Reviews.Title: “The worst service I have ever encountered.”
Reviews.Author: Molly S
Reviews.Content: I had booked my entire business trip two months in advance through a third party website at their hotel for four nights. A few weeks following I had modified my reservation to add one more persons name to it. I was told that the website faxed the hotel with the modification and Embassy Suites cancelled the entire thing two days before the conference. Terrible service, absolutely awful front desk assistance and service, no attempt to find additional space despite offering to pay more and booked directly with their hotel, no apology.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great value”
Reviews.Author: Stevie C
Reviews.Content: We pre registered because we arrived in Chicago before our check in time. The lady at the front desk told us to go ahead and enjoy the free breakfast! The made to order omlettes were fantastic, and the selection was phenomenal. The lobby was gorgeous! I loved the fountains and foliage. There were plenty of elevators for the large crowd of stylists there for America's Beauty Show. Our room was spacious and clean, and I can't imagine having a bad view! All staff were extremely polite and welcoming. If I come back to Chicago, I will definitely consider coming back here!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with a great view!”
Reviews.Author: CandidOpinions
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites are our choice for the breakfast, room size and evening reception. All those reasons were factors in choosing this hotel in general. Specific to this location is the wonderful view of Lake Michigan and the convenient location to downtown and the Magnificent Mile. In addition, the staff was welcoming and gracious from reception to the bartender. The hotel is one block off of the main transit lines, but a comfortable walk to them or to Millennium Park (just across the river). I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location. No service.”
Reviews.Author: j889814672
Reviews.Content: Nice facility, nice location, good rooms, good breakfast, nice small gym with new precor equipment. The only problem is no service. Long lines at reception and often only one staff working.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: kktooth
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice hotel for the most part. But we found bed bugs in our room. Management did come to our room and confirm that we did have bed bugs. They did comp our rooms, but what a hassle do deal with everything after the fact.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Wonderful staff, Sauna!”
Reviews.Author: Heretorest
Reviews.Content: I checked in for a few days away from school hoping to relax and spend too much time in the jacuzzi. I didn't realize it was President's Day weekend and there were so many children, I thought it would end my R&R. It didn't since my room was tucked off in a corner away from traffic. There is plenty of space, an amazing view from the 14th floor, and the hotel is conviently located for short walks to a variety of restaurants, a regular grocery store and the AMC right next door has a bowling alley. The evening reception was probably great but I was too lazy to get down there. Nice selectin on the shelf, though. The staff is beyond nice- like southern people nice, and I felt quite at home. Dinah Adibu- Guest Service Agen, made the weekend more personal through her genuine concern for my need for quiet to get in a little reading and a lot of sleeping. Thanks to her gentle encouragement, I accomplished both.

Reviews.Title: “Really good location a few quirks”
Reviews.Author: scott s
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here the last three nights had two rooms. A great location. Two blocks from Michigan ave. walked to water tower with teenagers in less than ten minutes. Rooms were clean and spacious. Decor in living room brown ans drab but fine. Bedrooms nicer. Hotel staff was very nice Breakfast decent. First day Monday a mob scene other days empty Did not like being charged 75 dollars to keep one room until five. I know they had plenty of rooms available and I am a Hilton person. Seemed chintzy Otherwise good stay especially for families

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: Amdls
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for our family of four. Plenty of room to spread out and give our teenage son (17) a little more privacy. The room was clean, a standard hotel room, no complaints. This hotel is situated a few blocks from Michigan Avenue in one direction, and the Navy Pier in the other. Easy walking to the famous Michigan Avenue shopping and many great restaurants. The pool area was smaller than expected, and quite crowded. Our daughter (a not-picky 11 year old) finally just got out because there were so many people in such a small pool. But the hotel cannot control that, it's just something to be prepared for if you book here. The breakfast is great, plenty of variety. The lobby seems well kept, plenty of seating for breakfast. I did not take advantage of the evening free reception snacks, as they did not offer any sweets. I would have appreciated cookies or brownies. But then again, I have a terrible sweet tooth, so maybe that's just me! Parking is pricey, $43 a night for self park. Worth it though, not to have to try mess with finding a cheaper garage. We parked underground and were able to walk right in to the lobby. Considering that the huge cooked to order breakfast is included, and that you have Michigan Avenue practically at your fingertips, this is a great value for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jason S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean, welcoming and had spacious rooms. The staff was very helpful and the housekeeping staff were even welcoming and greeted us. Dihanna (not sure if correct spelling) was very nice and had awesome character! She remembered us at check out from the night before also. The cook to order breakfast was very good. Great location just a few blocks from Michigan Ave. Will defiantly stay here again! We have been to Chicago overnight for the last 4 years and this is the best hotel yet!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, VERY clean, perfect getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Lynchfamily05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a 3 day Valentine getaway! The suite was very clean and spacious. The staff was pleasant and gave us recommendations for dinner and clubs. The Managers Reception in the evening had a nice selection of free drinks and munchies. The cook to order breakfast was extremely nice. We used the workout facility and found it to be very clean as well. We are already talking about when we can return to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Nice Location, Lots to Eat”
Reviews.Author: reflection6
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for five nights and was pleasantly surprised each day by how helpful and friendly the staff was. The front desk staff was awesome. Clementine was a superstar â€“ friendly and engaging. In my online reservation I requested a high floor and a corner room. My request was honored. I have stayed in both a corner room and a normal room. It is true that the corner room was very quiet. Request it if you are a light sleeper or want total quiet. I was not bothered by noise in the normal room, but I was on the top floor so that might have been the reason. The rooms are a bit smaller than other Embassy Suites were I have stayed in the past. I stayed by myself so it wasnâ€™t an issue. Breakfast looked very tasty â€“ bacon, sausage, pancakes, scrambled eggs, made to order omelets, potatoes, biscuits, oatmeal, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal and pastries. It was hard to resist all the options and stick to my healthy new yearâ€™s resolutions, but I had lots of fresh pineapple and cantaloupe. Unfortunately, there was not fresh cut fruit on the weekend â€“ only oranges. I did notice long lines for the made to order items. The managerâ€™s reception was great too. There was an open bar serving wine, beer, sangria, mixed drinks and non alcoholic options. Again too bad I was not drinking alcohol, but I had several club sodas with lime ï�Š. On busy nights there is a long line, had to wait about 10 minutes. There were also snacks â€“ salsa, hummus, olives, snack mixes, and nuts. No line for the food. Another great amenity was the three computers in the lobby with free printing. If you are looking to feed yourself there is a grocery store (Dominickâ€™s) right across the street and a Trader Joeâ€™s within walking distance. For shopping and dining Michigan Avenue is about two blocks away. I took public transportation to and from Oâ€™Hare. The bus stops are less than a block from the hotel and connect right to the train. Super easy to get yourself to the hotel for less than 3 bucks. Two complaints. The heat in my room was not very powerful. Maid service was slow. One night they did not get to my room until after 6pm. The maid service carts were in the hallways for most of the day. And it took awhile for the cleaning staff to pick up dirty dishes from the hallway. Overall, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is the best!”
Reviews.Author: Wendy S
Reviews.Content: This property is in a great location and is maintained very well. We were checked in by a very friendly associated named Dinah who upgraded us to a corner king suite overlooking both the lake and the city. She was only topped by our housekeeper, Monique. This hotel was crawling with unsupervised children and apparently their rooms revealed this as well as they were being trashed. Monique was so impressed that we kept our room orderly that she brought us a thank you note with some refreshments. She made our day! This type of personal touch by staff will definitely get us to return to this property, despite the excessive amount of unattended children.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: 365travelNYC
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small, but the staff are friendly and helpful. Everyone from the front desk to the cooking staff at breakfast were GENUINELY friendly. Breakfast quality was better than most Embassy's I have encountered with wide selection and high quality ingredients. Heater was quiet which is a huge plus for me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Popovova
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel after a long flight and slog from O'Hare, only to realize that I was at the wrong Embassy Suites. Clementine at the front desk could not have been nicer. She called the other hotel, confirmed my reservation, and offered me directions. I asked if it would be possible to change my reservation to this hotel. She indicated that only double beds were available, but she could change the reservation. Two minutes later, I had my room key, confirmed at the same rate as my other reservation, and the cancellation number written on a separate piece of paper for my records. Well done! I have stayed at this hotel previously and found it very modern and above the typical ES standard. My room was clean, though a repair on the ceiling above the shower was shoddily done. TVs were modern, bed comfortable, and overall vibe modern. Despite my later check in and last minute reservation, a knock on the door shortly after check in gave me my HH Diamond amenities of water and snacks. Breakfast the next morning was a notch above typical ES. What set it apart was the outstanding service and very friendly welcome from the ladies who were clearing tables. Nice touch. I'll be happy to return to this hotel in the future, and will insure that I get my reservation correct!

Reviews.Title: “No problems with Embassy Suites Downtown Lakefront.”
Reviews.Author: Debradale
Reviews.Content: After reading so many negative reviews, I almost changed our hotel reservation. Our stay was fine. Our room was next to a corner room. The room was clean and a nice size. We did hear some emergency vehicles at night, but probably because it's not far from a hospital. We did not encounter any noise from other rooms or the hallways and the hotel was at capacity. We did not attend the evening reception or the breakfast so cannot comment on that. The refrigerator was only cool, not cold. Parking is expensive at the hotel and the surrounding area. Overall, our stay was positive.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites not the best”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: I brought my family to Chicago for a gynmnastics meet my son was participating in. The Embassy Suites was one of the hotels selected for gymnists to stay in. I reserved room 738 and 739 and the lay out of the rooms was great. But in 738 when we tried to get hot water in the shower it took over 10 minutes to get warm and a couple more to actually get hot. This happened both in the evening as well as in the morning. The next item was the pull out sofas the mattreses were absolutely horrible. i don'e expect a pull out sofa to have a premium mattress but these were the worst i have ever slept on. The last issue was the heat vents. We could here a couple fighting and yelling through the heat vents as if they were right in our room. This went on from about 10:30 pm to 11:30 pm. Then at 3:00 am in the morning the same woman who was fighting earlier started talking on a cell phone and did this until 4:30 am keeping me from sleeping. It was not a good experince for us this trip.

Reviews.Title: “The Happy Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Jan D
Reviews.Content: Was impressed by this hotel. Did not expect a managers cocktail hour, this was truly enjoyed. Was totally surprised by the breakfast in the morning unlike most hotels that serve donuts, cereal, toast, juice and sometimes fruit and/or yogurt. This was a breakfast buffet plus a complete cook to order area. The food was darn good, as good or better than any other breakfast restaurant that I have eaten at in Chicago. Check-in went smooth and Melissa was great with questions that we had. We were able to check-in earlier that we had expected. The room was clean and neat. The king size bed was comfortable. The pool and hot but area was nice and relaxing. The exercise room was a convenient spot to work of stress. Really enjoyed the stay and definitely stay there next we come to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jnsmith1007
Reviews.Content: This is the fifth year I've been staying at this Embassy and it never disappoints! It is so refreshing to see staff that has stayed on board with the hotel and greeted with a smile each and every time. The happy hour was good and even though there was a line the bartenders made sure that everyone got their drinks quickly. Breakfast is fantastic and the omelet station is wonderful to have. I don't eat omelets but they will still make me a couple of over easy eggs cooked to perfection! Location is great and is within a few blocks of the Red Line subway so getting to the hotel super easy.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to usual service and standards of Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: TheNorsk
Reviews.Content: I had booked a corner suite (non-smoking) online months earlier, as I had to be in Chicago for a conference. Check-in and am surprised to hear I am placed in smoking room. Ask for non-smoking room, but was told none available. Found that odd, as it was early in the afternoon. SInce I had work to complete before late afternoon appointments, I took the smoking room. When I walked in the room, I was shocked at the condition of the room. It looked as if a brawl had raged in the suite: hole in bathroom door, cigarette burn on toilet seat, long burn marks on living room area carpet, scuffed-up furniture, and stains on couch. Moreover, there was extensive mildew/mold in the corners of the shower/tub. No bureau/drawers in bedroom, but there was a bureau in the living room. Was quite surprised by the run-down condition of the room. Later, I found the refrigerator had not been cleaned either. Bed was fine, and HVAC controls worked. I tipped the maid well each day and received decent maid service. As others have noted, the made-to-order breakfast line took a very long time, even at the weekday opening time. I skipped the line on the weekend mornings, as I had 8:00 AM appointments a few blocks away. I worked late in my room two nights, and made the mistake of ordering room service one night. Thirty-five dollars for a pizza that was perhaps the worst representation of Chicago deep dish I have ever encountered. Skipped the evening receptions as I had no interest in waiting in line for a bowl of bar snacks and a glass of juice. One final warning: Asked for a cab when I checked out as I had an early morning flight. No cabs in sight, and finally had to settle for a livery cab parked outside hotel. Cost to O'Hare was nearly $30 more than a cab. Will definitely not stay at this property when I return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Julie P
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Embassy Suites in Nov. 2011, I was there for a conference and pleasure. It was a very nice hotel and I had a great view of the lake. It was family friendly, had a very nice breakfast every morning, had free happy hour in the evening, Room was extremly clean. You have to pay an additional $15.00 per day for wifi, I thought this was a ridiclous charge seeing as how much I was paying to stay the hotel it should have just been included. I did enjoy the hotel staff, they were all very polite and friendly. One staff member arranged for our limo rides. Another staff member, named Shirley Bailey, whom was working in the breakfast area on the days I saw her, was extra helpful and friendly. She had a huge smile that was great to see in the earlier hours in the morning, she was eager to help, and was always happy. I made sure to tell management about her before I left because she truly made my stay at the hotel much nicer. I would reccommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Mari_brazil
Reviews.Content: Be careful.. you may stay in a smoking room even if you have booked 2 rooms in the hotel for more than a month ago. Terrible experience and the inconvenience of having to change rooms. Will never come back.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Danimals
Reviews.Content: Spent the New Years eve day/night/overnight at the Embassy Suites Lakefront Chicago. Used room service twice and they were quick and awesome w/their service especially as the hotel was packed that night. Check in was pretty quick too as the line was not too long and moved nicely. It was a fun experience to have new years eve at the hotel as the revelers were quite in the mood at midnight and the hotel staff/security were mostly okay w/the revelers having some fun. I think everyone came out of their room at some point to celebrate and those in the lobby were vicitims of extra toilet rolls being thrown from the upper floors (all in good spirit though)... After about an hour, security started to make the rounds and I was glad. Enough revelery by this time. Breakfast was the usual stuff at Embassy's the next morning and everything went well. Like this place and will come back as it's proximity to Navy Pier and Michigan Ave. are perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of LONG lines and below average customer service”
Reviews.Author: sk1996
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Embassy Suites Lakefront in Chicago. The location is good, but overall, I wasnâ€™t impressed, starting with check in. I had to go through 3 different rooms before I had one that was satisfactory. 4th time is a charm I guess. The first smelled bad, second was an accessible room and the third was stuffed in the corner and about Â¾ the size of the other rooms. Finally I ended up in a room with 2 beds (even though I wanted a king). The bed gave me a backache and sank in the middle. The linesâ€¦I just couldnâ€™t believe it. Iâ€™ve never seen lines like this at any hotel (well okayâ€¦maybe Disney during prime season but nowhere else). The made to order line took 1 hour to get through (not exaggeratingâ€¦there is a clock right next to the line). Unfortunately, I was dumb enough to stand in it, not realizing how slow it would be. Makes sense itâ€™s so slow with only one person cooking. The drink line at the evening reception took about 15 to 20 minutes to get through and they are VERY strict about getting one drink at a time. Makes for a less than enjoyable time waiting so long for one drink. They are free, but I think Iâ€™d rather pay to avoid the long lines (not an option). They never did deliver the waters they promised. Also, the walls are VERY thin. The lady next door wouldnâ€™t stop coughing and the kids on the other side were very loud too. The maid service was barely passableâ€¦she didnâ€™t even put the cover back on the bed. It was on the floor when I got back. Breakfast trays next door were not picked up until 8pm that eveningâ€¦they sat outside the neighborâ€™s room all day. Even though Iâ€™m a Diamond member, this clearly didnâ€™t have any impact. When I called to talk to the manager the morning of checkout, the operator couldnâ€™t even put me through because there was only 1 front desk person, a long line in the lobby and someone else on hold (thatâ€™s what she told me). This is probably a decent choice for families who are okay with an adequate hotel, but definitely wouldn't recommend for couples or business travelers. The Wit on State and Lake and Hilton Garden Inn at Grand are both way better choices. Great customer service at those hotels with nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago hotel located near major attractions.”
Reviews.Author: MrVacation31
Reviews.Content: Traveling with family or on a business trip, you cannot go wrong with this hotel. It is super clean and the staff is very friendly. The hotel is near great attractions such as Navy Pier, the lakefront, Michigan Avenue. The hotel offers many options for breakfast which includes an omlette bar served to your liking. The manager's reception offers top shelf liquors and some snacks to tide you over until dinner. Most Embassy Suites offer these amenities. The pool is a good size enough to swim a couple of laps or for the kids to jump in and out from. The adjacent whirlpool is very relaxing after a long day's worth of shopping or hiking. All together, I would return to this hotel in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “No such thing as a free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: drdig
Reviews.Content: This is a tough review to write. Firstly I want to say the staff was great - they are very very hard working, very nice and very sincere. They are also woefully understaffed. So for instance there was no concierge for the 4 days over the Christmas holidays were we there. The location is great, the rooms are solid, all include a living room (hence the suite in the Embassy Suites) and relatively clean. The deal they gave us was unbelievable - roughly $103/night for 4 including breakfast. So why the poor grade. Firstly the walls are paper thin and for the first two nights our "neighbors" were really loud late at night. The first night the beleaguered management dealt with them by sending someone up. The second night (it was a different family next door) they management did not really deal with it. Two bad nights sleep was too much. We did change rooms to a quiet "corner" room - these are much better. Now as for breakfast. Well the deal was such a great one the entire hotel was filled with families. So BF was jammed - it consisted of industrially produced scrambled eggs, pancakes, diced spuds, and turkey bacon - it was okay but really just sustenance not a meal. If you got to breakfast after 9:00 am (and we did) there were long lines, lots of jostling families, and kids of all ages swirling around. So yes, they include breakfast - but it was really not all that tasty or relaxing. BF was also served next to the pool area and the entire lobby area was suffused with the smell of chlorine - again, you get what you pay for. Would I go back - sadly no, next time I will go to a place where I am ensured a quiet night's sleep and buy my own BF.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain, but staff struggled to keep up with the crowds”
Reviews.Author: Yankeeinexile
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days over Christmas. There were many positives. The room was comfortable and quiet, though not as well outfitted as the nearby Homewood Suites. The hotel's location enabled us to walk to the sites we wanted to visit. The price was amazingly inexpensive. People at the desk were friendly. There is a made-to-order breakfast, which is far better than the steam table eggs of most hotels. However, the staff and infrastructure really struggled to keep up with number of guests. One day I stood in line for an hour before I could order breakfast. Another day I waited 45 minutes. (The other days we didn't bother trying.) There were even lines for the steam table breakfast. And we had to wait to find a place to sit after we got our food. One day our room was never cleaned; there were long waits for elevators. I don't think we would return when the hotel is at peak capacity. (Last year, we stayed at the Homewood Suites over Christmas. It was a little more expensive, but it didn't have the same logistic problems.) The price we found on TripAdvisor was a great bargain, so many guests would be willing to put up with the delays and crowding.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls, no sleep. Stay away.”
Reviews.Author: Bbbrooklyn
Reviews.Content: This place seemed like a good value and the room was in decent shape, but the walls are so thin that you can hear everything from the room next door and even the restaurant area. We moved rooms because the neighbors were so loud, but we found the same problem even after we moved to a new room. Being from NYC, I can deal with noise, but this was absurd. I would avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel is OK for families”
Reviews.Author: ashley97
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, about 3 blocks off the southern end of Michigan Avenue. It is hard to find, and hard to see at first....if you are driving, you pull into the building off Illinois Street, before the AMC theaters and Lucky Strike bowling. You can leave your car for 15 minutes while you register, and the staff will bring your bags up for you. Parking is $42 a night so we parked elsewhere. The hotel is fine...we were upgraded to a corner suite and if you can get one, you should. Not only was it quieter (more on that later) but we did not have the window to the constantly-lit atrium. This was important for putting kids to bed. Corner suites are much larger in the living room as well. The walls are paper thin in this hotel....we could hear our neighbor talking on the phone, clearly, and could hear both TV and talking through the vents, not sure where it came from. Beds are comfy, shower head is weak pressure-wise, and the hairdryer was on it's last legs. But the furniture and carpet were clean and in good condition, and towels were very plentiful. The fitness room is ridiculously small....3 treadmills, 2 ellipticals and a bike. Got crazy crowded between 7 and 8 am, but that was NOTHING compared to the crazyness at breakfast after 8:15 or so. Long lines for food, no tables to be had, the staff did their best to keep up but it was nearly impossible for them to do so. We ate before 8:15 one morning and it was a completely different experience. Manager's reception was also very crowded, with a very long line for a drink...you don't have to wait in line for lemon water and the snacks (trail mix and chips/salsa). Every staff member we met was very friendly, helpful and went out of their way to say hello and ask if they could help. I just wish we didn't hear random people through our vents and that there was more capacity in the gym and breakfast area. If you have at&t, you can get onto the internet for free in your room, just log in with your at&t account number and password.

Reviews.Title: “Decent home, decent breakfast....not great service”
Reviews.Author: G G
Reviews.Content: I was recently at the Embassy Suites near Navy Pier. It is a good location to enjoy everything the city has to offer. The breakfast was decent, considering it is free. Check in was fine. Valet is polite. The Concierge Doris was rather short and seemed to not want to be bothered. A little bit of an attitude. Clean room. Pretty lobby.

Reviews.Title: “trade show pricing”
Reviews.Author: tt153
Reviews.Content: I stayed there from 11/25 until the 30th. It was business for me, the RSNA. Rooms were ok as was the food at breakfast. the buffet is ok, over cooked bacon and eggs, I would wait on the line for the fresh cooked food. It is in a good location but if you are going for a family city vacation unless you get a great price I would stay at the doubletree down the block. It is not worth 200 a night. I paid 300 a night. Way Way over priced, but that was the trade show pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Internet outrageous price”
Reviews.Author: Rothmann
Reviews.Content: I paid for a one bed room Suite $ 300 per night andthey charged me $ 10 internet per day, but nobody told me its going to be$ 10 per night per device, I was with laptopf and iPhone, so I paid $ 20 per day, i stayed 7 nights, comfortable hotel, great location, some nights were very noisyas children were running around the corridors.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful vacation in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: lidia g
Reviews.Content: Our famiy of four spent a wonderful 3 nights at this hotel. Since the minute I called the hotel to let them know that we we were arriving a a bit earlier (Justin answer the phone) until the time we departed, we felt very welcome at this hotel. When we arrived, Ms. Dinah Adibu greeted us with a wonderful smile that made us feel welcome. When we told her that it was our first time in Chicago, she assigned us a room with a wonderful view. My family enjoyed watching the sunrise from the huge windows. The room was very clean and comfortable and my kids enjoyed the fact that they had access to their own space and TV in the suite. The breakfast was delicious and plentiful with a great variety of fresh fruits and healthy choices. Again, the wonderful and very friendly staff took care of every detail. Starting from the cooks to the people who cleaned our table. The Manager's Special was a time for my our family to go to the lobby and enjoy the cheerful atmosphere and tasty drinks and snacks. We are back home in Austin, Tx. We feel well rested and ready to start work again. However, we are planning our next visit to Chicago and we will certainly go back to this wonderful hotel. Thank you to all your staff for making our vacation very special and for making us feel very welcome. Lidia and family

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location and stays are very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tammyu
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a number of times and remain impressed with the staff and service. Although the breakfast line can be long the wait isn't long, the manager's reception is fantastic after a long day of meetings, shopping or sightseeing! The rooms are spacious and comfortable. I will return again and again!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with a few problems”
Reviews.Author: lobster4me
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference in Chicago. Pros: Great breakfast buffet. Managers reception is very nice too. Beds were comfortable. Elevators are fast. Cons: Housekeeping needs improvement. Asked the lady if she would clean our room next. She said yes. So I left for a short while. When I came back our room was not done. So I found the lady once again just one room down from ours. I asked her if she would clean ours next which she replied yes she would. I left again for a few hours. When I came back our room was not cleaned. So I waited a few hours thinking she just got busy and forgot. At about 3pm I went down to the front desk. I told them about housekeeping. They sent someone up to clean it. 45 minutes later the room was cleaned. Make sure to check your receipt before you leave. We received someone elses receipt. Along with a bill for internet charged to our CC. Internet was included in our stay. Had we not checked that they would have charged our cc. I wonder how many people do not check their receipts and get billed for things they thought were included in their stay. Heard sirens all day long.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with awesome rooms”
Reviews.Author: Teamhoffmann
Reviews.Content: We spent the recent weekend at the hotel with my family. The room was at a great price point and a very good value compared to other area hotels. The hotel looks to be in very good condition and the rooms were spacious and well appointed. We parked below the hotel in a clean and secure ramp. It cost about $40 for 24 hours so it was expensive, but typical for the area. The manager's reception was just starting and we were able to enjoy a couple of drinks before going out for dinner. It was crazy busy, but the bartenders moved the line along very quickly. Our room was on the 15th floor and had a beautiful view of the city. You can pay more to get a view of the lake, but I was pleased with the view of the Chicago river and interesting architecture. The room was large enough for five us to share. The breakfast in the morning was good. The lines were crazy long, but we slept in until a 9:15 so it was at peak time. We did not wait to get the food cooked to order. I was fine with the available items (scrambled eggs, pancakes, baked goods, fresh fruit, yogurt, etc.) Other family members waited in line for an omelet. It was delicious but it took a long time. I thought the breakfast alone saved us at least $50 if we ate in a diner. The hotel is very convenient to Michigan Ave. if you are willing to walk a couple blocks and the same for Navy Pier. We enjoy going out for dinner and don't mind a short walk to build up our appetite. Overall, we enjoyed the hotel and thought the staff was very friendly and professional. We had a problem with our bill at checkout and it was handled quickly and efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location for families in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Nabil K
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel over the period October 26-31. The location is ideal, walking to Michigan Avenue and the lakefront. Excellent facilities: spacious 2-room suites, superb breakfast, free drinks in the evening, internet connection (free in the business center), friendly staff, courteous doormen; in brief excellent for families and even individuals. Good value for money. I recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Danna-Tx
Reviews.Content: My 75 year old mother and I took my daughter to Chicago for her 18th birthday and we stayed at the ESH-Lakefront. Perfect location! Taxi rides to most places were $6 Navy pier 1-1/2 blocks away to the east Michigan Avenue 2 blocks to the west Grocery store across street w/deli, soup bar and wine/beer Walgreens around corner Hop On-Hop Off trolley #7 stop across street 1 block north of Chicago River Breakfast cook-to-order and buffet (get there early though) Complimentary computers in lobby with printers to use (free) - $15 per day if you use your own Wonderful views especially from the elevator Bar in lounge/lobby area with large seating area Sleeps 6 comfortably (separate bedroom) Nice neighborhood 2 closets/plenty of drawer space for families The sofa bed had not been changed from last stay (we assumed), but the staff was accommodating and changed it. The front desk and staff at breakfast were friendly and helpful. Our flight didn't leave until 8:30 pm and we were able to leave our luggage there to finish our adventure in the city. The valets and bellhops were extremely nice and helpful. From O'Hara airport, take the Blue eL to Lake/Clark terminal, take a taxi ($5.00) to the hotel. The train ride takes about 30-40 minutes and cost $2.25 each. We want to come back and this will be our choice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Griff K
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after experiencing the shock of my husband having his wallet stolen while we were on the subway from the airport to the hotel. The male concierge was most unhelpful, but Melissa Hinds at the front desk came to our rescue - found the phone number of the police so that we could report the theft and arranged for us to use the computers immediately so that we could report the loss of our credit cards. She even took off the charges for the 800 numbers that we used from our room. Thank you again Melissa - your friendly smile and assistance convinced us that Chicago is the friendly city! The hotel is very clean and comfortable, well situated for most attractions and within walking distance of Michigan avenue. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “horrible room on a busy weekend”
Reviews.Author: jaclr
Reviews.Content: No cheery welcome at check in. I requested room close to elevator because of walking difficulty, received room furthest from elevator. Breakfast cold. Wireless internet extremely poor, couldn't use in bedroom, in living area usually just 1 or 2 bars, frequent disconnect. Wrote my name in dust on tv cabinet in bedroom. First time ever where we rec'd partial bottles of toiletries, odd way to control costs, went out and bought our own. Hole in bathroom door out of place for a "nice" hotel. Relaxing in the tub I noticed the absolute worst, dried urine on the base of the toilet! I understand this was a very busy weekend but there is no excuse for the condition of this room. If they don't have adequate staff to maintain a room they shouldn't sell it. This is the first time we have ever had a complaint at a Hilton brand hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: makeham98
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just north of the river near the NBC Tower, very walkable to attractions and shopping. Having Dominick's Grocery Store (Safeway) across the street is a luxury. Rooms were clean and comfortable, although furniture could use some modernizing. Manager's Reception included free drinks... and trail mix. Drinks were served by very courteous staff. Breakfast was crowded but good quality, just don't plan on getting a hot breakfast without a few minutes' time. Only four elevators but i never had to wait. I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend”
Reviews.Author: ckekb03
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Good location near Navy Pier. Nice manager's reception in evening. Crowed breakfast w/ long lines after 9:00.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheAgeofAquarius
Reviews.Content: Guess what? If you want to feel like Donald Draper, in a good way, this is a good hotel to stay at. In other words, the rooms are large, and the whole place is very majestic. Lots of glass and steel, fountains, things like that. In addition, there is an attached restaurant, and the fitness room is my favorite in Chicago. Finally, it features free cocktails in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Themoy69
Reviews.Content: Went to Chicago for Columbus day Weekend. Hotel was in prime location right in down town Chicago. Room was good size. also manged to catch the Chicago Marathon as it passed right by the hotel. All in all a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average Across The Board...& Very Dissappointed!”
Reviews.Author: kgray30265
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip ever to the "Windy City". We were in Chicago for a business convention and I booked this room months prior to our arrival. We are HHonors members and only stay at Hilton properties, thus the reservation at this hotel. The conference we were attending was held one block up the street at the Sheraton, however, with the close proximity, and being loyal to Hilton, we opted to walk every day to the Sheraton. Upon arrival, we checked in, and were given an upgrade from a King suite to a Corner king suite...nice gesture we thought for our loyalty. Wish now that we had declined the upgrade and taken the regular suite. We were on the 8th floor and the corner rooms are very secluded and down a short hall way, if that is what you are looking for. We did not want to seem ungrateful for the upgrade, so we decided to stay in room 825. Mistake!!! When we got into the room, the window was propped open, and maintenance did come and correct the problem. The first night we were there, the coffee maker , which is not programmable, just came on by itself, and started to brew. I called downstairs, maintenance went into the room next door, brought another coffee maker. You would think, prior to bringing a replacement, the employee would make sure it was clean and free of nasty left over coffee, but NO. But it didn't matter, because housekeeping for some odd reason never replenished our coffee, sugars anyway. The remote control to the living area TV did not operate at all, and maintenance said they fixed it, but the same night, we had the same issues. Anytime we wanted to change a channel or the volume, we had to manually do it on the tv. Maintenance man did state to me that they had just made the switch to HD TV and they had been having nothing but problems. So, if being able to watch tv is important to you, this could be a problem. WORST of all, the temperature handle on the shower was faulty and would not stay where you set the handle for hot/cold temperature. After I was SCALDED with extremely hot water when I took my first shower, maintenance came up, and said he fixed the problem....however, the next morning, the same thing happened to my husband. I told him maintenance had been in and corrected the problem, so my husband took my word. This could be very dangerous with a small child, and I am so thankful that it was not my 3 year old daughter who was scalded with hot water. THERE WAS NO CONCIERGE available, even though the hotels website states otherwise. The front desk was below par in recommendations for entertainment, dining, transportation....Needless to say, I truly feel like a good chunk of our trip was spending time with the maintenance man, as well as being our own concierge. So much time wasted on our trip for unneccessary things. Asked for a one hour late check out on departure day, and was told the "hotels occupancy level could not allow for such." Never experienced this with any brand of Hilton before, as its usually granted. So, when we got downstairs to the ground level, the bellman was too busy on his phone and never acknowledged us, so, we hailed our own cab. On the positive, breakfast was great....Miss Shirley really knows how to please her guests and is by far, the most pleasant employee at this establishment. Evening reception....drinks are good, lines are long(which is not a problem), but not the normal eats for Embassy suites..chips, nuts, salsa. No hot food, not even pasta. and The SAME EVERY NIGHT...it never changed in the 3 nights we stayed. The business center is poorly stocked, no stapler, paper clips, etc for the true business traveler in need....I have stayed in Hampton Inns and Homewood Suites, which have FAR exceeded this property and were $200 less per night. I addressed all of these issues with the front desk agent upon my departure. She didn't really seem concerned with me or the issues we experienced, and my husband would have never said a word no matter how unhappy he was, so I spoke up. We are going back to Chicago at the end of November, and I seriously doubt we will be staying at this hotel, despite its good location for us. Once I get back in the groove of things at home, I plan on calling Hilton Headquarters to voice my concerns, if I do not hear from the manager of this hotel first. I know the price of the room is fair for Chicago, but we could have received a discount at the Sheraton with our group, and I must say, we spent a good deal of time at the Sheraton, and it is a BEAUTIFUL hotel, with a concierge on staff, and the employees over there are fabulous....seemed as though they aimed to please. Just sorry that we did not stay there. Our bill for 3 nights at the Embassy Suites was close to $1200.00....Very dissappointed all the way around. Feel as though we could have had less maintenance issues, a dedicated concierge agent to help us with things we wanted to see in Chicago, and not been burnt by hot water while showering....Below Par for me....not what I had expected in any form...I strongly believe in giving fair and honest reviews, and give credit where credit is due(see my other reviews), but this was not good for us...Based on service, room rates should be a half to a third of what we paid....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location and View, but otherwise...eh.....”
Reviews.Author: HiggySTL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our kids during the holidays (Dec'10) for easy access to Michigan Ave for shopping. It is within easy walking distance to just about everything (we wlked everywhere, even in the Chicago winter!). The parking here is bad, it cost about $40 to park at the hotel otherwise there are not many other options. To unload the vehicle apon check in is a real hassle as well, they only have a little underground service entrance to unload and drop off your vehicle, if you don't time it right you could be waiting in a long line in ther street. I think the lobby is on the 18th floor or something like that. Great for the views, but again a hassle to get to with luggage. This place was obviously book up and it showed during the evening social and the breakfast. Very crowded and a mess to navigate to get anything. i've stayed at other properties that were booked solid and the otehr did a much better job accomidating the crowds unlike this place. Room was typical, but the view we had was amazing. On neat thing about this hotel is the glass elevator is located on the exterior, so as your going up you not only see the interior atrium, but you also get a full view of the city. So if your worried about hieghts close your eyes!!! (we were on the 44th floor!).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Shahzad C
Reviews.Content: This was my second vacation to Chicago (1st Week of Sept 2011) and after lots of research and advice we chose to stay in Embassy suites Lakefront, Downtown.This is an excellent hotel to stay in Chicago. The suite was big enough to accommodate a decent family size (we were 4) with even High school grade children. The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of downtown and is literally steps from all the places to visit like Navy Pier, Magnificent Mile, Water tower, River cruises, restaurants, top shopping malls theaters and lot more. The area is family friendly and you can wonder around even in the late evening hours with family. The breakfast buffet package was fabulous and it had huge variety to select from and every thing to interest even the most selective eaters. The staff at the breakfast was very polite, professional and helpful. The room was clean and had two flat panel TV's so that children can watch there stuff in there room and you have your own screen to enjoy. Surprisingly the room was big enough to have a small kitchenette, dinning table set, study, sofa bed and an extra vanity to help a family with early morning washroom rush. The house keeping staff was excellent and the room was cleaned and done nicely each evening when we returned back from all day tour. The room was very quite and no downtown noise even though it was on 7th floor and facing street and river. I will strongly recommend this hotel to everyone and you will not be disappointed with the price, quality, food and the luxury of the suite. For us this was worth every penny. I must mention that I like to travel frequently with family a few times every year and always stay in downtown of mega cities. This was "Excellent experience" and will always look for Embassy suites in future. Congratulations to Management and staff, keep it up. S Choudry

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: 6ofusOhio
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in this hotel a year ago and had an identical type room. Hotel is modern, clean, and comfortable. Breakfast in the morning--very nice and has a variety of grab-and-go food items as well as made-to-order eggs. Lots of seating even though it was very busy. Had good service at check-in and all employees we saw and had interaction with were accommodating. We like this hotel especially for it's location, right in the heart of everything. Our only negative was that there was a used band-aid stuck to the inside of our room door that was not ours!

Reviews.Title: “Standard Embassy suites, good stay”
Reviews.Author: nycfussy
Reviews.Content: pretty standard embassy suites, rooms fine, staff very helpful and accomodating. They had trouble finding us a room with a king size bed, finally did a day later. Tried, which was nice. Good location, expensive parking, but downtown and easy to get car. Location is good for getting in and out of the city. quiet. Breakfast had different hash browns than most embassy suites, not as good/yummy. It is good for business and family stays.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel to stay in Chicago downtown...”
Reviews.Author: g b
Reviews.Content: Very well designed, very nicely located hotel.. The staff was very well trained.. The only problem was during the reception hours there was a huge line to get the drinks and they were offering very basic snacks- not suitable for a low-carb fan.. Also the enterance of the hotel was a little hard to find while driving-very small sign... But they had a nice breakfast and a nice location..

Reviews.Title: “Business Travel Only”
Reviews.Author: Wolfgang V
Reviews.Content: Aside from the Italian bartender down on the ground floor who makes great drinks.. the rooms, the jail-like way they cram everybody in, the big desks and office like environment.. this place is all business. The coffee is fresh and you can get a good nights sleep before your next flight or meeting. You can work late - plug in and turn your room into your own office. In the morning you may get run over by luggage rollers from yuppies who take their job too serious - romping down the corridors in their high heels - not wanting to be late for another boring trade expo - or seminar. There was nothing really warm about my stay. Completely standard.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Beautiful property, Breakfast not so hot....”
Reviews.Author: GadgetMedic
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a very nice property. I am a Hilton HHONORS member and stay in many Hilton properties, so I am comparing to other Hilton family hotels. The Good: Convenient location, great movie theater next door, Walgreens on the corner, grocery store and Starbucks right across the street. There was a nice restaurant in the building, but I can't review that, as I didn't use it. Nice easy walk to Navy Pier. The lobby of this hotel is spacious and very beautiful. Waterfall in the center, lobby bar and breakfast area all nice. Like other Embassy Suites they have made the lobby bright, sunny and inviting. My room was very nice, king with a sofa bed, flat screen TV's and spacious bathroom. The room was decorated nicely, and VERY clean. All of the staff were wonderful, especially the Valet and bell staff. All of them went out of their way to make me feel like a valued guest, and they were very polite. The Bad: Again, typical of Chicago, parking price is outrageous, $50 per night to valet... if you don't have to drive and park there, that would be beneficial to your wallet. Room was $249, but that's expected. The Ugly: If you make me pick one bad thing, it was the breakfast. Yes, it's "Free" but WAY too crowded, unorganized, and to accommodate everyone they had extra tables set up everywhere. The food, average at best as far as the buffet line. If you make it through the custom hot breakfast line, that was much better, the omeletâ€™s were very good, the chef's and other staff, again, VERY nice. :) Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, very convenient and accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: mrtimmy1122
Reviews.Content: I took a school group here for a few nights on a field trip in Chicago. Great value for the price. Location was perfect for touristy things and walking distance to all sorts of things on Michigan Ave. Breakfast was amazing and the interior is maybe a little dated but still nice. The rooms are fairly basic but looked like the furnishing were fairly new. Great views in every one of our 10 rooms. The pool was too small and too chlorinated but that was the only downside to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay... and Shirley was AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: shep831
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice and clean, and all of the staff courteous and helpful... but at breakfast (there's an AMAZING complimentary breakfast buffet), we were greeted by an Embassy Suites employee named Shirley. Shirley greeted us with a gentle smile, a warm welcome and quick guidance on the different nuances of the breakfast buffet layout. She was a ray of sunshine to start the day for us! After we had gotten our food, we were able to watch Shirley greet EVERY patron with the same warm smile and helpful guidance on how to navigate the buffet. Some folks were hesitant to accept the guidance.. and walked right past her - not allowing her to share her warmth. Those folks missed out on a little bit of sunshine. Thanks so much for your example today, Shirley! You are the epitome of Ephesians 6:7: "Serve wholeheartedly, as if you were serving the Lord, not people" - Matt and Cindy Shepherd, Peoria, Illinois.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay, will return!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa_KY
Reviews.Content: BREAKFAST: The breakfast buffet was amazing, self serve hot line (eggs, bacon) and made to order omelets. 3-4 different types of donuts / pastries. Fruit was typically bananas, oranges, and cantalope or watermelon. Pancakes with syrup or blueberries also available. Cereal, yogurt, and granola also available. Very impressed with food quality and selection for a free included breakfast. ROOM: Living area of suite very spacious. Rooms have microwave and fridge. Bed very comfortable, pillows were the only negative - but they were pretty standard for hotels these days - down pillows that are very soft/squishy where your head sinks into the pillow. SERVICE: Guest Check In: Great job, also provided a free surprise dessert / treat in our room upon arrival for my husband's birthday. Concierge - Not available after 5pm. :-( We did not get much help regarding touristy attraction info - which seems like an everyday concierge request. We actually stopped in another hotel and received the help we needed. OVERALL - Despite negative/opportunities listed we would definitely stay here again. The rooms were quiet and clean, bed very comfortable, breakfast was excellent and this was about 2 blocks north of the canal and 3 blocks west of Navy Pier. Great hotel & convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room but Scary Trip to Get There!”
Reviews.Author: pbroviak
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Labor Day weekend while visiting Chicago. The hotel was easy to find and the staff were very helpful and the room was clean and great. But the trip from the elevators to the room was scary because we were on the 17th floor and there was only a glass, waist-high wall separating us from plunging at least 12 floors down. I realize this is the design of Embassy Suites to have the rooms on the perimeter of an atrium and have stayed at them before without having a problem. So I'm not sure if it was the glass or what, but this one made all of us uncomfortable to walk along the hall. Probably also particularly scary because of having children with us. Other than the walkway, the only other complaint I heard from my family was that the breakfast food was cold. As for the amenities - the pool and hot tub were ok but small. They also were of an older design and probably could use upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: knoxvillenick
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Great location. Easy access to lakefront and Michigan Ave - Breakfast. Great, free, hot breakfast. Had custom omelette and pancakes every morning. We didn't have any problem with lines, although we do tend to get an early start. - Price. Good price. We got the parking package - Indoor pool. Kids enjoyed it. Cons: - When we arrived in our room, there was a hole in the door between the living area and sleeping area. Not too nice. On arrival I told both the bellhop and another employee to please note the damage so we wouldn't be billed. It would have been nice for them at that point to offer a different room. Didn't happen. Worse, though, is that upon arriving at home we received a bill for $75 for room damage!! It took multiple phone calls and quite a bit of time and hassle to rectify. Frustrating since 1) normally we don't like staying in a room with holes in the doors and 2) we told two people to note the damage so we wouldn't be billed and we still got billed. - Concierge. The single most pretentious, unhelpful, and condescending concierge I have ever met. I have stayed at some of the nicest hotels in the world, including in Chicago (Drake, Peninsula, Trump). The concierge at the Embassy Suites in Chicago, of all places, was incredibly rude and unhelpful. - Bellhop. On checking out I needed assistance with my luggage. I was alone with two very small children which makes it very hard to deal with luggage and kids at the same time. I called multiple times for the bellhop on checkout. Waited almost 30 minutes. Never arrived. Overall a good hotel for the price. Needs some work in the service department.

Reviews.Title: “My choice each year”
Reviews.Author: HOSKI
Reviews.Content: I go to Chicago once a year for business and always select this hotel when it is one of the choices offered. The free breakfast is really nice and the rooms are so big and clean. It is so open and the staff are very friendly. My biggest complaint about this hotel is that they charge so much for internet. In this day and age it is a shock to me that they charge so much. $3.95 per hour or $14.95 for 24 hours plus taxes I stayed in room 829 this time which is a smoking room with 2 double beds. My deadbolt didn't work but the other locks did and I did not feel unsafe. The furniture was in good shape and there were flat screen tvs in the bedroom and livingroom. They have a very poor selection of channels to watch but have movies starting at $4.99. They have a few at that price and the rest are $10.99 to $16.99. I would have rented one for $4.99 but the only one at that price that interested me I had already seen. This room had a great view which I have never had at this hotel before. I could see the lake and it was very relaxing. The room has a coffee maker, fridge and microwave for your use. They also supply glasses and glass cups. I prefer paper cups but it is what it is. They did have cardboard cup surrounds with the coffee maker so it looks like they should have had paper cups. Housekeeping was not good about filling the coffee station so I'm not sure what should have been there. After I used the tea bags I never received any more. The room also has an iron, ironing board and hairdryer. The iron and ironing board are in the hall closet. There was tons of storage and lights and lots of seating. What is nice if traveling with someone else is that there is a door between the livingroom and bedroom. There are lots of electrical outlets to plug things in which I greatly appreciate. A nice big desk/table with a work chair and 2 other chairs. Also I nice couch and chair in the livingroom. The kitchenette sink dripped the whole time and was annoying. I could here my neighbors when in the livingroom but not in the bedroom so it wasn't that bad. They provide bar soap, shampoo, conditioner and lotion. I was surprised that housekeeping threw away my open soap the first morning and replaced it with a new one. I'm used to them leaving it since it is barely used and leaving a new one in case you need it. It seemed like such a waste to me. I did stop at the evening reception Sunday night and got some snacks but opted not to have a drink. There was a line but it moved quickly. Monday I enjoyed a breakfast around 7 am and it was not busy. I didn't opt for the cooked to order but went with the buffet. The food on the buffet was not hot. Don't know if that was a one time thing or if it is always not kept hot. It bothered me to see that not many people left a tip for the staff. They were great and kept everything cleaned and all the food filled. One thing that bothered me was that they used styrofoam cups instead of paper. Later I noticed that it got really busy for breakfast but it was moving pretty fast. Tuesday morning and I did the made to order omlet. The cook was great when I asked for a little omlet. Usually cooks still make it huge and I can't eat it all but he honored my request. The coffee was good I enjoyed the food. The problem on Tuesday was the lipstick on my juice glass when I wasn't wearing any. Overall the staff was great including an early check-in. The gift shop staff varied greatly with the Sunday evening staff being so nice and the Monday morning lady being snooty and didn't even look at you when talking to you. The elevators went down one day for awhile while I was away from the hotel at meetings. They were fixed quickly. The internet went out at the same time and later that night we lost the tv for a few minutes but everything was quickly fixed. There is a free business center one level down from the lobby. If the printers are not working they wil print for you at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “wow, lovely place”
Reviews.Author: leiceterboy
Reviews.Content: After having a succession of hit or miss hotel experiences in Chicago that left me somewhat disappointed this one really came up trumps. As i was travelling with a family I needed space and suites always seem the best option. We had a great room on the top floor. The beauty of these suites is that the bedroom is on the back with the living room on the front divided by a door. So you really can put the kids to sleep and have some alone time watching tv or movies. Lovely clean rooms with nice fresh (cotton!) sheets. Great location not far from Navy Pier (kids museum is good for young children) and close enough to the Magnificent Mile to be able to walk everywhere. Breakfast was amazing and every night between 5.30 and 7.30 they gave out free drinks at the bar. The only downside to both of these things is that they get incredibly busy (i do wonder how many savvy people just come in off the street for this as they never ask for your card). Only negatives were Wi Fi is not free (although the business centre has free internet use) and no safes in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great for sightseeing, excellent value for a group of 4”
Reviews.Author: UckfieldSue
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights, (2 mothers and daughters). Perfect set up with a bedroom with 2 double beds and a lounge with a bed settee. Fridge and microwave. Buffet breakfast included, convenient and made it even better value even though the quality of the food is not great. Would definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Lollapalooza for Everyone!”
Reviews.Author: AccidentalGlobetrttr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Embassy Suites from 8/4-8/11. The hotel is always a pleasant stay, with extremely helpful bellmen and desk staff. The rooms are the standard generously-sized suites you are familiar with. On weekends, this hotel is taken over by families. The free breakfast in the morning is a madhouse. While the staff does the best they can, the sheer numbers and appetites overwhelm. It's your call, but we usually ate out. There's an excellent restaurant, Yolk, a mere block away, and the food is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Conference location”
Reviews.Author: bermudalovers
Reviews.Content: This hotel was location for conference I attended. Brought wife and girls along. 2 double beds and pull out sofa. Beds small for 2 adults and a valley in both beds. Complained to maid. Sofa bed a bonus as kids could watch movies/TV and wife and I could have a bed of our own. Nice to have mini fridge and extra sinks in room and daily USA today. Free breakfast daily was great! Also free drinks and snacks from 530 to 730pm daily. Long lines as you can imagine. Pool small but nice and gym was nice as well although unused in this family. $49 day for valet parking seems excessive but not being a business traveller I'm sure it's on par with most major cities. My first time to Chi-town and I loved it. Great pizza and Greek town was nice. Museums and Aquarium and Willis Tower were awesome. Went to the beach and a water taxi tour and Navy Pier. Did not use public trans nor did we have time to go to Millenium Park. Could have used another few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & space”
Reviews.Author: FlamingoChuck
Reviews.Content: Hotels is clean and spacious and the location is fabulous for Navy Pier & Michigan Ave. Prices are very reasonable considering you get a free breakfast & evening reception (plan to wait in line for both, but hey - it's free). That said, the hotel does seem to be under-staffed. We stayed 5 nights & saw more than one person working at the front desk only once, which made for frustrated people checking into rooms. Bell staff down in the alley (hotel main entrance) always seemed otherwise occupied - we never trusted leaving our luggage with them and usually used the side door of the hotel to avoid all the cigarette smoke. Hint - PJ Clarke's (restaurant within same building as hotel with good food & late hours) has free wifi - Embassy charges $15 per day for spotty wifi. Winter prices make this a great deal. Summer prices, not as much...

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JasminedogLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Our family of four thoroughly enjoyed our 4 night stay at this Embassy Suites Chicago Lakefront. I recommend this hotel for its competitive rates (given each room is larger than the average downtown Chicago hotel room), the complimentary full breakfast, the central downtown location and the friendly staff (from the ground floor bellman to the lobby concierge and front desk staff). This hotel is situated midway between the higher priced hotels in the North Michigan Avenue area (about 2 blocks away) and the Navy Pier (about 4 blocks away). We caught the Orange Line Metro from Midway Airport and then transferred onto the Red Line Metro (exiting at the Grand Station stop which is an easy 7 block walk away from the hotel). The Embassy Suites is part of the block-wide River East Center which includes a huge AMC multiplex cinema, the cool Lucky Strike Lanes bowling alley, a Bally's Fitness and a ground floor Walgreens. The surrounding area of the hotel is a beehive of activity with plenty of tourists heading towards Navy Pier, residents who live in the surrounding high rise apartments and condos and workers from the surrounding office towers. Across the street is a huge Dominick's Supermarket stocked not only with groceries but excellent prepared-foods counters. A few blocks north or west you will find an interesting range of eclectic restaurants and the high end shops of North Michigan Avenue. Our double double suite was fine for the four of us. The suite was nicely decorated and the furniture was adequate and functional, not luxurious but certainly consistent with the Embassy Suites brand. There were minor deferred maintenance issues that the housekeeping staff of the hotel needed to address that included dusting of the lamp shades in our suite, cleaning of the dirty stairwells, and better maintenance of the two sets of coin operated washers and dryers. However the visible public areas of the hotel were maintained nicely and our requests for additional blankets, shampoo and soap were promptly delivered. The daily complimentary breakfasts were consistent to the Embassy Suites brand and the wait times after 8:30 AM were rather long as other posters have noted. The selection was good and consisted of scrambled wet eggs, sausage and bacon, potatoes, pancakes, fresh fruit, 3 selections of cereal, yogurt, breads, donuts and pastries. The same items were also available in the cooked to order omelet line as well. Staff did a great job of clearing dirty dishes from the large number of tables and extra tables were set up each day to accommodate the crowd. We used the fitness room daily, but it was very small and limited with a rack of free weights, three treadmills, one recumbent bike and a couple elliptical. The indoor lap pool was short and narrow. Both seemed like an afterthought and we wished the hotel arranged for complimentary fitness passes to a nearby health club like the Bally's. Other than the deferred maintenance issues behind the scenes, I thought that the Embassy Suites was a beautiful hotel in a good downtown hotel. The hotel staff that I encountered treated us with respect and a desire to please. As long as the rate was fair, we would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to pier. Good for families.”
Reviews.Author: Gompala
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Would recommend to others. Pretty close to the shopping mile and the pier. Extremely pleasant staff all around. If I had one issue the pool is almost so tiny you may laugh. Good place for families.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again, not for people with acrophobia.”
Reviews.Author: avodemas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in July on a work-related trip. The hotel is centrally located minutes from the lakefront, Navy Pier, downtown attractions, the Magnificent Mile shops, etc. I arrived on a Monday afternoon by an airport shuttle bus, which dropped me off at the main entrance, which is surprisingly located in the back of the hotel. The reception is located on the third floor (you have to take elevators to get there). The hotel lobby was nice and bright and very open (from reception floor all the way to the top). It was very noisy, however, as there were a great number of people waiting in line at the bar for the daily manager's reception. The registration process was quick and painless. My room was on the 13th floor, and set in a little corridor off the main balcony facing the open lobby. This was great two-fold: 1) no noise and 2) better for someone who is afraid of heights. The reason I mention acrophobia is because almost all of the rooms face the open lobby, separated only by a walkway and a plexiglass barrier (low). I was getting vertigo every time I had to walk to and from my room to the elevator. Although I didn't visit with my child, as a parent, I Would have been concerned about the kids safety as they could easily lean over the banister and plunge 10+ stories down. The suite was nice and clean. The living room had a wardrobe closet with a flatscreen tv, a sofa bed, coffee table, an armchair and a table/desk with 2 chairs. There is a little wet bar/kitchenette area in the hallway separating the living room from the bedroom with a sink, coffeemaker, mini fridge and a microwave. Opposite the kitchenette is a bathroom with standard features. The Bedroom was nice and had a TV armoir with yet another sink. I found myself not really using the living room as I was staying there alone, but it would have been great for entertaining or hanging out with family if more people were sharing a suite. There is a window with shutters facing the hallway and I did have some privacy concerns as they are not completely impermeable to light. The daily breakfast in the lobby was nice. Average selection and it does get crowded if you sleep in as all of the families with loud hungry kids flood the lobby before heading out for their daily adventures. But if you're there before 7:30AM, it's fine. The swimming pool is really small and if you get at least 1 kid in there, it becomes impossible to swim in. There is also a whirlpool that gets filled with kids as well. Did I say it was a family friendly hotel? There is also a sauna, which seemed to be the only kid-free place in the pool area. Having given up on swimming in the hotel, I ended up walking over to the lake beach, which is only a 5 min walk from the hotel. Hotel reception staff were very friendly and gave us pointers about dining options and local attractions. Now about the business facilities. The 2nd floor of the hotel is a conference center with large ballrooms and smaller rooms for breakout sessions. The facilities were nice, but one MAJOR complaint I have is the internet. There is no WiFi signal in the business area and I was disappointed that after paying $15 for WiFi, I could not use it most of the day while attending meetings on the 2nd floor. The signal in the rooms was a little stronger, but the connection was very slow. Overall, if you are visiting with a family and want to have a central location to all of the attractions, this is a great hotel! The free breakfast is nice, there is a restaurant on the first floor and a supermarket across the street. Daily manager's reception is also nice with free drinks and snacks. It is a noisy hotel, so if you want a quiet retreat, it may not be for you. Also, if you are afraid of heights like me, you may have a difficult time adjusting to the open lobby concept.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Minor downsides”
Reviews.Author: LoupMom
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. The rooms were clean, all the staff were friendly and helpful. I must say, the lines for both breakfast and manager's reception were about 10 minutes or longer, but the bartenders were moving quickly while still very nice. They had as many stations as possible for the food and coffee at breakfast. I also used the fitness room and it was better than most hotels, but got hot with six of us in there and though all treadmills worked, mine had an issue with the speed control. I would stay here again, the location is tough to beat. We did eat breakfast out once at the top rated Yolk restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: MajorJJ
Reviews.Content: After some of the reviews here on this forum I was nervous what our stay at the Embassy Suites Lakefront would bring. Three of us where in town for the Lollapalooza event at Grant Park so we wanted a hotel was we could walk from. We flew in early into Chicago and wanted to swing by the hotel just to drop off our bags and make our way on to Lollapalooza. To my surprise our room was ready for us at 10:50am. Being a Diamond HH member they let me check in early (way early). Everything was fine with our room, very big room for being right in the middle of downtown. We had a slight issue with the coffee maker and tub draining, but I continue to give this hotel 5 stars as I reported issue and 15 minutes later we had a brand new coffee maker and the engineer (Ron I believe, nicest guy!) was fixing the tub. We had no problems at breakfast (8:30ish each day) and only did the managers reception once. The lines move quick for both and the food/drinks where pretty good. The hotel tries very hard at breakfast setting up additional tables and two additional buffet lines for those not wanting to do the â€œcook to orderâ€�. Our walk to Grant Park was about a mile but it was fine and nice to see the city at night. The day we left we took a towncar from the hotel back to airport, it cost a bit extra at $45 but sooo much more comfortable then a taxi. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: SheraBella
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at this property. The reason I choose this hotel is the extra amenties, such as the cooked to order breakfast and manager's reception every night. The rooms are nice, which a small fridge and microwave. Sometimes the rates at this property can pretty high. We booked a different hotel because we found the Marriott on Michigan Ave at $120 LESS a night. I just happened to check the rates again, and found one at $199. My only issue was checking our bags. We got to the property very early, and of course our room wasn't ready. We were told to bring our bags back downstairs to the bell man who would hold them in a secure location. Well, we waited for about 10 minutes along with several racks of other luggage until the bell man even showed up. I didn't feel comfortable leaving my luggage unattended, but luckily it arrived safely to the room. I would definately stay at this location again if the rates are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “We left after the first night....”
Reviews.Author: vanGoghsCat
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel a month ago, when we arrived they did not have the room I reserved four weeks ago. Hotel was so busy and loud....Loyola University had booked most of the rooms for interviewing purposes and it seemed they had priority over us. Our new room had one bed and the couch for my son. Carpet had black duct tape on each threshold. Icky.....and the carpet was so gross. I would not walk on it without flip flops.... The pull out bed in the couch had disgusting stains on the mattress.....I did not want my son sleeping on that bed. I sat up most of the night on the computer to book another hotel for in the morning. We paid $405.00 a night there and I called the Ritz Carlton( at 1:00 am) and booked a room for the morning. I got a room at the Ritz Carlton. Discounted($600.00 instead of $1000.00) by the Ritz because we told them we were transferring from another hotel. The Ritz Carlton was incredible! I have stayed at Embassy Suites before and have been pleased with the service and hotel. Embassy Suites in Hot Springs and Little Rock were great. Chicago not so much...remember, you do get what you pay for in Chicago. It's a lovely city but it's expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - prime location”
Reviews.Author: Zell
Reviews.Content: Recently reserved 2 suites using Hilton Honors points. Called in advance to make sure son's name on one suite so he & family could check in prior to our arrival. Check-in was smooth for both suites which were next to each other. Typical arrangement for Embassy Suites.... 2 rooms... one with sofa, chairs, desk, chairs and small wet bar with refrigerator and the other room with bed(s)... with bathroom being in shortl hallway dividing both rooms. Rooms arranged around center atrium. Overall hotel atmosphere - very bright, clean, modern decor. There are 4 glass enclosed elevators to access suites from the main lobby. Of note, is that the lobby entrance is NOT on the street level. Street Elevator lobby, & valet parking attendants are on 1st floor (Self-parking - $41.00 daily but with NO in&out; Valet parking $49 daily... with in& out privileges). Valet service may take up to 20 minutes to get car... so call from the room & plan accordingly. Breakfast buffet is very good, although lines are long if one goes down in the last hour. Suggestion... go early like at 7:30 or 8 a.m. Omelet station is run well, with one person taking orders and putting out the various ingredients for the chef to add to the omelets. Chef is amazing at the speed in which he makes omelets... fun to watch. Can also get pancakes, biscuits with gravey, hash browns and pancakes in this line.There is also a buffet line for eggs, bacon, etc on steam table. Assorted pastries, yogurt, cereals, and fruit... although fruit could have been expanded. During the week days, the fruit was sliced melons and pineapple. On weekend, fruit was limited to whole oranges and bananas but no pre-sliced melons.
