On the weekend the hotel was filled with families instead of business people... perhaps that made a difference in what was put out. There is a very large seating area and the tables were quickly cleaned with hotel staff. Suites had 2 flat screen TVs plus sofa, & 3 chairs in living room, one of which was a very comfortable ergonomic chair. Our son's suite did not have an ergonomic chair. There was also a very large ottoman suitable for seating. Directly across the street from the hotel is a large market - Dominick's that also has a Starbucks. Domick's is open until at least midnight and some nights until 1 a.m. In addition to the normal food supplies, one can purchase bus passes at Dominicks... we highly recommend... it's so easy to jump on and off a bus to Navy Pier... the buses are air conditioned, the free trolley is NOT! It's also an easy walk to Michigan Avenue where many buses can be picked up going to and from the Museum Campus and up and down the Magnificent Mile shopping district. Many of the Chicago taxi's are NOT air conditioned. Be careful in flagging down a cab that has windows rolled down! Some cabs are hybrids and drivers actually USE their AC. When we asked valet attendant about getting us a cab to the airport, he suggested we consider a town car as it would be more comfortable with only a slightly higher cost. We opted for this and he immediately called a town car and we paid a flat rate of $45. plus the tip. This is our 2nd stay at this hotel and we'll definitely return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked and I would never stay here agian”
Reviews.Author: MDHKLR04
Reviews.Content: I am an HHonors Diamond member and I would never stay here agian. The sevice and staff were rude and overworked given the capacity over this weekend. I was over billed and I had to find the error as they could not. I was very disappointed in the entire stay. I would really vaod this place on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service, but too crowded”
Reviews.Author: kleikm
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. The rooms were clean, but the bathroom was a little outdated. Also, the lines are huge for the manager's reception and breakfast. I don't know what the hotel could due about that considering the size, but the lines for both were about a 1/2 hour long. I would stay here again, though. We are lunch in the hotel and it was very good. The people who work here are very, very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: bluedaisy1984
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend in April. The hotel itself was very clean as well as our room. We had a great view of the city. We also enjoyed the breakfast buffet, although the lines can get very long at the omelet station. The manager's reception was a great perk as well!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel very clean but busy free Breakfast and managers reception”
Reviews.Author: onetravelgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with kids over spring break. Really nice clean comfy rooms and beds. Sleeper was okay Wonderful views of downtown buildings like the Tribune from our room. Used the pool and sauna small pool like 3 lap lanes, but great sauna. The breakfast was very busy and it was a long wait for the made to order food. Separate lines for self serve which helped. Entire lobby area was packed and it's a big area! That said they never ran out of food and staff cleared tables quickly. Good food when you found a place to sit. Maybe not as busy at a different time of year Valet parking was fast yet expensive like other hotels in area. This is a beautiful clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would happily stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Sunflower082111
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with a group of friends. The hotel was clean and well kept. Everyone was friendly and helpful. We could tell that the staff enjoy their jobs and work. The breakfast is the best I've ever seen. They serve a FREE made to order omelette bar as well as a hot bar (bacon, eggs, toast, biscuits, fruit, cereal, yogurt, juice, etc....). The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance of public transportation and attractions. The only downside (as with all hotels IN Chicago) is the cost of parking a car. There is a parking garage underneath the hotel, but the cost of parking in Chicago is outrageous!

Reviews.Title: “The entire experience was great.”
Reviews.Author: bcerliano
Reviews.Content: Phillip was a great bellman, friendly and helpful at each encounter during the 8 day stay. Duane went out of his way to get my insulin to me on the way out - I appreciated that. All staff spoke, which was new to me, and were always friendly and helpful. Breakfast crew went out of their way to open a little early each day when our group of over 100 needed food before our very early meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Too big for providing good service”
Reviews.Author: SEA556
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Gold Honors member and stayed at here because of the location though I could have stayed at one of my favorite Marriott Renaissance hotels for a slightly lower price. First I must comment on the Management. I called three times in the 4 days before arriving at the hotel and left 3 messages with 2 different managers to request something that required a simple YES or NO answer. I never received a call back or an email response from either managers. I then thought that perhaps they simply took care of it and I will see at check in but I was wrong. I found it very disturbing that I received no response despite my Gold Status. Next while the hotel is in a great location and the rooms as usual are very nice the hotel is so big it is almost impossible to get breakfast or attend the evening reception without waiting in long lines. The first day the breakfast line for the grill was so long we did not even bother. The second day I had to wait in line 15 minutes to place my order. The line for the prepared food was slightly better but still long and the prepared scambled eggs bin was often empty. The selection of fruit at the buffett was also poor compared to other locations. During heavy travel time be prepared to wait. The evening reception also had long lines for drinks. These long lines are not because the hotel is lacking in workers or don't care, they do care and there are plenty of workers, the hotel is just so big it cannot support the rush of people eating at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FlaTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for family vacation. Walking distance to Navy Pier, shopping and most other sites. Nice clean room with great service and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, beginning to age”
Reviews.Author: mot29
Reviews.Content: The ES Downtown-Lakefront, Chicago is a fine hotel in a great location, but it may be about ready for some renewal. My room was clean and neat, comfortable, but a few problems -- the wire soap dish in the shower was starting to sag and the bathroom door know was a bit loose. And the walls showed lots of scuff marks. But the checkin staff was great -- accomodati9ng me early and giving me a corner suite with a slightly larger living room and a view of the river meeting the lake. I skipped the happy hour because the line for free drinks was long and the chips didn't quite cut it. Breakfast was good, staff helpful, room clean, and bed comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: beachluverColumbus
Reviews.Content: Awesome location. Within walking distance to popluar restaurants, shopping, Navy Pier, etc. Buy tickets for the double decker bus tour at hotel and save $, turn left out the door, go straight across the street and hop on the bus and start your tour. For Michigan Ave shops, cross the street to your right and go up the steps and you are at the start of Michigan Ave shops. For Navy Pier, go out the building to your left, go around building and walk straight and you'll run into Navy Pier within 10 minutes walk. Everyone talks about lines for the food being so long. It's no different then going to a restaurant, waiting for a seat, waiting to order, and then wait for them to bring you food. In fact, I think it's quicker. I had two kids with me and they never complained. Food was good and constantly restocked. The staff was very friendly. The line for the cooked to order food did take a little bit longer. The manager's evening special of drinks and appetizers was ok. Lines were a little long but again, think about if you were at a restaurant waiting, and it is free. The snacks were chips and salsa and different nut mixes. The room was clean and nice. Our view looked towards the Willis (Sears) tower but couldn't see it. We could see some of the River. It wasn't spectacular but then again, I don't sit around the room and stare outside. The pullout bed took up most of the space in the other room so we just folded it up each morning. No big deal to pull it out every night. The wood slat blinds would have annoyed me if I had to sleep out there with the hall lights shining through all night. But my kids never complained. The pullout bed didn't feel that comfortable but was ok for a 9 and 6 year old.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: betshell
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for the NEA convention. The staff was very helpful, changing their breakfast serving time to accommodate our Texas caucus. The only thing that was even a little disturbing was the price of parking (which did not agree with what they had posted in their in-room information) and was very high in comparison to parking around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were disappointing, pool small and crowded, great location.”
Reviews.Author: lstpaul
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value for the great location very close to the Navy Pier, but the hotel itself is just 'ok'. The view from our bedroom was fine on the 14th floor - but mainly just overlooked a couple of rooftop pools nearby, the bed was comfortable. Our room was a bit dirty - there was a dirty fork under our bed. The elevators were surprisingly fast considering the number of guests that were there. The rooms were very small, which was particularly uncomfortable in the living area since our two children slept on the sofa bed so it was pulled out most of the time. The mattress on the sofabed was old and thin - suitable only for young children - not great for ours ages 10 & 17. The window in the living area was just to the hallway (which seemed odd) and had wooden blinds that let in a lot of light - and there was a very bright hall light just outside the room so sleeping was very uncomfortable in that room. Housekeeping didn't come to our room until 6:00pm (and after we had called for new towels) - so we just had them leave towels and skip any other cleaning - so that was annoying. Parking is expensive at $42 for self park and you have to leave your car there, $49 for valet but then you can leave and come back. Wi-fi was $14.95 a day and then only worked on one laptop (we had three). The pool is very small for the number of guests so was mostly too crowded to use - but we did manage to find a short time to use it that wasn't bad. We never got the free cocktails as the lines were too long, but we did manage to get free breakfast and it was quite good - but again be prepared for lines. The front desk and concierge were ok, but not overly friendly. We weren't impressed with the restaurants that the concierge recommended. We will look for another hotel when we go back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price for the location!”
Reviews.Author: kstapper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week and loved the location of this hotel - near Navy Pier, shopping, subway, etc. The only negative was the lines for the manager's reception and the buffet breakfast - as seen on several other reviews. We never had to wait more than about 15 minutes for the ready-to-eat buffet, but the lines for the cooked-to-order were too long. As for the rooms - comfy beds, spacious, loved having the fridge and microwave. Showers were great! Towels were big and thick! The pool was a little small and very chlorinated, but fun after a day of walking for the kids. Overall, a great place to stay in Chi-Town!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, All you could expect”
Reviews.Author: hoosiertreker
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful. The valet called to ask if he could move a bag to my trunk to make my car less of a target. I thought this was thoughtful both because he thought to move it and because he asked first. The desk staff went out of her way to find me a view of the lake and the city. The Navy Pier fireworks were outside of my room. I'm sure that was partially luck. There were a ton of families there on summer vacation. They looked to be enjoying the hotel too. The rooms were a little smaller that other Embassy Suites, but Iâ€™ll attribute that to the urban setting. The glass atrium was impressive. I do warn my fellow height and elevator phobics that the ride to my floor was a doozie. It was high speed, all glass, high-rise elevator. A gorgeous view of the city if you can keep your eyes open.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent-all aspects!”
Reviews.Author: jdisadore
Reviews.Content: The Texas Delegation to the National Education Association Representative Assembly used this hotel as our base. The hotel started breakfast service early to accommodate us as we had 7am caucus meetings. Every single employee was cordial, and extremely helpful. We were greeted as we entered the breakfast area, the valet service was exceptional, nothing was too much trouble, all areas including rooms were cleaned to a high standard. I am planning a family vacation next year and will certainly be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences I've ever had--bar none!"”
Reviews.Author: smalldaddy
Reviews.Content: This staff, Steve, Diliah, Terry, Jamie; the food manager, the bartenders, food preparation staff, everyone, everyone, everyone and all of the others whose names I can't remember were the most accommodating and pleasant people that i've ever dealt with in a hotel. No is not in their vocabulary. The early morning breakfast was superb as was the happy hour with unliminted drinks and snacks. We will always request this hotel when in Chicago. It this is an indicator of how other Embassy Suites operate, then I'm seeking them out. Not having to hustle breakfast and getting nutritious well prepared food was fabulous. The rooms are very clean, modern, comfortable, and relaxing. This whole atmosphere was esceptions. Please give this hotel 5 stars!!!! For service and convenience nothing has beaten them in my 63 years of world travel..

Reviews.Title: “An Embassy unlike the others”
Reviews.Author: NebraskaTraveler_11
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in many Embassy Suite Hotels throughout our travels and came across one that was a little different than the others. This one is thoroughly modernistic in appearance and atmosphere. While I missed the greenery the other Embassy's usually sport, the service and amenities are still great. Traditional Embassy Breakfast and Managerâ€™s reception are very well attended, so plan accordingly. The views in this particular Embassy are fantastic â€“ downtown Chicago as seen from the best. Itâ€™s located only a few blocks from the Navy Pier and also from the River Walk area. A great place to stay with the family as a home base while you discover all of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Great Area!!”
Reviews.Author: lboogie41
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend just completed a three night stay at the Embassy suites Chicago/Lakefront.. Hotel was centrally located is the reason i picked this over several others in downtown area. Nice rooms, great lobby, very friendly staff.. I requested a high floor and ended up on the top floor which is the 17th.. Overall i was very pleased with my stay.. I just don't agree with the cost of daily WiFI..$14.95.. so $45.00 later.. I can see a Small fee but then again i've stayed at several other Hilton hotels that offer free WIFI.. That definetly needs to change and will be the main reason i don't choose this location again..Breakfast is always a plus but extra long lines, Managers reception (Nice) But Extra long lines. Staff very nice, No complaints at all.. kudos to Terry the Concierge..He is very energetic and always happy.. Also Great Restaurant connected to the hotel.. PJ's. Overall i think you will be pleased staying here.. Just note the WIFI isn't free and expect very long lines for the breafast and the managers reception.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Impressive.”
Reviews.Author: Bay5
Reviews.Content: If you want to impress someone, bring them to this Embassy Suites. The lobby, bar, and eating area is spacious, beautiful, clean, and breathtaking. The rooms are well-maintained and we love having extra sinks outside the big bathroom. You are in the heart of Chicago here and looking out any window is impressive! The elevators are fantastic!!! Swift and timely!! And the view of the lobby and the city while going up and down is worth the price of the room! Word of advice: be patient at breakfast and be patient with the busy conceirge.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family”
Reviews.Author: Nellie_traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days with kids ages 12 and 16. Easy walk to North Pier, Michigan Ave shopping and Millenium Park. Great set up for a family of four with a wonderful breakfast. Boys loved the pool and hot tube after a full day of walking and we loved the happy hour. Staff was always pleasant and very helpful. Would certainly recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “my experience”
Reviews.Author: kanejoseph34
Reviews.Content: everyone was great they make you feel like family especially neringa the lead mixologist she has a great personality very friendly ,I will definetly be staying there again.I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed and more”
Reviews.Author: sfman38
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during my first visit to Chicago. The location is great for sightseeing, as many other reviews describe. Our room also had a great view of the lake from the 14th floor (out of 17). The room was very spacious as you would expect from Embassy Suites. What really impressed me, though, was the nice decor, service, and attention to detail. Checkin was easy and pleasant as Dinah provided great service (she did solicit a TripAdvisor review, but I was already planning on writing one and she gave great service anyway). She was there every single morning during our 4-day stay! The breakfast buffet was excellent. There is a very large variety of choices as well as an omelet station. The manager's reception served free cocktails and snacks from 5:30-7:30. The snacks were good in amount but a healthier variety have been nice. Lots of salty snack varieties and only a bowl of raisins as an alternative. Overall, for all of this being FREE, it was very satisfying. The room itself is very nicely decorated. Clean, bright, and inviting, it was the nicest room I've had at an Embassy Suites. I must give major kudos to the housekeeping staff. Our room was serviced after the first night and the housekeeper observed that on my bed, I had removed the down pillows and used the one foam instead. She replaced the other two down pillows so I had all foam pillows - nice touch. Also, the next day we left the do not disturb sign on the door because we did not need service. We received a call and voicemail from housekeeping letting us know to notify them if we needed service or any extra items. Very personal gestures. The pool is a lap pool, which is nice. The jacuzzi is large, and there is also a dry sauna around the corner. The fitness room next door is well equipped. One odd note - we wanted to check our bags for a few hours at checkout time. The lobby is on the 5th floor and luggage check is on the first. I confirmed the location with the front desk and was told that bags are indeed stored on the first floor, but if we have a laptop we can keep it at the front desk. This made me wonder about the security of our bags on the first floor. Perhaps the front desk was just offering safety deposit box service, but I found it odd nonetheless, since it wasn't exactly convenient to store our laptop 5 floors from the rest of our bags. There are many, many nice hotels that have great locations in Chicago. A hotel really needs to be top notch or else there are plenty of other places for guests to stay. This hotel absolutely delivered on all levels. I would highly recommend staying here, for any occasion!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly front desk especially "Dinah Adibu"”
Reviews.Author: Uyanik
Reviews.Content: Very nice location, very helpful front desk , Dinah Adibu from front desk is an angle,Thanks a million.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: booyasgurl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a one night sight seeing trip to Chicago. Hotel was a little difficult to find if traveling on foot and once you get there the lobby is oddly located on the 2nd floor so also a tad difficult to find. Service was pleasant and room was clean and had a wonderful view. The mangers reception ended up being a disappointment compared to other Embassy suites I have stayed at since after standing in a very long line I got one extremely weak cocktail and some mediocre snacks. The breakfast line was also VERY long and the food quality was poor. I understand that these are "complementary" however when you consider the room price is over $250.00 I think the quality could be better.

Reviews.Title: “A Solid Hotel Choice in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DSullivan94
Reviews.Content: The main reason I chose to stay at the Embassy Suites Downtown Lakefront was because it was the most affordable option for larger families like mine because we wouldn't need to buy two rooms (at high downtown Chicago prices) to accommodate everybody. Additionally, you can't beat the complimentary breakfast and evening drinks that are offered daily [One piece of advice: if you are expecting to get an omelet cooked to order, wake up early because the line gets long quickly]. Also, the pool and fitness center make the Embassy Suites a good stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel for families with children. However, that being said, there are some things that you should be aware of. If you are staying as a family with more than 4 people, somebody will likely have to sleep on the dreaded pull-out sofa. Unfortunately, I had this wonderful privilege for two nights and did not like it at all. The window shades in the rooms aren't sufficient enough to block out the incredibly bright lights from the lobby, and the sofa has a typically uncomfortable spring mattress that is difficult to sleep on. If you are not staying as a family, be warned that this place is popular with families and can be somewhat noisy and crowded on weekends. Also, parking is outrageously expensive ($49 for valet in-and-out), so if possible, I would highly recommend getting around using "the L", Chicago's subway system (a 3-day pass only costs $14, and the Grand Red Line station is about 6 blocks from the hotel). In all, this hotel is definitely a solid choice for its great location near Navy Pier, Michigan Avenue, the Tribune Building, and the river. Additionally, the service here is top-notch and the entire place is well run by the check-in staff, concierge, bellhops, and even the guy who makes the omelets (he's amazing!).

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: passportisready
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the location and it included breakfast. We were on a parking package also. Hotel is located only 3 blocks from Navy pier and one black from Michigan Avenue. You are in the heart of the city here. The staff was very friendly and helpfu. We would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathy Keesler
Reviews.Content: We went on Memorial Day weekend and the hotel was PACKED so the breakfast buffet and cocktail hour were pretty impossible to get into but there was a great breakfast place around the corner called "Yolk". Great food! The suite was great and the view was pretty cool. It was very clean with lots of room. Because there were so many people at the hotel, a few days we ran out of hot water in the a.m. There was never a concierge but the front desk was helpful. The bellmen and guys downstairs were awesome and always smiling and pleasant -- they were helpful with directions and restaurant ideas. We were walking distance of most anything and down the street from the Navy Pier. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good value for price”
Reviews.Author: CLT-Homebase
Reviews.Content: As "suite hotels" go, this one is a bit older, however, it is well maintained. Their staff is professional and cordial, and they do a particularly good job with the breakfast that is included in the price of the room. If you have to be downtown Chicago, the location is convenient. I will return to this property the next time I have to be in town in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: crackdougall
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at a number of Embassy Suites, this was disappointing. The room was in serious need of repair. The service wasn't great; the valets, bell staff and breakfast staff were great, but the front desk staff gave the impression they didn't give a hoot about any issue we had. The managers reception was way too crowded and the line for beverages made the whole event pointless. The location is good, with public parking nearby for trucks that are too tall for the garage onsite (6'8"). Overall, it was a 3 star stay, but compared to the other ES we're used to, it fell short.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: PghJared
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Spring Break with 4 kids. Definitely a great hotel for families. The location was perfect within walking distance to the major attractions including Navy Pier, Millenium Park, Art Institute and Hancock Tower. The rooms were big and had good views of the city and lake. The employees were polite and very helpful. Everything was clean. I thought the free breakfast and free happy hour would be a good thing. But so did everyone else at the hotel. We actually skipped most of the free stuff because of the big lines. Not the hotels fault. But it felt like the lunch buffet line of a cruise ship just after you leave port on the first day. The pool was packed also. They parking was expensive ($40+ per day). But we expected that and the inexpensive suite and great location made up for it. No doubt we will stay here next time we're in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: pafuri
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites Lakefront are seriously one of those hotels you are so comfortable with that you know next time you will be back! Letâ€™s start at the beginning. Check-in was faultless; the room was great, right down to the choice of pillows. The managerâ€™s reception was crowded, but not too bad if you were really early, or alternatively arrived 20 minutes before it ended. Ditto for breakfast, this thinned out late, and had only a small omelette queue first thing. Elevators were lightning fast, and staff very accommodating. Negatives? Well, the room was made up very late- in fact we didnâ€™t bother to allow the staff access on the second day when they pitched up at 16h15 to make up the room! The only other negative was that there is a concierge desk, but it is never manned. I really donâ€™t believe they have one. The front desk staff cover for the concierge services, but really arenâ€™t qualified for giving opinions and making recommendations. Location is fantastic- a 20 minute walk to Navy Pier, and a couple of blocks to the Magnificent Mile, or 10 minutes to Millennium Park. There are a number of good restaurants in and around the hotel, plus a large convenience store and Starbucks across the road- very useful! Iâ€™ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Service Second to None”
Reviews.Author: dfrcpa
Reviews.Content: I received extraordinary service in response to my requests! When the Business Center internet was down, I was invited into the hotel office and set up at a work station to get all my work done. When I needed to extend my stay another day, my request was cheerfully met and confirmed while I was working at the workstation and new room access keys were given to me. Many thanks to Dinah Adibu, Guest Service Agent, who made this all possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: KaleneAndy
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights here around the Easter holiday and can thoroughly recommend it. Our suite was a decent size, with a separate lounge area to the bedroom, fridge and microwave, while lots of storage meant that we could properly unpack and settle in. Breakfast was excellent, though it was a good idea to make an early start, given the queues that formed later on. While the cook-to-order offering is the star attraction, there were lots of options available in the regular buffet, even if finding a clear table was sometimes a challenge. The pool was relatively small, and typically full of kids on the couple of times we tried it. Not so good for anyone wanting to do a few laps, but I guess it was a holiday weekend. We didnâ€™t make the Managerâ€™s Reception on any of the days, despite having thought that we would. However, the array of snacks and queues for the bar suggested that it was a pretty popular event. Transport options were good, with five or six buses running close by and Grand/Lake Red station a couple of blocks walk away. Dominicâ€™s Supermarket is right across the street, and Walgreens around the corner, so easy access for basics. It was just as well that we knew where we were going, and where to catch the bus etc., as the concierge was absent almost every time we walked past reception on the way to the lift. Internet access was too pricey at $16/day, but we were able to use the Business Centre on a day when the wi-fi wasnâ€™t working. Despite the large number of guests, the lifts seem to take mere seconds to arrive, and the soundtrack of the atrium was the chiming of the bell as the latest lift arrived. All up, a great option when staying in downtown Chicago, and a place weâ€™d happily return to.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay with wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: 1987GTA
Reviews.Content: Laura, and others, at the front desk were always cheery and helpful with every inquirey. Shirley was present every morning at the breakfast with a smile and an encouraging compliment to each of our family members....and the breakfasts prepared were exemplary. Dwayne, who worked as the doorman, greeted you with a smile, and made a point to know if he could help in any way. He provided us with directions to attractions and restaurant, and organized the transportation. All the staff went out of their way to provide you "service with a smile". The managers reception were also a highlight with our family. We look forward to visiting Chicago again, and we know where we will stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: iluvretirement415
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great stay at this Embassy Suites. Beautiful view of the lake and nicely appointed room. Good location and within walking distance to the Navy Pier. The breakfast is definitely worth getting up to eat. Staff was friendly, helpful and provided exceptional service from beginning to end. Melissa H. and Steve at the front desk, Shirley in the dining room, and Phillip in transportation/concierge were all fantastic and made our stay most enjoyable. The hotel looks a little sterile, however, and I would suggest they add some plants or something on each floor to break up the monotony when you look upstairs. Also would suggest free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Most pleasant staff, ever!”
Reviews.Author: doubleduces
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend in Chicago with friends. Arrived at the hotel at 9:30 AM to drop bags since check in wasn't until 4:00 PM. The woman at the front desk was very kind and friendly and said she has a room ready for us...the room was indeed ready with an incredible view of the lake!! Entire staff was pleasant, kind, friendly, couldn't do enough to make the stay as pleasant as possible. I'll never search for a different hotel in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “You'll never meet a more pleasant and responsive team.”
Reviews.Author: jblmevans
Reviews.Content: I spend approximately 125 nights per year on the road. While I am a strong Hilton supporter, and usually enjoy positive experiences at all of the Hilton hotels, I am particularly impressed with the level of service provided by this hotel's team. I frequently stay at this hotel while I am in Chicago. Without fail, every employee at this hotel is dedicated to providing a wonderful level of service. From the check-in process through the complimentary breakfast, the team makes your time away from home as pleasant and enjoyable as possible. While I have enjoyed all of the folks that I have come in contact with, I would like to note that Laura Bevington (sp?) was particularly helpful to me with a recent room request. I am sure that I will be able to note other individuals as I continue my stays at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Accommodations!!”
Reviews.Author: MaryAnn031
Reviews.Content: We love the Embassy Suites Chicago Lakefront. Laura B. and Melissa B. were very helpful and made our stay extra special. The evening reception was great, the kids loved the pool and the breakfast was outstanding. Our room was also lovely and we had wonderful views of the city and lake. We will tell all of our friends and it is the only place we will stay from now on when we visit Chicago a couple of times a year.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: AlnSC
Reviews.Content: Room was what I expected for Embassy Suites. Housekeeping was good, always cleaned the room and left fresh towels. Breakfast was good although the line got longer unless you went early. Manager's reception had a long line. Needed more bartenders. My only complaint was checking in. The room was not ready. They said they would call my cell when it was, but never did. After an hour and a half I stood in the long line again and it was ready. Others had the same problem or worse they were given a not so clean room. It was taken care of with apologies. Check in is at 4 but your room might not be ready.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break and Everyone, I mean, EVERYone came”
Reviews.Author: ann_in_nyc
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in several reviews, the hotel was very full and the breakfast and cocktail hours were a bit of a scene. I would heartily recommend this hotel to families for the indoor pool and free breakfast, but I would be a little dismayed if I turned up here, traveling without kids. It's full of them--school trips, family trips. That said, it's a short walk to the Loop and the Magnificent Mile and the El. The staff, especially Dinah at the front desk, were pleasant (even with all those people!) and calm. We initially booked a corner room, because it had more square-footage, but the bedroom only had a king-sized bed, so my husband and I had to sleep on the double sleep sofa. I'm too spoiled for a sleep sofa, so we switched to a room with two double beds and all slept better.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we stayed at in a long time”
Reviews.Author: TSP1973
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Embassy suites 2 different occasions. Staff is excellent, very courteous and kind. Excellent and clean rooms, very comfortable. Very nice swimming pool and jacuzzi, how ever the water fountain and lights to the Jacuzzi are never working, but other than that, very nice! The free breakfast buffet is one of the best out of all the Embassy suites I have stayed at. Very good food and excellent service. The free cocktails from 5-7pm are very nice also!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: skyhawk352
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Embassy Suites Chicago Lakefront for 1-night on April 26th 2011. Overall was a good stay. Arrived around 3pm with no line for checking in. Front desk agent explained all of the amenities of the hotel. Although there are only 4 elevators, they was always one readily available. One of the previous reviews commented on how the elevator system was confusing. For me, I felt reassured by the separation of the elevators. When you enter the hotel on the street level you can go up to either the ballrooms or the main lobby level. In order to access any other part of the hotel, you have to pass by the front desk. Gives you a little more peace of mind knowing that people probably won't meander by if they don't belong. Rooms were typical Embassy Suites in style with the separate living room/bedroom area. Spacious with all of the amenities you'd want. Two TV's, Fridge, etc. The ceiling of the room (1632) probably could have used a paint job, but then again, it's just a ceiling. I would be more concerned if the bathroom or carpet in the room itself was dirty, which it wasn't. The afternoon complimentary cocktail party was good. Everything from soda to mixed drinks. The longest line I experienced here was probably 3 people ahead of me, but with 2 bartenders, the line moved fast. Unfotunately with my schedule I didn't get a chance to take advantage of the free breakfast. There is a small business center with 3 computers with complimentary access. Great for checking email or printing up your boarding pass, etc. There is a small fitness center along with a pool.. Unfortunately my schedule did not leave me any time to enjoy either of them. Location wise the hotel is great. You're a short walk to Michigan Avenue or Navy Pier. Right down the block is a Walgreens in case you need to pick something up, stock your fridge, etc. Overall I highly recommend this hotel whether it be for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Value but Crowded”
Reviews.Author: RazorTraveler
Reviews.Content: Granted, we stayed during high season (Spring Break), but at times the hotel was too crowded. The pool is tiny and the area for breakfast and the evening manager's reception is too small to handle the amount of people. Breakfast and the manager''s reception had LONG lines and surprisingly the hotel did not have enough tables or chairs. Some people gave up and took their food upstairs to their room. Despite these drawbacks, the location is excellent- easy and convenient access to the bus (bus line to all of the major museums is right across the street) as well as the red line subway. Michigan Avenue is a few blocks away as is the Navy Pier. The area has terrific restaurants and lots to see and do. Service from the hotel staff was terrific- very helpful and service oriented. The room was clean, and it was nice to have privacy between the bedroom and the living room, making it easier to relax and unwind after the kids go to bed. The bathroom was good size, and there was plenty of hot water even with the hotel very crowded. For runners, the Lakeshore Drive path is a few short blocks away, and it's a great way to see the city skyline and of course, Lake Michhigan.

Reviews.Title: “Very Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: maddy333
Reviews.Content: Without going into all the traumatic details, the hotel staff - particularly the director of housekeeping - was instrumental in returning a very, sad, little girl's missing blankie. Apparently it became wrapped up in the sheets when the mattress was turned. Thank you so much Embassy Suites and Nancy for saving out weekend! You went above and beyond the call of duty! A Grateful Grandmother

Reviews.Title: “Their customer service in all areas is unmatched”
Reviews.Author: ESM63
Reviews.Content: I recently travelled to Chicago with my 2 children age 8 and 10 and their grandmother. We used Hilton points for free nights, which determined our choice of hotel. Were we ever lucky!! Upon arrival the desk clerk recommended we speak to Doris, the Concierge, for recommendations and advice for sightseeing, esp. since I was using crutches. We met Doris, who quickly became our best friend for the weekend. Doris made numerous reservations on our behalf, even going so far as to make inquiries into Bulls playoff games for my son. Doris was always professional yet she also displayed a warm, and personal interest in my sons and my mother, which made all of us feel special. Doris also made excellent dinner suggestions and was always able to get us a table, She is a true asset to this hotel!! I would also like to commend the other staff, including security, which we had to utilize when my mother left her wallet in a taxi. We contacted the hotel from the Shedd Aquarium when we realized what had happended. They were very efficient and had us return to the hotel and they reviewed camera/video from the valet/taxi area. They were able to identify the taxi name (my son had remembered the taxi number) and security contacted their dispactch and they were able to reach the taxi driver1 The taxi still had mom's wallet and returned it to us at the hotel!!! Last but not least, the staff in the atrium/breakfast,cocktail area were also very attentive. When I came in on crutches staff immediately offered to get me whatever food or beverage I needed and to help in any way. I have stayed in many other hotels but no other Embassy Suites has ever provided this kind of service before. We will return to this hotel because of the wonderful employees!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MSUSpartan94
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel to stay at in downtown Chicago. The manager's reception in the evening (free drinks and appetizers) was great as well as the amazing complimentary hot breakfast (made to order omelets!).

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Hope1720
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago so my son could check out DePaul University, it is close to everything. I just wanted to compliment an individual by the name of Ms. Shirley Bailey, she works in the dining room cleaning tables. Let me tell you I have never met a person so full of joy and kindness, she cleans the tables with a smile, takes pride in her work and makes the customers enjoy their stay. I even over heard telling the younger girls, to smile it makes the day so much better. See Shirley is older and wiser and knows what those young girls don't, life is short and make the best of what you do and enjoy every minute. They are sooooooo lucky to have her working for them, showing the younger girls how they should approach their job and even luckier because Shirley makes every customer feel great about their day. You need to give her a HUGE RAISE, or have her teach classes!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Pungmeister
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Chicago for a two-night stay with our kids (ages 4 - 14) over spring break. The hotel was packed, but I was impressed with the friendliness of the staff. Everyone from the front desk to the servers that staffed the breakfast buffet were incredibly polite and friendly. The fact that the majority of the employees actually made eye contact when they were waiting on you sent a big signal that they were interested in our experience. The breakfast buffet that was included was better than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Add $64 to whatever your rate is”
Reviews.Author: JLDCA
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very clean, good service, best location, I can't say much more except your internet access is $14/day plus if you have a car, parking is $50 per day. Wow! Why is it Courtyard gives free internet but Embassy Suites does not?

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: hardwareace1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four days in connection with a convention at McCormick Place. The breakfasts were very good. There was a lengthy line at the start of the nightly cocktail receptions but they moved fairly quickly. As mentioned by others - the pool was small - we didn't even bother going down there after glancing at it upon arrival. The exercise area was OK but lacking adequate strength training options. The location is very good. As mentioned, parking is a bit steep at $41 for self-park but, that's par for the course at all other hotels in the downtown area as well. You could opt to park at a nearby public garage but it wasn't worth the minimal savings to me to be outside the hotel. Our only negative experience was with housekeeping. Although one wouldn't notice it taking a stand-up shower, my wife noticed some nasty black mold under the grab rail in the tub while taking a bath. We left a note for the maid and she made a half-hearted effort to remove it - about 25% remained when we returned. Apparently, she wasn't going to bother getting a brush and whatever chemicals were needed to remove the remainder. There was also what appeared to be greenish spit (saliva) on one of the porcelain caps that cover the screws that hold the toilet to the floor. That remained there for two days before I ended up nearly gagging and cleaning it myself with a washcloth. Those are items I would never allow at my own home and certainly don't expect to have to deal with at an Embassy Suites hotel. If management would like to address the deficiencies with the maid - we were in room 904 from March 30th-April 3rd.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room and public areas; super quiet room; great staff”
Reviews.Author: Lisamarch
Reviews.Content: Had not stayed here for 6 years but still as nice as it was then. Unlike other recent reviews, we didn't experience dated features anywhere. Our room was very nice - clean and modern with nothing worn out. Large bathroom. Manager's reception was wonderful - you actually get GLASS glasses, where some Embassy Suites make you drink from plastic cups. Breakfast pleased everyone and we did not have a line, going there at 7:30 one morning and 7:00 the other morning. Valet service was great. Very good experience - the only reason we don't stay here more often is that it's not as close to Michigan Avenue as other hotels, and I can usually find a cheaper rate at other places.

Reviews.Title: “Dwayne made a difference!”
Reviews.Author: My5Rowdies
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Embassy Suites for a gymnastics competition in February. We had stayed at this location in Feb of 2010 for the same reason. Our first visit to the hotel was AMAZING! The service was excellent and the facility was above par. Naturally, we had high expectations for our second visit and the Embassy Suites did not disappoint!! On our first visit, we met Dwayne Moore (bellman/doorman) and we were so impressed by his attitude, his enthusiasm and his eagerness to assist customers. We were greatly pleased that Dwayne was also working during our second trip to Chicago. Dwayne is a remarkable young man. He is passionate about what he does, and it is evident that he is employed in a profession that very much suits him. Dwayne is service oriented and his selfless attitude is portrayed in all he does. Dwayne MADE our trip to Chicago. He deserves to be recognized for his exemplary service and his genuine servant heart. Many a hotel worker come and go, and many are not remembered from day to day. However, we remembered Dwayne because he initially made such an impressive impression upon us. He is not one to be forgotten! We definitely hope to see Dwayne again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Location - SMALL POOL”
Reviews.Author: shapeup4
Reviews.Content: We came downtown over spring break to see some of the sights. First trying to find the valet parking is hard, unless you really know where to park. It is on the side of the hotel with a small sign. $48 for valet parking seems really expensive, but what choice do you have. Check in was very easy and staff nice. Hotel seem to be kept up well in the lobby area. The room look more worn than I expected. The couch and cchair seemed to be pretty well worn, and the sofa sleeper was very uncomfortable to sleep on, per my daughter. The light that comes in through the blinds at night was horrible from the atrium. We have to take a sheet and block the light in order for them to sleep. The beds in the room were made up very nice and pretty comfortable. The shower pressure was not good at all and the lighting in the bathroom was poor at best. My girls and their friends were really looking forward to going swimming and we were all so disappointed by the size of the pool. I have never seen a pool this small. It looked to be maybe 6 feet wide. Why have a pool, there was no room for anyone to even swim except maybe one person doing a lap. The breakfast was awesome. It offered things like eggs, bacon, omletes, pancakes, fresh fruit, donuts, juices and much more. Yes there were lines, but not unmanageable. Location was great to Navy Pier or Michigan Avenue. We enjoyed walking, so this was no problem. The hotel is located over the AMC and Lucky Strikes, which proved to be alot of fun for all. Not sure if I would stay here again. Might try another suites hotel and see what they offer.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: sunshineboltie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem for the price and location. We were here for combo business/pleasure and it was our second time choosing to stay here. The morning breakfast is very good, the location is three blocks off Michigan Ave and the rooms have a separate seating area. The location is on the Nordstrom end of Michigan Ave. If you prefer Barney's or Watertower place for shopping, you may want to choose the other E. Suites, although it is all still within walking distance. Cabs are readily available right outside the door as are restaurants, coffee shops and a theatre. This isn't a super high end hotel- just basics for a good price and value. ( except parking costs are high at about 42.00 per day in an uncovered lot some distance away from entry- (that is parking your own car.)

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: skidamarink
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 3.5 if I could do halfsies with reviews. I like to summarize reviews so let's start with the goods: 1. Room is a good size, pretty comfortable set up. 2. Breakfast options are great, made to order eggs, pastries and breads, some cereal, scrambled eggs, bacon, fruit, oatmeal, apple/orange juices, coffee/tea, yogurt. 3. Dominicks groceries right across the street. Great for getting water, soda, etc. 4. Manager's reception at 5:30-7:30pm 5. Great staff. Very helpful. 6. Parking structure is in the same building. So no need to get out on the road from the lot. 7. About 3 blocks over from Magnificent mile. 8. Really fast/efficient elevators 9. Internet pretty decent speed. Hhonors get free internet. 10. Good bath stuff. Now to the eh... 1. The room is dated. Our first room had a malfunctioning cabinet door and non working mini fridge. We called down and was moved to a different room immediately. Which was nice (hence the great staff comment). Microwave is OLD, mini fridge doesn't really cool properly, shower doesn't work properly either (the knob to change from tub to shower sticks really bad. 2. Bfast line can get really bad if you don't get there early. Manager's reception is the same way. 3. I always check the pillows and beds before we settle in the room, the pillow had a stain on it... ew... 4. Missing coffee in the amenities box 5. For some reason the trash cans/bins do not have any liners anymore. Not sure if that's a cost loss or what. But when you have a baby who's still in diapers it is kinda gross to just dump it in the can/bin. So we had to scrounge around for plastic bags. 6. Self parking is $41/night ... oy... 7. The entrance to the building is well hidden. It's actually on Illinois St. side. We meant to do valet but couldn't find the entrance so we self parked instead.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Swttxred
Reviews.Content: The best mini-vacation her. Wonderful hotel in all aspects. 2 blocks East of the Magnificent Mile (all the good shops were within 2-6 blocks on Michigan). Dominick's grocery store right across the street, AMC movie theater right behind the hotel (around the south corner), and a Walgreens right beside the theater. Navy Pier was within walking distance as well. The pool area was not big enough and the room could have been much cooler. The pool area was very humid and hot while we were watching our kids swim. The FREE cook-to-order breakfast was wonderful as well as the manager's reception every evening. There is always a line for the free food, but is well worth it! The choices were abundant. Of course, the earlier you get down stairs for breakfast the shorter the line. The beds were so comfortable! Nice to have a mini-fridge and microwave in each room especially when you can go across the street for groceries. The rooms were dark and quiet and the beds were very comfy for good sleeping. We didn't use the sleeper sofa, so cannot comment on the noise level in the living room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, decent location”
Reviews.Author: EnchantmentOTS
Reviews.Content: Outstanding staff. Breakfast was included. It was good, plenty of variety,pop included. Easy walk to/from shopping and theater district.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa38Kent_UK
Reviews.Content: Great hotel- friendly service, fantastic breakfast and our room had a lovely lake view. We have stayed in a few Embassy Suites hotel and this was the nicest, the Managers reception was great after a day of sight seeing and we had plenty of room with our three girls. Although the location isnt really central, the bus stop was a short walk away. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Relaxing Experience!”
Reviews.Author: amandalang
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites was a wonderful place to stay. It has a great location for all different kinds of entertainment the Chicago has to offer. We arrived at noon and were worried about getting into our room however the hotel had our room ready for check in which was nice so we had the day to explore. Upon arrival we found that our shower did not drain the correct way. We quickly called it in and had a WONDERFUL, FUNNY man named Ron come to our help. He was in to fix our shower quickly and gave us a free movie rental for the hassle, which it was no real hassle. Everyone at the E.S was very helpful and friendly. The manager's reception and breakfast were great!!! There was a bit of a line to both however they moved quickly!!! The room was wonderful and had a lot of space. The water took awhile to heat up and the drain worked for a shower and then went back to hardly draining at all. Those were a minor glitch but we would definitely return to this hotel and we will recommend this to all our friends! Thanks for a great 30th birthday get away!

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the blizzard”
Reviews.Author: mikemac1958
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Chicago couldn't have had a better location. The staff are wonderful, helpful and friendly. The accommodation is incredible sooooo much space !! The food is great but portions are way too big for us Brits !!! :)) one block away Grom main shopping street. 10 min walk (30 in the blizzard !!) from the Naval Pier. :D

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location with Perks”
Reviews.Author: MzTaylor06
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Chicago on a girls getaway with my mom, aunt, cousin and second cousin. The hotel was excellent for our small group! Check in was prompt and they even assigned us two rooms side by side.(There are no adjoining rooms in this hotel)We were on the 17th floor which had a great view of the lobby and common areas below. The first night we were there we decided to eat at the restaurant on site called PJ Clarke's. The food was awesome and I must plug the meatloaf sandwich and the crab stuffed shrimp. There were delicious! The made to order breakfast in the hotel inlcuding additional hot items was not only a great value but is was really good. The rooms were nicely decorated and very roomy for two people. It was especially nice to have a refrigerator and microwave in the room. With the Magnificent Mile only two blocks away, this was a perfect choice for a downtown Chicago visit. There was also a Garrett's Popcorn only 3 blocks away from the hotel which is always the last stop before leaving town. One tip if you plan on going: The address of the hotel is on Columbus Dr, but the entrance to the valet parking and drop off is on Illinois. Be sure to look for this. We arrived during rush hour just after the big storm. So, coupled with snow packed one way streets and traffic, it took us an hour to circle around to find the correct entrance. Overall, this is a great hotel and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lakefront”
Reviews.Author: huskamo
Reviews.Content: The design of the hotel makes for some noise issues but overall it's a pleasant experience. The front desk staff, Clem in particular are very helpful, polite and professional. Clem went out of her way to provide information and to help ensure that our needs were met. People are very eager to write negative reviews but I wanted to take the time to compliment Clem on being a superior customer service represenative. The free morning breakfast is much better then expected offering a vast assortment of choices. I have had some bad complimentary breakfasts but this one was very good. Located within walking distance of Navy Pier, shopping and restaurants, the Lakefront Embassy is a good choice for your Chicago stay and with the addition of Clem it becomes a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: LHA79
Reviews.Content: We sure enjoyed our stay. We walked to Navy Pier. Had a wonderful cocktail at night and a nice hot breakfast. The room was very quiet and we slept really well. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keepthepace
Reviews.Content: All was fine. Nothing special. The fitness center is nice but small for a hotel this size and the equipment needs a tune up (really three of the five machines were not working properly). Evening managers reception served tortilla chips and salsa (not at all worthwhile).

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bleedngreen
Reviews.Content: We visited Chicago for the sailboat show at Navy Pier - a short walk away. Check-in was quick and within minutes of finding the room the housekeeping staff arrived to replace any feather pillows with poly-fill ones. After our showers the loose shower control handle fell off but the hotel engineer came up as soon as we reported it and thanked us for letting them know so they could have the room ready for the weekend. We were surprised that he asked the desk to reduce our room rate, which we appreciated. The breakfast was great and the manager's reception was great too. Did not use the pool but it looked fine. Only two things were annoying -- the elevators arrival bells are loud, and the bright light outside the room that leaked through the wooden shutter into the living room would have been very bright if we had children sleeping there. Lobby waterfall was not working but probably would have been loud anyway. Would definitely stay there again and have recommended to our friends already. The in-hotel restaurant PJ Clarke's - eh. Needs some attention to decor and has a tired menu.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room-No Peace and Quiet-No Forks/Spoons at Breakfast-No Bellman”
Reviews.Author: Cooper8r
Reviews.Content: We liked the room and the location. That was about it! Stayed two nights. First night very noisy guests next store at 12am. The lines for the manager's reception to get a drink were forty people long. Second night (or morning) 4:30am noisy next door guests. We had to call security two nights in a row (out of a two night stay). Called twice to get blankets, had no movie channel options, waited 20 minutes to get spoons and forks for breakfast, waited for a bellman to come up and get our luggage....never showed. Very disappointed. Told the front desk clerk about our experience and they told me to go to this website and write a review. What customer service that is huh? Seems like this hotel plays a numbers game, get a lot of people in there, don't have enough staff to service them, get their money and it all pans out in the end. Honestly...to put it bluntly.....this place sucks. Wouldn't stay there or recommend it either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay, but you will pay more than $40 a day for Parking”
Reviews.Author: PennyRick
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to the Michigan Avenue shopping area, and it is near the lake. It is a relatively new place with an open courtyard and excellent views. Staff members were pleasant. We enjoyed our stay there, but a few things made the place less than it could have been. (1) We had a rental car. Parking in the area is limited and very expensive. We were given a choice between Valet Parking (with free in-and-out privileges for the car) at $48 a night or Self Parking (without free in-and-out) at $41 a night. (2) This is a large hotel with many guests. It offers a free breakfast and free happy hour drinks. On the days we were there, if you wanted an omelet for breakfast, you had to wait 20 minutes in line before being served. There was no waiting for other menu items. Similarly, if you wanted a complementary drink in the evening, you had to wait in line 10-20 minutes to get served. In both cases, they had a single serving station trying to accomodate large numbers of guests. (3) Internet WiFi access is not free. We had a choice between $14+ a day or $3.75 an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location is a plus-avoid weekends!”
Reviews.Author: Irishgal4life
Reviews.Content: I stayed from Jan 7th-10th. Checked in early around 9:45 am and the room was ready! Check in was a breeze! Manager's Special on Friday and Saturday nights was very busy with lots of people getting their drink then going to the end of the line for another! Can get crazy but it's fun! Breakfast was also busy these mornings. Very nice breakfast is included and well worth it! Room was nice, smaller than other ES hotels I thought. Walls are very thin, and you can hear the people next to you if they are somewhat loud, as well as those above you through the vent! Elevators are very fast! Location is great, a short 5 minute walk or so to Michigan Ave where you can catch a bus to the sites! Convienant grocery store right across the street with a starbucks! Great Hotel-if you can stay during the week when it's most quiet with little to no lines for drinks or breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: cshager
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location when visiting Chicago as it is close to Navy Pier, Mag Mile, and doable walks to the Loop and River North. The price of the hotel includes a reception in the evening that includes light snacks and alcholic drinks. In addition, a full cook to order breakfast with many extras is also included. I would suggest that you buy the package that includes valet parking. It adds about $30 which is a fair price for Chicago. Prices at other hotels can run $5 to $15 more each night. Public parking is also almost as much, and for about $5 more, I would choose the hotel parking The room is a suite with two rooms and includes a microwave and refrigerator. A large grocery store is located right across the street. The workout room has everything needed for a good workout, and the pool area is nice and includes a hot tub. This is a good and economical choice when visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time over the New Year - Great Security Department!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bob1942
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this wonderful hotel over the New Year celebration. The location of this property is a great selling point. The rooms are nice all suite rooms so there was plenty of space for me and my friends to have. The staff was very professional and nice. But the Security Department was fantastic namely Officer Van, he helped me track down my missing iPhone in amazing time, if not for his help I would have lost my phone and missed my flight back home.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ksmom2Kansas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights for a conference, so we got an excellent price. Overall, we really liked the hotel. The location was excellent -- easy to walk to Michigan Avenue. One evening we walked to Macy's on State Street also. It would have been a beautiful walk if it hadn't been so darn cold! Breakfast was very nice, as at all Embassy Suites locations that I've been to. Plenty of variety. The bed was great. I slept very well. Out in the "living room" of our suite, you could really hear the elevator bells and the noise from the lobby, but you couldn't hear it back in the bedroom, so it really wasn't a problem. I would have liked to have free wireless in the room, but that wasn't available. Annoying! The people working there were all very nice and very helpful, with the exception of one lady working the breakfast line. She was extremely abrupt and rude. Definitely a good place to stay though, and I'd recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: travel_junkie3000
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Embassy Suites hotel with an above average breakfast included. One of the nice things about the Embassy Suites brand is the evening cocktail hour and the hot breakfast. Unfortunately everytime we've been to this hotel it has been so crowded we haven't been able to make it to the evening reception. The lines are extraordinarily long. If you plan on going for breakfast, go early, it's worth it for the Cook To Order station. They have a nice selection with omelettes, sausages, bacon, pancakes, biscuits and gravy, and potatoes. There is also fruit and yogurt, oatmeal, cereals and a selection of breads, donuts, etc.. If you go late (after 8:30am) plan to wait in a very long line and struggle to find a place to sit down. The rooms are nice, with a sitting room and table in the front. If you have 4 people the extra bed is a pullout couch in the front room. Everything was very clean and it's really nice to have a mini fridge in the room. The room actually has 3 sinks. One for convenience in the bedroom, one in the bathroom, and a bar sink by the mini fridge. Very nice if you have several people sharing a room. The bed was comfortable, the pillows were excellent. Bathroom was clean and adequate. We had limited interaction with the staff, but the team running the breakfast cook to order station were amazing. If you can find cheap public parking I'd recommend it, the valet at the hotel was $45, and the 'public' parking garage next to the hotel was $41 for overnight. Look for parking elsewhere and cab it to the hotel - I think you'd still save $$$. Overall - a nice hotel. I wouldn't seek it out, but perfectly adequate and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but dissapointed with service”
Reviews.Author: Louavulltraveler
Reviews.Content: The location and room were great. But we checked on a Sunday and got home about six hours later only to discover we had left a Vera Bradley toiletry bag behind. We called and spoke to security who had to wait a day to check with housekeeping. The room was not booked the next day, meaning the only people who had access to our hotel room would be housekeeping. The bag and contents were over $300 due to makeup, hair products, etc. The hotel was great..but for over $200 per night (we stayed near Christmas) you'd hope the bag would be turned in by housekeeping. We called a manager and they said there was nothing they could do. Again, I hoped they might have offered some concellation or at least done a thorough investigation with their staff. Unfortunately that experience left a bad taste in our mouth for this hotel, especially given the number of options in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Spacious Suite”
Reviews.Author: RoColorado
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and have been to Chicago numerous times; and I would not normally review my business hotel, but I was so delighted by this hotel! The suite I had was spacious and very comfortable. The bed was luxuriously comfortable. This location was convenient to Michigan Ave. and Wacker Drive. The included breakfast offered a lot of fresh choices and a wide variety of options. I got a good rate and felt this hotel was a terrific value. I would highly recommend the hotel and I expect to return there on future trips to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hola4876
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great; all rooms are suites so there is a living area, a refrigerator & microwave, and a separate sleeping area. The location was fantastic, just a couple blocks off Michigan Avenue; very easy walks to every place we wanted to visit. We had views of the Chicago River, the downtown skyline, and of Lake Michigan. The hotel serves a full breakfast and has a managers reception every evening. The rates are very reasonable especially considering the free breakfast and beverages. We will definitely stay here again the next time we visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: elgmar
Reviews.Content: So I am a HHonors member and used some points for the stay here this past weekend. Great location. Two blocks off the Mile but very easy to walk right to it. This is the first time at a ES, but the free breakfast....simply amazing value. It is cook to order if you want to wait for it. Another great value, the Manager's Reception. These two aspects saved our group over $100 in two days and made it a fun hotel to stay at. Would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: brownl21
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! Rooms were nice two room suites with pull out bed in living room area, refrigerator, microwave, and sinks in bedroom, bath, and kitchenette area. Included in our stay was a free breakfast; hot buffet and cook to order omelets; great breakfast! There were also free drinks for two hours each night, no top shelf stuff but they made everything we asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Walls are paper thin!”
Reviews.Author: Jdilley363
Reviews.Content: You can hear normal conversations in the room beside you. The hotel is very nice and in a great location but its ridiculous that you can hear everything......what a poor design!!

Reviews.Title: “We've found our perfect Chicago Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Citylove09
Reviews.Content: After searching forever for a nice hotel with great location, I cam across the Embassy Suites at an amazing rate. Myself and a friend of mine were coming into the city for a concert and a mini vacation and this hotel was perfect! The rooms are large and spacious. Beds were comfortable and the view was awesome! Hotel staff was kind every time we walked through the door. Dwayne was especially kind to us each time we returned and was a breath of fresh air to see every day! Breakfast was amazing. Tons of options and the food was hot and delicious every morning. Shirley (as well as everyone else) went out of their way to explain everything to us and make sure we had everything we needed. Location is good! We walked to Navy Pier twice (10-15 min walk) as well as Michigan Ave. There is a Walgreens around the corner as well as a grocery across the street. Pool and hot tub were nice to relax in after a chilly day walking around in the City though the pool was in a little need of a cleaning. Internet was $15 for 24 hrs so we didn't use it but the business center was helpful for directions. Taxi rides ranged from $5-$7 to attractions you can't walk to. We can't wait to return to this hotel next time!

Reviews.Title: “Would do it again”
Reviews.Author: HBInn
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Presidential Suite, at the Embassy Suites Hotel, Chicago Downtown Lakefront and it was wonderful! From the moment I was greeted by the bell hop at the front door it was a delightful experience. Doris at the front desk made the trip such a wonderful experience, and we enjoyed seeing her during our visit! The breakfast staff were kind, courteous, helpful and most of all cheerful every morning! Bar tenders in the evening were on top of their game, and pleasant to meet. As for the rooms, they are clean and comfortable and we got a wonderful night sleep! I would definitely do it again! In fact, we tried to book a room for the next week for other family members before we even left!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: 7WooHoos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites downtown for several nights in October. It's a great location to do all sorts of shopping, sightseeing and dining! The rooms are very clean and nicely kept. It's not luxurious, but wonderfuly functional. The fridge and microwave came in handy. As mentioned before, the breakfast is very good, but it does get busy by 8:15 or so. We walked to Navy Pier, Bobby's Bike Hike, the boat tours, Millenium Park and Michigan Avenue. Everyone was very helpful. The pool and hot tub were not the warmest. There's a Walgreens next door and a wonderful grocery store/sandwich shop/deli....of course the name escapes me right now, across the street. We did self park and it was very easy, but you have to be sure you're not going in and out. We've always stayed at the other end of Michigan Avenue, but I think this is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a family with a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: r2cook
Reviews.Content: The hotel benefits from a great location, we had a great view of Lake Michigan, my son stood in the window sill the whole time we were in the room and loved the boats coming in and out. The breakfast is included, but you better get there early, it gets swamped around 8:15.

Reviews.Title: “great value and location”
Reviews.Author: tiredmom87
Reviews.Content: The hotel was at a great location to get to everything we wanted to do in downtown chicago. valet parking was great , the rooms clean and up to date. we are a family of 4 enough room, great to have a microwave and mini fridge. good sleep. Great value - we got an extra discount with using american express card. Families check your credit card co. some have great discounts for families on vacation. Breakfast buffet was good , but come very early or you will wait a long time in line for food ,not condusive for little children. But we also went at peak season,the place was sold out every night so book early it is worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Chicago Stay Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Tricia1010
Reviews.Content: My friend and our mothers went to see Oprah in her last season and we really wanted to show out mothers a great time while we were there, showering them with the BEST of Chicago. Mr. Hasan & Mr, Qualls gave us the finest service I have ever received in my many trips to the Chicago area. After emailing the hotel about our special upcoming trip, Mr. Hasan, Mr. Qualls and staff gave us a room with a panoramic view of the city along with a welcome gift in our room with turn down service. The manager's reception was a nice way to relax before going out on the town for dinner and the morning breakfast was wonderful with many things to choose from. The staff was outstanding in helping us find a great Italian restaurant and with the cab service to Harpo Studios. The hotel was clean, roomy, and comfortable giving us plenty of rest and room to get ready in the morning. I will absolutely stay at this hotel again. Remember it is the 511 North Columbus hotel, which is a short walk to Navy Pier and the Magnificent Mile. It is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Was a real treat!”
Reviews.Author: playandsleep
Reviews.Content: Every single staff member we encountered during our 2 night stay was extremely friendly, greeting us with a smile every time and warm greeting. Our room was clean, well tended to, and comfortable. The hotel sent up a bottle of wine, 2 glasses, and a platter of cheese, crackers, and fruit (all delicious) as a birthday treat. Although the hotel was booked solid this weekend, the elevators were always quick, our floor quiet, and the breakfast buffet well stocked, and the employees kept tables clean and available. We play often in Chicago, and have stayed at quite a few of the downtown hotels. We've stayed at this Embassy several times before, including a stay in August. The past 2 times we've noticed a remarkable improvement in their customer service. We also were able to snag a great rate, and although we didn't pay a lot to stay there, we were treated like royalty. Parking in their garage is easy, and we had plenty of room to park a big car. Parking fee is comparable to other Chicago garages. Thank you, Embassy Suites Lakefront, for making my birthday weekend a special time. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Location is a positive and negative”
Reviews.Author: Moonstonemoclips
Reviews.Content: Typical Embassy Suites. Rooms were clean and the staff were quite efficient. The location being very central makes this very popular which is its downside. With the free breakfast, the liens can be long and the place very noisy. Likewise with the evening reception. That being said, the place was well run, the staff courteous and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “NO customer service!”
Reviews.Author: fresman90210
Reviews.Content: The hotel is your typical Embassy suites. Great location! Everyone who worked therre was really rude. Valet was terrible, front desk terrible, and conceirge was never at the desk. Wee checked in and straight to conceirge desk for directions to a venue, after nearly 15 mins we just decided to go downstairs and ask valet on our way. He informed us that wasnt his job and to return upstairs. The front desk said they didnt know and just gave us a map and said good luck! The room was smoking room after requsting a non-smoking room. The room was dirty inside aswell. We a had a great view of the lake though. The big problem here is that they dont have enough staff members. We waited in line 30 mins to check in because the front desk only had one person working.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't ask for a better hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: craigdubya
Reviews.Content: First thing is first, I am sure there are better hotels in Chicago. However, given price, location and staff - it was excellent. The hotel is very easy to get to coming off the highway into the city. Valet parking is offered but there is a self-parking garage on illinois that is a only $32/24 hours. It is a 30 second walk to hotel. The staff was vey friendly when we checked in and were very quick. Much like other embassy suites hotels, the complimentry drinks and snacks are perfect between 530 and 730. The rooms are fine. We had a room on the 10th floor and looked out onto the lake. Beds are good. Bathroom is a little small, but does the trick. Hotel is within walking distance to everything which is a plus. Grab a map from the front desk and you are set. As well, it is a 5 min walk to the red line subway line which we found to get us everywhere we wanted to go that wasn't close (US cell field and Wrigley). There is a small grocery store across the street along with a Starbcuks which was perfect. Breakfast in the morning, while busy was great. Cook to order line is long but quick.
