They are friendly and will make you whatever you want. Word of warning ... some people are ridiculous with their requests for breakfast! A little tip - walking out the front door of the hotel and walking up Grand there is a GREAT restaurant. It is called Volare and I think it is on the corner of Grand and St.Claire. It is just before you walk under Michigan ave. It was a recco from the front desk (yes, they ARE knowledgbale) and I have to say it was one of the best Italian meals I have had. If you want somewhere close, well priced and good ... go here. You will thank me as you take your first bite. Make reservations as you walk by as it will get busy. All in all, great hotel, great location and great staff. We will be back to Chicago and we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “5th year staying here .. it's great.”
Reviews.Author: holtdmg
Reviews.Content: We have a Chicago Mom trip we take every year for past seven years, the third year we stayed here and now just book direct with hotel each year. There are 8 of us who come. We find the hotel super clean, conviently located within walking distance of Navy Pier and Michigan Ave. The rooms are the best .. big and clean and the bed are great. We love the happy hour and breakfast. But it's the staff that really are the best. Easy check in quick response to calls for extra pillows and stuff, we had trouble with TV and Ron came up .. he was great and funny and fixed everything.. it is priced within the standard of chicago .. which blows us Michigan people away a little bit but is the best bang for the buck and we feel real safe here.. we will be back in 2011 for our 6th year.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Amenities, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pulpoeater
Reviews.Content: Frequently stay at Embassy Suites properties and this one is not too bad...starting to show a little wear and tear, but still decent. The location is probably the best you can get in Chicago....close to great restaurants, shopping, and attractions within walking distance. Room was just fine and the bed was nice as well. I have to compliment the staff for their organization regarding the managers reception and breakfast. Despite the number of folks staying at the hotel, the lines were not too long and there was always a table available. The bar, restaurant, and service staff were polite and friendly. I like Embassy Suites and this one did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic Service!”
Reviews.Author: sktss_123
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before for business and loved it. It's the typical Embassy Suites. Once you've seen one, you've seen them all. It has a great location... other than that, it failed. The front desk was cold and rude upon arrival. It was as though it was a hassle for the gal to be working. Then they put us in the wrong room. We went down and got it switched out. (After a complaint on that to E.S. they did take care of us, but that doesn't excuse the rest of the weekend.) Everyday we had to ask for more towels and washcloths because there were 4 of us in the room, NOT two. (Even the spares from the night before they would end up taking.) They would take the blankets and never leave any coffee cups...even though there are tea bags, coffee and a coffee maker. The elevators worked half the time. The hotel seemed to be close to full capacity by the weekend. It could take as long as 7 minutes to get an elevator. There were no vending machines on the 10th floor, but the sign still said there was. The machines on 8,9 and 11 were broken. So, after 20 minutes of attempting to purchase a bottle of water... I finally found one on the 6th floor. The breakfast had was mediocre at best. At the other Embassy Suites, there's more "made to order" food than just omelets, not here. The pancakes by Sat. were so hard on the edges, I couldn't even cut through them... and my 3 year old wouldn't even have anything to do with them. The donuts looked like they were about a week old. And the variety of any of the food never changed... 4 days in a row of that is a little too much. The guests by weekend were rude as well. Allowing children to run the hallways and scream at 10:30 at night is uncalled for when traveling on business. Not to mention, the sirens every 2 minutes on the streets below were horrible. If they just provided a sound machine, would have been wonderful. Finally, the stench in the rooms from the humidity was awful! By the end of the trip we couldn't get out fast enough. Even my 3 year old daughter kept complaining of the "sour" smell in the room. It was disgusting. And to top off the exit, we needed a larger taxi as we had been there 5 days and were 4 people. The cab driver that was there flipped out. Got out of his car and started a shouting fest! As if we'd even feel comfortable driving with an irate taxi driver at that point. All in all, the rooms were ok and the service was pathetic! We won't be staying at that particular Embassy Suites again. Side note not related to E.S.... PJ Clarke's was great as usual!

Reviews.Title: “typical embassy suites/nice stay”
Reviews.Author: thetripplanner
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Embassy Lakefront--we had an okay experience--asked for a lake view room and got it so that was good--rooms are typical embassy style--TV was a bit hard to master. The walls are paper thin but was so tired at night did not have a problem going to sleep. Breakfast--well free breakfast equals lots of folks--lines to me were not clear -- stood in line for what I thought pancakes--nope -- not that line-- I am not a fan of buffet breakfasts so did not enjoy this -- line for fresh food was too long--did not go to evening cocktail hour--pool was tiny and hot but my daughter enjoyed it--painful for me though. Decor wise--very bland--institutional in appearance to the courtyard area--beige and more beige. Not too modern looking there--check in and out was fine. If Navy Pier where you want to go easy 3 block walk to that. Subway and Walgreens right around the corner--very helpful to have close by.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: BeakerTX
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights during a conference in Chicago. The room was quiet (thanks to the extra room buffering the lobby). However, the room was a little dingy (despite some signs of recent renovations), lacked window sheers, and was the second room of my stay. The first room smelled of mold/mildew. The lobby was frequently crowded, but manageable. The location was perfect for accessing surrounding restaurants and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Insguy83
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler and probably use Hilton properties 50-60% of the time. We took two rooms at this hotel for two nights and it was the worst hotel experience I have had in 20 years or more. The hotel is very noisy and not in good condition but the real issue is poor service. They seemed completely overwhelmed by the number of guests. Long waits at the front desk and for the valet (parking was $49/night). We didn't use the complimentary breakfast either morning because of long lines just to get a table or hot food. When checking out we called for a bellman and were put on hold and eventually hung up on. We brought our bags to the lobby and asked for a bellman to store them. The front desk called for one but he never came. The concierge doesn't come on duty until 10 AM which seems a little rediculous for a hotel serving tourists who probably want to start their day a little earlier. When she finally made an appearance at 10:10 AM she was surly and didn't seem to know much about the city. We asked her about two tours we had found on Trip Advisor and she didn't know about either one of them. They were both excellent. One originated two blocks from the hotel and is the highest rated tour on trip advisor. If you're ever vacationing in Chicago I highly recommend Booby's Bike Hike and the Chicago Planet Food Tours. Just don't stay at the Embassy Suites. When I finally had enough and complained they offered me a complimentary night at the hotel. Are you kidding me? We couldn't get away from this place fast enough

Reviews.Title: “The absolute best place to stay - Clean, friendly, a great value!”
Reviews.Author: LWAConsulting
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for more in a hotel. The suites allowed us to have some privacy from the teenager. Microwave and refrigerator came in handy. Sink inside and outside the bathroom gave us space to get ready. Managers free reception (drinks and munchies) and free breakfast with "served to order" entrees fabulous. Friendly and affordable. Location was in the heart of town within walking distance (or public transportation) of major attractions. The rooms were extremely clean and the beds were the most comfortable I've ever experienced in a hotel. The staff was incredible. Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money! Skeleton crew!”
Reviews.Author: tlcstlcs
Reviews.Content: I thought the location would be great (downtownlakefront) therefroe I was willing to spend $369/night. However, I do not think it was worth it and would not go back. Many items needed repair including the wall of water in the lobby, both telephones in our room, alarm clock, bedroom door handle, etc. One big disappointment is that the hotel operates with a skeleton crew----with only minimal staff available. The general attitude was not friendly---just business with the exception of Doris the conceirege and the bellhops/valet who really hustle. Also internet charges are per day per laptop.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: austintraveler52
Reviews.Content: Typical Embassy Suites in appearance. What distinguishes this hotel is the excellent service at the front desk. The first room we had smelled moldy. Asked Justin at the front desk if we could switch and he could not have been accomodating. Moved us to another room immediately. By the way, nice breakfast. Location is great...off of Michigan by bout four blocks closer to the Lake but an easy walk to most downtown Chicago spots.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: CindyC77
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Chicago on business (4 nights) - a friend and two children also traveled with me. The Embassy Suites Chicago Lakefront fit everyoneâ€™s needs, from the great location to many sightseeing attractions, to the pool, great free breakfast, big roomy suites, and wonderful friendly service. It is a two-room suite set-up and that just what we needed. We requested early check-in since our train was arriving in the morning and even though the hotel was sold-out; we were able to get in our room before lunch. The maids were super friendly and let us trade out as many towels as we wanted on a daily basis since we declined other service. With four females, we went through a lot of towels. Ron in Engineering fixed our sofa bed and then gave us two free in-room movies for the slight inconvenience. Ken O. and Elena S. were simply delightful to work with! Weâ€™ll see you again soon. I have traveled to Chicago numerous times and usually stay at the Omni, but the Embassy Suites Lakefront offers more value for the money. Yes, you have to pay for Internet, but we certainly re-cooped than money with the daily breakfasts, snacks, and drinks. If you want to avoid the lines for omelets, go early to breakfast, otherwise the other foods are available with virtually no wait. Attended the evening reception only once and there was no line. There is just so much to see and do in Chicago, it could easily make a week-long family vacation destination. The hotel was walking distance to Navy Pier, Michigan Avenue, Hancock Building, Water Tower Mall, and the Hershey Store. Also during the trip, had the opportunity to go to Shawâ€™s Crab House for the Sunday Brunch. All I can say to the seafood lover is â€œunbelievableâ€�â€¦ I never knew king crab could taste so fresh!...and homemade lollipops tooâ€¦. Itâ€™s almost worth flying from PA just to go there! There were also filming Transformers 3 in the city so that added to the excitement. We love Chicago and the Embassy Suites Lakefront and hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great place...keep going back.”
Reviews.Author: rlb5937
Reviews.Content: Although I live in the suburbs of Chicago, my family loves to go downtown, stay at the Embassy Suites for a few nights, and pretend we are on vacation. I guess you would call it a staycation. This is always our first choice. The lobby is beautiful, the rooms are not only roomy, but the beds are so comfortable. We always get a great night sleep and when we wake up in the morning an amazing breakfast is waiting for us. The location couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “basic Embassy Suites - no reason to be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: malawimike
Reviews.Content: Came here for business. If you have ever stayed at Embassy Suites you will know what to expect. Nice room with separate living room. Big hot breakfast. Managers reception in the evening. My only complaint was with the people staying there -- parents letting kids take food at the reception with their bare hands, people rushing to get food like they had not eaten in a week, taking excessive amounts and then leaving half of it on the plate when they leave the reception. I wish people could act a bit more respectful! The hotel is in a good location. Walk to Millenium Park, Grant Park, Navy Pier, and Lakefront. Great grocery store across the street with a fantastic salad bar/deli/hot food selection. I saw a lot of guests bringing food back from there. If you are looking for a nice pool, just know that there is a pool but it was pretty small. Don't go expecting a big pool for the family to splash and play around in. But it is fine -- it's just small. All in all, you should have no reason to complain about this hotel. It's all good!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not cheap, but nothing in this area is cheap”
Reviews.Author: SolowTraveler
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is close to almost everything. Walk to Navy Pier, Millennium and Grant Parks, museums, Magnificent Mile, and lots of other attractions. The rooms are not cheap, but nothing in this area is going to be cheap given the location. The service was great, my room was clean, breakfast is the best I've had at a hotel. If I could make one suggestion, I would ask that they improve the fitness center. It's quite small, and I've stayed at lower-rated hotels with better (and more) equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 10 in every way - perfectly met all of our needs!”
Reviews.Author: Allison_in_DC
Reviews.Content: Went there for a long weekend with two girlfriends. Had a beautiful partial view of Lake Michigan. Suite was spacious and clean. Two double beds with a pull out sofa worked perfectly for the three of us. Doormen were extremely helpful and pleasant when we arrived and welcomed us back every time we returned at the end of the day. The managers reception staff were so friendly and attentive. They remembered our preferences and gave great drink suggestions when we didn't know what we wanted. Breakfast/Managers Reception attendants were attentive and unobtrusive, keeping a very busy area clean and welcoming. Hotel is in great condition - bright, fresh, clean, open atrium with lots of natural light. Location is wonderful - close to the L, Navy Pier, Mag Mile and has great restaurants and activities in the immediate area. Also just two blocks away from a stop on the Double Decker Tour bus line. Would go back there again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious rooms, good amenities!”
Reviews.Author: fluffnfold
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights over a weekend in mid-July. The location of the hotel was excellent; it was about three blocks to Navy Pier, the Ohio Street Beach, and Lake Michigan, and about two blocks to the Chicago River. There is a grocery/store pharmacy called Dominick's across the street, so it's easy to buy drinks and snacks for your room, although that is almost unnecessary with the free hot breakfast served every morning and the nightly manager's cocktail party (even on weekends). Because my spouse has priority with Hilton, we were upgraded to a corner suite on the 17th floor (the highest floor), with excellent views of the river. The standard suites weren't quite as large as the corner suites (there's an odd window from their living area to the hotel atrium, so one could see in), but were still a great size, with a separate bedroom, bathroom, wet bar/microwave/fridge area, and living room with sofa bed and desk (the corner suites also had two chairs as part of the sofa grouping). There is an indoor pool and fitness center, as well as a gift shop, bar, and large lobby lounge area. There is no outdoor space at this hotel, which was the only drawback for me. A little sundeck, or other outdoor relaxation area (no matter how small) would have been welcome. The hotel spans an entire block, so it is possible to enter from multiple locations. There is an AMC movie theatre right next door, along with a bowling alley, PJ Clarke's restaurant, a Japanese restaurant, and a Walgreens pharmacy. There aren't many non-chain, unique restaurants in the immediate two block area, which was another slight drawback, but it was a quick walk to more cuisine-friendly streets. It is necessary to take two sets of elevators to reach the guest rooms. One set of elevators only travels three floors, from the street to the mezzanine (meeting) level to the sky (lobby) level. Then you must get off and walk to the other side of the hotel to catch another set of elevators that goes from floors 5 to 17. I understand that this set-up discourages non-guests from hanging out in the lobby and using the restrooms, but it is slightly inconvenient. I must say, though, that this hotel has the fastest elevators that I've seen in a long time! If you hesitated the slightest bit before trying to board, the doors closed and the elevator whisked away. (But that's probably why we almost never waited for an elevator, even being on the 17th floor during a busy summer weekend.) I would definitely stay here again, even considering all the other hotel options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: terpnut
Reviews.Content: As parents with two small children, we've always enjoyed the privacy of suites when travelling, and the Embassy Suites has delivered a consistently good stay whereever we can find one when we travel. This hotel has a very narrow, alley-like two-lane driveway so it was very congested when our taxi pulled up. Very awkward for those arriving by vehicle. One immediate downside of this particular hotel is that it is built on top of retail and thus you have to take an elevator to what is essentially a fifth floor lobby. Then, after checking in, you have to traverse the length of the hotel to get to the main hotel elevator banks. The bottom line is that there is lots of walking to get to your room. Not a problem if you are okay with walking, but if you are mobility challenged or want quick street-level access to your room, this is not the ideal hotel. Check-in was friendly, smooth and quick. Front desk offered some typical toiletries if you forgot something. This is one of the newer Embassy Suites so most hotel areas and rooms were in great condition. The main lobby has the expected huge atrium contributing to the nice airy, albeit noisy, feel typical of Embassy Suites. A few complaints in the room: 1. The bathroom shower rod was one of the new curved type that gives people more room, but the mount was broken so gravity made the curtain open whenever we showered. This led to lots of water spilling out onto the floor. 2. Walls are paper-thin and you could clearly hear conversations in the next room. Much worse than other hotels we've stayed at. 3. On the second of three days, housekeeping didn't replace enough towels or supplies. The other days were fine. 4. The single power outlet integrated with the desk lamp is too close to the switch so you can't plug in a flush-mounted power strip's plug. 5. Charging for internet access in this day and age is simply ridiculous. Breakfast was also typical of other Embassy Suites: it's free, the food is mediocre, and it gets crazy busy if you go late. To their credit, they keep the food and lines moving, kept it open longer than the stated 10 am cutoff, seating was plentiful and the service was quick and friendly. The manager's reception offered a decent selection of drinks and beers. Personally, I'd rather have free internet access than free breakfast or drinks. The best would be for Embassy Suites to offer all three! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Ran us out of town”
Reviews.Author: IndyMegan
Reviews.Content: We left Chicago early on our last day of a weekend trip mainly to get away from this hotel. The night before, as I was trying to rest before late-night plans, I could hear a baby in the next room and a constant din from the hotel's atrium, and I went to a movie next door just to escape. I was disappointed to say the least. The service was great, room quality decent, crowds barely tolerable, double-elevator thing annoying, but the real problem is the atrium-style design. I'll never understand it. Every room overlooks the cacophonous atrium, as though every guest wants to hear what is going on in the atrium at all times. Walls were thin; heard babies crying on both sides at various points of the stay. On a sold-out weekend, the breakfast buffet was a madhouse. Waited 25 minutes for an omelet. The lobby is on an upper floor of the building, so you take on elevator to the lobby and then, across the atrium, another elevator to the room. The manager's reception, a daily perk, is good for the drinks but not worth the time for the snacks - nachos and cheese sauce, and sweet-potato fries, both mediocre at best. I didn't love the location. It's convenient to Navy Pier, which I didn't need, but families with kids must enjoy. It's also close to Michigan Avenue, but you have to climb steps to reach that street, because the hotel is set on one of Chicago's lower-level streets. A little confusing to reach, too. It wasn't a bad walk to Michigan Avenue, but it felt a little removed. The crowd is kid- and family-heavy, because it's a suite hotel. Be prepared for that. Lots of bodies crowding the driveway, buffet, elevators, etc. On the other hand, the atrium is very spacious with lots of couches and chairs. The pool is a lap pool. The hot tub is decent sized. Both are located off the atrium, not a rooftop or top-floor location like many hotels have. The rooms were okay, though a little on the small side. Hilton Suites, Omni, and Doubletree Suites are much larger. There's a window with shutters in the living room to the hallway outside, and since every floor is open to the atrium, light comes in through the shutters at all times. It was never fully dark in the living room. Also, the window makes it impossible to feel secluded in your room. The living room is in the front of the room, with small hallway to the back bedroom. The two-bed suites have double beds, not queens. There's a sink and an armoire in the bedroom. The bathroom is of decent size, but not nearly as big as those at Hilton Suites. On the plus side, the beds were cushy (but not Heavenly Bed cushy), and the AC worked great. The back bedroom was cool and pitch dark, for a good sleep. There were some positives. The service was very good. Buffet breakfast was more than satisfactory, with cooked-to-order omelet. The rest of the food is just okay, but you can eat a big breakfast that might cost $20 easily at a restaurant. There is a bike rack on the block, which we used overnight. A bike rental place at Navy Pier is close. I will avoid the Embassy Suites Lakefront in the future, but if a family needs the space and can take advantage of the good breakfast value, a stay here makes some sense.

Reviews.Title: “I am not sure if the other reviewers...”
Reviews.Author: travel54039
Reviews.Content: I am not sure if the other reviewers actually stayed at this hotel. The rooms are mediocre at best. I haven't seen a TV that old in some time. The beds were comfortable. If you are going for the free breakfast and happy hour-stay at a better hotel, pay less for the room, and pay for it. The lines for this made me feel like college dorms. The lines for elevators were as long. Bathrooms are small and nothing special. The price for internet is pathetic and the business center must be dial-up. I was blocked from reading the newspaper. I waited 30 minutes for towels, two calls and an hour for a blanket, and one day we had to call to get our room cleaned at 5 pm. Would not stay here again or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful experiance”
Reviews.Author: igetaround69
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the embassy suites with family for a graduation trip to the university of illonois in Champagne. We booked 3 rooms at the Embassy for a few nights and thoroughly enjoyed our trip. The Happy Hour is a brilliant idea! The rooms were in excellant condition and housekeeping kept them very tidy. The only issue we had was that when we received our luggage, one bag was missing and we were already in Champage (2 hours away) It took a few calls back and forth to get to the bottom fo the issue but the missing luggage was finally found and sent to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: DCgirl520
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights while attending a conference. The hotel is in a great location! In walkable distance to the Magnificent Mile (full of shopping!) and also walking distance to the pier (lots of restaurants). The hotel itself was very nice. I loved the free made-to-order breakfast, as well as the free happy hour. I also recommend the restaurant located in the hotel. It is very good. The room was nice; very spacious and clean. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the price paid!”
Reviews.Author: AmeryinCO
Reviews.Content: Two adults, two children (ages 11 and 3) had a great time during our 6 night stay at the Embassy Suites Lakefront, Chicago, on the corner of Columbus Drive and Illinois Street. Excellent location for several activities. Found a terrific deal on Hotwire for only $86/night. While my hubby loaded the luggage cart, my 11 yr old took care of the 3 yr old and I checked in. I went back to the loading area for the kids and my hubby took the car a few blocks away to park at Millennium Garages which is far cheaper than the hotel's daily parking rate of $42. After I loaded the cart the bellman insisted on bringing it up for me and told me to go ahead, up to the room and relax, which we did. Less than 10 minutes later the cart arrived with a smile and he helped me unload it as well. Two double beds which were quite comfy, AC worked VERY well and was able to be adjusted to the digital temp of your choice. Amazing view from the 11th floor of downtown and right over Columbus Drive. Water pressure in shower VERY good,hot water warmed quickly. Mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker in room allowed us to keep sandwich fixings and drinks for meals. The living room (a second, separate room) has another TV in it along with pull out sofa bed, end table and desk for computer. Note: WIFI in the room is not included - costs $14.95 per day or $3.95 for an hour. Free internet access is available on the hotel computers on the business floor, and printer is also available there for printing boarding passes or directions to things. One of the best breakfast buffets for a hotel is inside the Embassy Suites Lakefront. The buffet area includes scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, fried potatoes, yogurt, fruit, donuts, pastries and toast in addition to all the beverages (coffee, tea, 3 different juices, sodas, milk). There is also a "cooked to order" line where you can get omelettes made to your specifications as well as biscuits and gravy and other items that are on the buffet. Recommend going EARLY. Hours are 6:30-9:30 Mon-Fri and 7:30-10:30 Sat-Sun. Going early allows you to avoid lines AND to find a table to eat at. Of course you could always take a tray and go back to your room, which some people did do. In the evenings there is the Manager's Reception from 5:30-7:30pm. Two alcoholic drinks (one at a time though) and snacks. Snacks varied from popcorn/pretzel mix, trail mix, chips and salsa, sweet potato fries, small chicken nugget bites. Just depended on the day. And for this event, the line starts around 5:20pm and get there early. by 5:35pm you will have 15 people ahead of you. Bring your room key and money to tip the bartender. It's only certain types of alcohol obviously, well drinks, beers on tap, that sort of thing. No premium liquor. One line is for beer/wine/sodas and the other line is for mixed drinks. I had a Cosmo and Mai Tai just to give an idea. The lady in front of me got a tequila sunrise. No blended drinks. Indoor pool only - no diving, deepest is 4 1/2 feet which worked well for us and our kids. Hot tub great too. Pool towels provided. Workout room had 3 ellipticals, a few treadmills, some free weights and bench press. Bring your iPod headphones to use the TV on the elliptical! Restaurant on bottom floor of hotel - PJ Clarkes - a tad expensive but entrees are sharable especially between kids. Across the street from hotel is Dominicks - a grocery store. Walgreens is about a block away. AMC Movie Theatre right next door. Beautiful atrium in center of hotel going all the way up 17 floors. Glass elevators, ran fast, never waited. Would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Experience of its own”
Reviews.Author: AarMumbai
Reviews.Content: This is the place for finest continental breakfast in the world. The Managers invite (6pm - 7 pm) is a unique experience which I have never seen in any of the restaurants in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: gadsbee
Reviews.Content: The suite was clean & roomy. The beds were sooooo comfortable. The breakfast in the morning was fabulous-we had made to order omelets with all the trimmings. Found all the service staff to be both friendly & accomadating.. Amy at the front desk was very patient & helpful when answering all my questions.

Reviews.Title: “A great fit for everyone!”
Reviews.Author: RINGar0undtheW0RLD
Reviews.Content: We just finished a family reunion that included 58 people from 6 months to 82 years young; from Beijing, Vermont, Illinois, Colorado and Montana; experienced to inexperienced travellers who stay at 5 star resorts, your and elder hostels or go on safari. This was truly an excellent experience for all attending. All were very impressed with the caliber of product and service offered. Clearly there is a cohesive, dedicated staff and it is apparent from pre-check-in to departure. We look forward to staying with you again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellingirl58
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 nights at this hotel and had a great time. The staff are very helpful, polite and friendly. Special mention for the bar staff who were kept very busy each evening at the Managers reception (We were there over Memorial weekend) but still had a smile and a friendly word for everyone and the breakfast staff who also worked very hard to keep the area clean and tidy. The breakfast was excellent, good choice and quality. The room was very clean and spacious,the bed comfy and bedding and pillows of a very high quality. Again, excellent staff worked very effectively and were very polite and friendly if you met them. We made use of the business centre daily which was small but adequate and complimentary. All in, I would highly recomment this hotel, has to be one of the best bargains in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: Ash1822
Reviews.Content: Good location, good breakfast. Gave us a smoking room when we reserved a non- smoking room. Check in was slow. Hotel could be kept up better. Sheets were dirty. Taking two different elevators was not convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dmc37
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Good Location - Walking distance to Magnificent Mile, Millenium Park and Navy Pier. There is a water taxi stop close by to take you to Sears Tower. 2. Free breakfast is not bad. 3. Free Internet at Business Center. Cons: 1. Didn't get the room I reserved. I wanted a room on a high floor, away from the elevator. Didn't get either. Maybe if I complained but that's not the point. Hilton is usually good with reservations. I didn't complain because we had been travelling all day, with a new born and I already carried all the luggage in the room. 2. If you don't pay for valet, you can't go in and out of parking structure. You also have to take 3 different elevators to get from parking to your room. It's not a long walk, but it's an inconvenience if you have alot of luggage and a baby. 3. Cleaning lady didn't clean our room one day. When we asked her what the deal was, she said it's because we had a do not disturb sign on our door and it was too late. Really? We got in late that day so again I was more interested in getting rest for us and baby than to complain. But I did make sure that no matter how late we wake up the next day the cleaning should do her damn job. I've had some good experiences with Hilton but this is definitely not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: auntchele
Reviews.Content: My mom and I went to Chicago for Mother's day. It was our first time in that great city. I loved the location of the hotel. It was within walking distance of major attractions. The room was decorated very nicely with contemporary furniture. We really enjoyed the full breakfast each morning. The hotel does a happy hour each night. I went one night just to check it out. I had a amaretto sour which was great. The day I was there they did not have much in the way of appetizers. Not sure if this is the norm or not. My mom walks with a cane and the staff was very wonderful and attentive to her.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Experience”
Reviews.Author: Valerae
Reviews.Content: My mother, sister and I recently stayed at the Embassy Lakefront for a little girls-only vacation. I cannot say enough about our experience. The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly, the pool area and weight room were very nice and the general atmosphere was lovely. The breakfast offered was phenomenal. Omelets were fixed to order, pancakes, warm syrup, fruit, bacon, sausage - plus the regular items you'd find at typical continental breakfasts were all available. I haven't enjoyed such a great breakfast since staying in Quebec (where complimentary breakfasts like this are more common in hotels). The nightly manager's reception was a lot of fun. Even if the line got a little long, it moved quickly and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. That was a great little treat in and of itself. We had a great deal on Hotwire and weren't sure what to expect since none of us had stayed at the Embassy before but we've already agreed to come back again next year. The location is close to great shopping and restaurants. I can't recommend it enough!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: whitney001
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago to celebrate my parents anniversary. We had stayed there several times but the rest of my family had not. They were all very happy with the choice. Rooms are spacious and have great views. There is something for everyone at the breakfast buffet. The happy hour is just pretzels and chips but it is a nice spot to relax before heading out for the night. The lines can be very long which is frustrating when they allow only one drink per person [ at a time]. I was most impressed with the complimentary champagne and cheese platter that the management had sent to my parents. Apparently the reservation clerk had heard my father mention the occasion. They were just delighted - it was such a pleasant surprise.. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best experience I've had!”
Reviews.Author: R-Pitty
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for my job. I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel during my 6 day (first time visit) to Chicago. From the moment the airport shuttle dropped me off the staff were nothing but friendly and curteous. there was someone to meet and direct me to the main lobby ( as you have to go up one floor to the lobby from the street). The lady at the front desk was cheerful and was able to give me a room on the top floor with a view of Navy Pier ( after I had explained to her that there were no tall buildings where I come from so I liked being up high!). The front desk was also very helpful in helping me to find shopping and other near by attractions (FYI make sure you check out the grocey store across the street, it's a great little shop!) The managers recption was a welcome social experience after a hard days work and the staff and bar tenders were very prompt. I never once waited in a line. The morning breakfast was out of this world! Like nothing I had seen as a complimentary breakfast before, and again, never waited more than 5 minutes in line for a made to order omlette. On top of all of that the hotel was spotless, the room was quiet and it was like a home away from home. I will most definately be keeping my eye out for more Embassy Suites in my travels. My one and only complaint was the cost of High Speed in your room. I don't pay 14.95$ for high speed ultra at home for a month, nevermind a day. Thank you so much to the staff of the Embassy Suites Lakefront, Chicago for making this my best stay ever at a hotel! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: steve7515
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Embassy Chicago Lakefront for a 3 day weekend with friends. Wanted a room that could accommodate three guys and a location downtown close to restaurants and the CTA trains, and the Embassy fit the bill perfectly! The hotel is about 4 blocks from the CTA subway Red Line Grand station. Also about a 5 min walk to the Magnificent Mile downtown area. If you're into Sushi, great restaurant just around the corner from the hotel...next to the AMC movie theaters. Navy Pier is about a 10 min walk. Checking in was a breeze. Very quick and friendly, and got the room I wanted...2 beds and a fold out couch. Room was a good size. Two TVs (LCD in living room area), and three, yes three sinks. Never saw that in a room this size, but was nice to have. Room also had a refrigerator. Inside the hotel is well kept and clean. The free morning breakfast was great! Saved us time and money. Omelets make to order, pancakes, bacon, cereal, donuts, fruit, juice...everything you need. Line can look a little long at times, but 10 or 15 min wait max...no complaints. Hotel also had a nice fitness center, pool, and business center. Didn't use the pool...no time. The business center was good to print out maps and boarding passes, but the network seemed very slow. They hotel has WiFi, but they wanted $15 a day which seemed steep to me considering most hotels give that to you now a days. But charging for the WiFi and giving you a great breakfast I guess cancels each other out. All in all I was very pleased with the Embassy and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lc_teach
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend girls' trip to Chicago and stayed at the Embassy Suites Downtown Lakefront. First of all, everyone working there greeted us daily with a smile and went out of their way to show us around. The manager's reception and cooked to order breakfast was a GREAT added touch. We will definitely return for another stay at this fine hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: LibragirlMissouri
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Contemporary, updated decor. Very clean. I loved having two rooms. We have a one year old and it gave her more room to roam. The microwave and refrigerator came in handy. The free breakfast and drinks were wonderful. It's in a great location. Walking distance to everywhere. The only glitch was when we checked in and valet parked. They said they would bring our luggage to our room. We waited a half hour and it still didn't show up. My husband had to go get it and he said it was just sitting there. He started taking it and then someone finally noticed and apologized and brought it up. Not a huge deal but my daughter needed changing and I didn't have her diaper bag. Other than that, it was a great stay and a very good hotel for families!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience - Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: jjsexton4679
Reviews.Content: From the moment my family and I stepped onto the property we experienced some of the best customer service I have ever experienced. The staff was helpful and prompt in each request we had. The room was wonderful with a beautiful view. The breakfast was full cook to order with anything you could want. We were visiting during Spring Break and were at the hotel on Easter morning. The breakfast area was very busy and I expected a long wait to get an omelete that morning, however I was pleasantly suprised at the quick service I received. During the breakfast time staff were constantly interacting with guests and ensuring that things were stocked and tables were cleared and cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is I tried!”
Reviews.Author: Fruittgirl
Reviews.Content: I attempted to make reservations at this hotel for the NRA Show this May 2010 and spoke with the Reservations Manager (Vanessa) about a certain promo that the online system was not accepting, she took my name and number and said she would call me back. The next day, I didn't hear from her, so the following day after that I called and was connected to her voicemail to leave a message, I left the message to please call me. She still to this day (3 weeks later) has not called me back. So, what does that tell me? It tells me that she doesn't want to deal with me as a prosective customer. So, if I am not a very important customer when making a reservation, how am I going to be important when I spend $315 per night to stay at their hotel? Being a hospitality student myself, I believe this is NOT the way to treat your customers, by ignoring them. Moving on to the "W" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly very good...”
Reviews.Author: mntripadv
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed a long weekend in Chicago and a comfortable stay at the Embassy Suites Downtown Lakefront - and appreciated being upgraded to a larger corner suite following inquiry upon arrival. Like many, we seek out Embassy Suites when traveling with the kids as you can't beat the suite rooms, free breakfasts, manager's receptions, and atrium space. There are 2 Embassy Suites in downtown Chicago very close to each other and I ultimately chose this one based on its 2008 remodel. Although nothing that follows spoiled our stay, here are my gripes having paid about $200/night: (1) The bathroom needed maintenance and housekeeping. The curved shower curtain rod was so loose that the curtain wouldn't stay closed on either end; grout along the top of the tub appeared mold-ready; floor tile never sparkled; tub faucet was loose; light bulb was out for days; toilet paper dispenser placement required you to be a contortionist to access it; and the absence of any venting fogged up the entire suite during showers leaving visible moisture everywhere. And, (2) despite the ES website touting new flatscreens in the living room areas, we had an old tube TV; (3) we waited over an hour for an extra blanket and pillow to be delivered for the kids sleeping on the pull-out sofa; (4) our food tray from room service (dirty dishes) sat out in the hall for 2 days; (5) the chlorine was too strong in the tiny pool; (6) the bar sink faucet was loose; (7) creamer packets for coffee weren't always replaced; (8) and there were never enough hand towels (there are 3 separate in-room sinks). Still, we rate ES Chicago Downtown Lakefront very good - and a little more "attention to the details" would have earned it excellent. (PS: Cheers to the hardworking bar staff during the nightly manager's reception!)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: rareuser
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this facility for 7 days last week and I have nothing but good things to say. I had my 3 and four years old girls with me and a group of 5 other women. The staff, the faciility, the accomodations were very nice. After only a couple days, the staff knew me and greeted me as if they were really glad to have me. The hotel is located close enough to everything you want to see but far enough away from the hustle and bustle that you're able to enjoy it. The breakfast and cocktail hour was a nice add on. I attended the breakfast each day and never had a problem with anything served. I travel for business a lot and would rate this as one of my top places to stay. I can't say enough about the staff! Kudos to them. My only complaint is that you have to pay for the internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility, though breakfast staffing too light.”
Reviews.Author: ChezTom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well maintained and a half dozen or so blocks from Navy Pier. We enjoy staying at Embassy Suites hotels when traveling since they offer a quite nice breakfast with your stay as opposed to a meager continental breakfast that most others offer. The staff working the breakfast did their best, but the hotel was obviously understaffed on the weekend we stayed. Nightly managers reception with complimentary drinks(both alcohol and non-alcohol) and chips/salsa. Parking approaches $50 per day for valet and $42 for park yourself. Warning: if you plan on driving the city while there and self park, your total fees WILL exceed valet rates. Best to park the car in a nearby lot for about $30.00 a day and use taxis for local trips. Lastly, internet runs ~$15/day...something that drives me nuts for a hotel that averages between $130-$150 a night and that much lower brands offer complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: daft-duck50
Reviews.Content: stayed at the embassy suites for 9 nights arrived new years eve,hotel was packed, check in was no problem, the room i booked into was fantastic, spacious ,spotlessly clean and very quite, only problem i had on my stay was i was charged $50 for overnight parking( i didn't have a car) but when i complained at reception the bill was removed, reception staff were very helpful and friendly, cleaning staff were great and quite (no banging doors etc etc) breakfast was really great, lots of choice and plenty of room,waiting staff were also great, very friendly and efficient, hotel location was great short walk to shopping ,dining and metro, one of the best hotels i have stayed ever

Reviews.Title: “Okay - But Not As Good As The Other Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: Vauban
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a few Embassy Suite Hotels - in Washington DC, in Monteray Bay CA, and in New York. We're a family of five, with three young boys. So finding a room for five is never easy, and the ESH chain are always accommodating. This one, whilst presentationally impressive, has a few flaws that made this less good than the others, in my humble opinion. The Good Things: - Big room, smart decoration throughout hotel, and good room facilities (microwave and fridge); - Friendly and helpful staff; - Good value for money - we paid about $300 for two nights' stay The Less Good Things - Really thin walls - we were unlucky that we had a noisy family next door. But even when their kids weren't shouting, you could hear everything. I think this is a pretty dire problem, especially if you sleep lightly. Everytime their room door shut, our room shook! - Breakfast was a bit disappointing - no fruit salad on the first morning (just oranges and bananas in a bowl), and a selection that generally compared badly with other ESHs we have stayed at. - No mugs at breakfast or in the room. Everything was polystyrine cups, which is not how I want my coffee in the morning - unless I am on a building site. And a lot of the cutlery was disposable plastic too. Not very environmentally friendly. But also generally just not very nice. - Huge Qs for the complimentary evening drinks - it took a good ten minutes to get a (small) drink from the bar. Which made the whole Managers Reception thing a bit of a drag. We didn't bother the second evening (when the Qs were just as bad). They really do need more bar staff for the rush hour. I felt a bit cheated. The Verdict If you need a room for 5, this isn't a bad option at all. But if your personal circumstances mean you don't, I'd recommend looking elsewhere. I think you can get better, especially in the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WiscDoll
Reviews.Content: My mom and I just arrived home from our trip to Chicago where we stayed at the Embassy Suites Downtown/Lakefront. Love this place! I stayed here about six years ago with friends and it was nice then, and it's still very nice now. My mom and I had reserved a room elsewhere for this trip, but decided it was worth a little extra money to stay at the Embassy Suites. We were able to check in early (at 10:30 a.m. on a very busy Saturday morning) with no questions asked and were given a spacious room on the 16th floor with two double beds. The beds were so comfortable; we crashed in them after a long day of shopping! Bathrooms are fairly large for a downtown hotel. There was a little wear and tear in our bathroom, but nothing terrible - just a little wallpaper peeling off in one of the corners. Had large, fluffy towels in the bathroom as well. Oh, and love the complimentary manager's reception and cook-to-order breakfast. Both were busy on Saturday night, but the lines moved fairly quickly and the staff was friendly. In fact, everyone at this hotel was friendly and polite. And the location can't be beat - just two blocks off Michigan Avenue! I definitely hope to stay here again on my next trip to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and experience”
Reviews.Author: osulou
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel and exceptional staff made our trip a very memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but ripoff rates for internet service”
Reviews.Author: venthost
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for several days over Christmas. The room and service were fine. We paid for valet parking ($49 per night) which allows in-and-out service. My big gripe is that they charge $15 per day for an Internet connection. I had two teenagers, both with laptop computers. That would have cost $15 per computer which is unreasonalble. Comparable hotels in the same area are Homewood Suites and Residence Inn both which offer free wireless Internet. I will never stay here again because of the ripoff rates for Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: no1saluki
Reviews.Content: I book a room via a discount hotel website so I got a great deal. I live in Chicago and wanted to plan a short downtown staycation with the family to do something different. Other reviewers commented on the attentiveness of the staff and I agree. The valet and bellstand folks were very attentive and took the time to greet me and the family and moved quickly to tend to our needs. The breakfast crew were helpful and courteous, taking the time to explain everything to us. The free breakfast is amazing! Cooked to order, all you can eat breakfast included with the room rate? Now that's a great value! They also have a free evening reception with snacks and drinks, which is also great. Crowded, but great. Our room wasn't ready when I attempted to check-in around 3:30. The front desk person took my cell phone number and promised me a call but I never received one. Good thing I didn't wait around forever. They also had two people working the desk with a very long line waiting to check-in and the auto check-in machine was broken so expect long lines for check-in in the afternoon. I don't care for hotels that require me to take an elevator to the lobby from the ground level only to make me walk across the lobby to find the elevators to the rooms. I prefer to walk-in from the street but in downtown, I suppose I can't have everything. The valet and drop off lane was hard to find and very busy. It's a small tunnel with a single park lane and driveway off to the side which was often blocked with parked cars. The valets work hard to move things quickly but it's easy to get trapped in there for awhile. The room was very spacious! I had two double beds and there was also a sofa bed in the living room, which I slept on. Wouldn't do that again! The regular beds are very comfortable but the sofa bed is like every other-- very uncomfortable. Every room has a window looking out to the atrium with plantation shutters. The shutters don't keep out the light from the hallway so if you like your sleeping room dark, it will be best to nix the sofa bed and sleep in the bedroom. You can also hear a lot of noise from the outside hallway (at least in my room) so just keep that in mind. Room service was quick and attentive and the food wasn't bad at all. They even had a salmon kids dinner, which my son gobbled up. Healthy food for kids? Nice work Embassy Suites. Oh and valet parking is steep-- $49. But you have in/out privleges till 6pm the day of check out. So, it may seem expensive but being able to take your car in and out til 6pm the day of check out is a pretty decent deal.

Reviews.Title: “The support staff is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: girlplusthree
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending two nights at this hotel, and we had a great time there. It was perfect for our needs, and we were very comfortable. The #1 thing that stands out in my mind from our time there was how attentive and capable the people who worked at the breakfasts and the men who worked at the bell station were. Both groups of people stand out in my mind as being fantastically hard workers and great at their jobs. Each morning at breakfast, there were many, many workers who were there to clean tables, help people carry their trays, remove dishes, refill juice glasses...anything that they saw needed to be done or would make one's breakfast more enjoyable. Every worker at the breakfast was so kind, helpful, and attentive. Each morning, I was amazed at how hard they all worked and how many of them there were. They each went above and beyond--they didn't just clean off tables--they did that (extremely promptly) PLUS so much more, even things that I'm sure probably weren't in their specific job description. I was just so impressed. The men at the bell station were also so kind and helpful. Each time I entered the hotel from coming inside, I was greeted with a sincere and friendly "welcome back!" or "how are you?" They were right on top of helping us get cabs. We never waited more than a second to be tended to, even when they were very busy. Overall, the hotel seemed to be very well-staffed in areas that are often underrated or overlooked. That made our visit so pleasant. There were other very nice things about the hotel, but these two things were notable. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay at the Embassy Suites!”
Reviews.Author: travelingal736
Reviews.Content: We love Chicago and travel there about 2 or 3 times a year for 2 to 3 nights each trip. We have stayed at the Embassy Suites in the past and absolutely love it there. The location is perfect for us, the rooms are larger and more comfortable than any room we have found in the downtown area, and we love the manager's reception at night and full breakfast in the morning! We stayed at the hotel between Dec. 12th-14th this trip and had another great stay! We especially want to thank Melissa at the front desk for choosing an awesome room for us on the 14th floor which had a great view of some high-rise condos and the lake front! Thank you Embassy Suites and we look forward to our return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and services”
Reviews.Author: JeanetteNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We visited Chicago for the first time from New Zealand and very much enjoyed our stay. Breakfasts and drinks at night were a great plus as was being able to do our laundry. The rooms very large, clean and ours had a great view. The receptionist was very helpful and let us book in early, and the lady who welcomed us into breakfast was so lovely she made our day. The hotel was close to everything, but we also appreciated being able to eat in P J Clarke's when the weather was too bad to go out. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: NikkiG1133
Reviews.Content: Loved it! One of my favorite hotel's that we have stayed at in Chicago. Great room, great breakfast, great location. Everyone we came in contact with was so pleasant. The lobby was beautiful. The room in nicely updated - and breakfast was delicious. Hopefully we get a chance to stay here in the future and most defiantly will recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you'd expect, no dissapointments”
Reviews.Author: ccs4756
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to its billing. It has a friendly staff, clean rooms, good complimentary breakfast, and a handy manager's reception nightly. The facility is well maintained, well appointed and almost feels like a luxury hotel. The "suite" layout is ideal for a family vacation, especially with children who still need naps or go to sleep at night early, because the bedroom and living room are separate. The location is fair, depending on your itinerary. Yes, Navy Pier is three blocks away and the Magnificent Mile is two blocks away; however, the red line of the L-train is 5 blocks away (closest station). There is a free trolley running on Illinois St and Grand Ave. at least on the weekend between Navy Pier and the Grand/State station; Embassy Suites is directly between these. The cost is fair, as well. It would be nicer for hotel guests to pay less for parking, but I'm sure they charge what the market will bear. The actual room rate is competitive, if not slightly superior to other hotels in the area. Dominick's supermarket is directly across Columbus Ave if you need supplies, but you should also consider Fox & Obel (one block toward Navy Pier on Illinois St) if you like a more up-market selection. They also have reasonably priced brown box meals to go, which are a nice contrast to the typical deep dish or deep fried vacation food.

Reviews.Title: “Among the Worst Hotel Experiences”
Reviews.Author: irvineoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a conference in late Oct 2009. I have some experiences to share: 1. This hotel has extremely bad cell reception throughout. My colleagues and I can't hear each other when calling from each other''s room, or calling from lobby to the rooms. I nicely pointed out this problem to the front desk supervisor ( no manager on duty at 8am in the morning), all she can say was "sorry" without ever acknowledge the problem. 2. Spoke with front desk twice trying to get some help on restaurant information reservation. The first night when I called, asked them to help me make a reservation about the Webber's restaurant. I was told that "on a Wed night, you don't need reservation for a party of three - just walk-in you will get a table". So my colleagues and I "walked - in", and it is a 45 mins wait. Apparently, nearly every night is like that. The second day, I tried to get some information about a good restaurant that I can take a client to. Again, they don't know anything, take a long time just to find out a phone number for a restaurant's (Shuler Steakhouse) which just across the street from them. 3. On my first day there, I tried to call the front desk by dialing "0". First try, maybe 15 rings, no one answered. Second try, after 10 rings, someone answered. I politely asked the girl if I should call a different extension to reach the front desk directly as I have been trying. The girl rudely said " I answered now" without even apologizing. 4. Although the room is pretty nice, the hall ways leading to my room smells bad. 5. On the plus side, they do have free breakfast in the morning, and free happy hour drinks in the evening. I stayed at many hotels. The hotel has good "hardware" - rooms, lobby, etc. What they absolutely lacking is management, and employee training. By the way, their rates are not cheap, and very comparable with the Marriott which is .3 miles away, and beats their services quality by 200%. I will not stay at any Embassy hotels if I can help it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaAngie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights on a family trip to Chicago. This hotel is in a great location - only a few blocks from Navy Pier and Michigan Avenue. The rooms were nice and clean - nothing special. The waits for food and the cocktail reception could be really long with people grabbing tables as quick as possible. However, for a free buffet - I shouldn't really complain! : ) We did the average "stuff" in Chicago - Navy Pier, Michigan Avenue, American Girl store, Lego store, Sears Tower and John Hancock Building. We took the water taxi from Navy Pier to Sears (Willis) Tower, which was fun for my son and more enjoyable than a taxi. We realized coming back that if we took the water taxi to Michigan Avenue - it was only a two block walk to our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever - won't stay here again !”
Reviews.Author: norecommendation
Reviews.Content: While traveling on business as a meeting planner, upon checking in, the extremely rude front desk said my pre-paid reservation for 4 nights had been cancelled by Orbitz.. After an hour of negotiations, that proved not to be true and we were given a smoking room because they said that's all they had (after they told us the hotel was sold out!). The morning of the 4th day, we found a check out notice under our door, and after another 30 minutes of negotiations, they allowed us to stay the 4th night. I had planned on bringing a group to Chicago in 2011 for a convention, however, because of this experience, I wouldn't even consider it! The hotel is lovely, but the staff does not come up to par!

Reviews.Title: “My bag "disappeared" from a locked Bellman's closet, hotel was very unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: Winsomelife
Reviews.Content: I had probably the worst hotel experience ever here. Before I even checked in, my carryon bag with everything I needed most was stolen from the bell closet and no one there really seemed to take it seriously. Early when I had moved some things in and out of the bag while accompanied by a bellman, everything seemed fine until I came back to retreive my bags and the most important one with my laptop,camera, jewelry,car key, medicine, etc had been removed from the middle of a pile of three bags...very suspicious. AND to add insult to this, the hotel insurance says they are not responsible abover $250...BE VERY CAREFUL HERE, they do not seem to care about their guests or the safety of their belongings. I arrived on a Sunday and it was when I was leaving on Tuesday evening that the security officer handed me his card as I was getting in my cab for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: Bojack10EC
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel - recently remodeled, friendly staff, delicious breakfast, great location (many rooms have view of Lake Michigan). Front desk staff very helpful in extending reservation for an additional night. Breakfast staff & mini mart staff very helpful and friendly. Conveniently located within short walk to Magnificent Mile & Navy Pier. Chicago trolley stop next to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Much improved”
Reviews.Author: lovetootrvl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suites in August of 2009. It was TERRIBLE! What could go wrong it did. At checkout they compensated me for some of it, and assured me that my next visit in Sept would be better. I decided to give it one more try, and it was WONDERFUL. I was told that only a handful of the same employees were there and they were dedicated to making a turn around. This has everything going for it, made to order breakfast, evening reception and location.

Reviews.Title: “great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saginaw_MIMImomof2
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites was definitely ideal for families with small children. The location of the hotel to the Magnificent Mile and Navy Pier couldn't have been better. We knew the kids, age 3 and 5, wouldn't be up for walking too much which is why this hotel was chosen. The complimentary made-to-order breakfast was great. We saved so much money on that alone that it made the hotel choice worthwhile. Overall, we were very satisfied with Embassy Suites and would definitely choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient with Children”
Reviews.Author: MarcFrenchNY
Reviews.Content: Overall very good experience, went there with 2 kids aged 5 and 3, suites are definitely convenient for families, and very clean, no real surprise like any embassy suite on the downside, I can mention that it was very crowdy for breakfast (not too mention a 20mins waiting line to get freshly cooked omelettes), there were no bagels though it was not bad at all. Also, they charged me $15 for a 24hr internet connection which I found a bit steep.. on the upside, there is an indoor pool which seemed nice but did not have time,,,

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff / Great Location / Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: NYMETS1986
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Embassy Suites Chicago Downtown Lakefront and everything was terrific. The staff at check-in, bell hop, valet and bartenders were all very friendly and readily available. The breakfast buffet was very good and not too crowded if you go early. The manager's reception in the evening was great and the bartenders were terrific. On checkout the bell hop offered to get us a cab to the airport for $45 (that's the going rate) but when the cab was late they offerred us a full-stretch limo instead for the same price! The kids really enjoyed that. I would recommend this hotel for both families and business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy room & great view, but noise and crowd issues”
Reviews.Author: jengaworld
Reviews.Content: Spacious room and a fab, partial lake view. Watched the Navy Pier fireworks from the bedroom window -- sweet! Noise was a problem. Paper thin walls -- TV and conversations on either side were so loud that other guests might as well have been in the room with us. I don't think it was our neighbors' fault -- I could even hear sneezes, the walls have no soundproofing. Service was spotty. While the front desk was great, the housekeeping staff skipped our room one day. The Manager's Reception was a zoo -- at least 50 people in line in front of us both nights, and a fairly surly woman pouring drinks once we finally made it to the bar. We'd probably stay here again for the super location and spacious rooms w/fridge and microwave. But honestly I would trade the breakfast and drinks hour for better soundproofing and free Wi-Fi. (Internet = $14.95/day, ouch!)

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: ShivasIrons
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on Hotwire for only $108/night, which really was a steal. The hotel is in a very good location and the rooms were quite nice, but front desk service was really lacking. I was there for a four night stay, and for three of those days my keycard wouldn't give me access to my room, forcing the desk to call security each time to let me into their room. Things break, that I understand, but still not fixed three days later? Unacceptable. To top it off, not once did the front desk even offer an apology for the problem, and this was dealing with multiple front desk staff due to the many times I needed to be let into my room. They just stated very matter of factly that their card system wasn't working properly and security would have to let me into the room. I don't expect them to bend over backwards apologizing, but a simple "we're sorry for the inconvenience" would have been nice. Would I stay there again? Yes, because the price was right and it was a good location, but I just wouldn't be expecting much from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good for kids, some service challenges”
Reviews.Author: Adventravler
Reviews.Content: My wife and 4 1/2 yo daughter stayed here during one of the busiest summer weekends- The air and water show. First of all, the location is great. It is easy to walk to Navy Pier, the beach, Michigan Avenue, even with a youngster. The hotel is just a few years old and is holding up well. We paid extra for a lakeview room but, because of the number of high rises around it, probably not worth the extra expense. The rooms, as with all Embassy's we've stayed at, are spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was very good and they had an amazing omelet chef who was fun just to watch as he cranked out special order after special order. On the service side they were a bit challenged. I recognize that this was a big weekend and they were packed but feel they should have known this as well and planned for it more. Front desk waits, happy hour lines over 100 feet long and luggage check out all took time away from our holiday in Chicago. They also only had the concierege available for part of the day. Two times we were looking for advice and help and because the concierge was 'off-duty' we would have had to wait in line to get a suggestion.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hilton property”
Reviews.Author: 52clr
Reviews.Content: Check in went smoothly. We were able to check in early, however because the hotel was completely sold out we were given a smoking room. The room was very warm and stuffy although the thermostat was sent at the lowest setting.When maintenance arrived and pulled the font of the unit off the air filter was so filthy it looked like it had not been changed for years. The quality of air in the room was very poor. The bathroom was very dirty with only bare amenities. There was 1 bar of soap, 1 bottle of shampoo and no hair dryer. Over all the hotel was not very clean. The chairs in the breakfast area were very dirty. Carpets were stained and food trays left in the hall ways for extended periods of time. There was no concierge and no one at the front desk could answer any questions. The quality of this hotel has really gone done hill in the last few years. I have stayed here on a least 6 occasions in the past because of the good location but because of the poor service and the lack of cleanliness I will not return. Perhaps I'm expecting too much from Embassy Suites, but at one time this was a pretty nice hotel to stay at. It appears that they need a major renovation of the rooms and common areas as well as improvement in overall customer service. Hilton should be ashamed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: susie6505
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites over Labor Day weekend for a wedding. We are HHonors Diamond Members. We had a top floor 1 bedroom suite (17th floor). The elevators were the fastest elevators I have ever been on. Never had to wait more than 2 minutes. The room was extremely comfortable. There was a queen sofa sleeper in the living room with a TV. The bedroom had a King bed with another TV. We used the valet for parking. Not happy with the $49.00 day parking, but MOST of the hotels downtown Chicago charge about that much. Service was perfect. Loved the Managers reception 5:30pm to 7:00pm every night, snacks with free cocktails. The breakfast in the morning was great. It was crowded, but it was a holiday weekend. We did not have any trouble finding a seat. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel. You are close to EVERYTHING! We did the Architecture Cruise http://www.chicagoline.com/ which was within walking distance from the hotel. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: kate055
Reviews.Content: This is with doubt one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at, it was our first visit to Chicago, we booked through hotwire and got it for 100$ per night.THe location is brilliant the complimentary breakfast was excellent we never had to queue, the 2 hour free drinks was great and you could order what ever you wanted. The staff were friendly and efficent, small swimming pool was fit for purpose, rooms are large and spotless clean,we viisted over labour day weekend and it was busy but this is a well run hotel and we never felt stressed. I cannot reccomend this hotel enough and we have stayed in many around the world, we definitley visit Chicago again it is a wonderful city with wonderful people. WE went to see the jersey boys it was brilliant it closes in Jan so if you are in Chicago dont miss it, Sullivans steak house food excellent , give PF Changs a miss this one not up to usual standard, P clarkes connected to hotel food ver good and good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Such a Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicole222
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Hotel Chicago Downtown for a girls weekend. We had a great time, everyone on the staff was VERY friendly. We actually had a large number of us in the room, which was not a problem because the rooms are a decent size. The staff was very accomodating when we needed more towels, blankets, etc. There is a great free breakfast in the hotel lobby. It has made-to-order omelets, plus everything else a person could want. The consierge was very helpful, told us where to go, what to walk to and where to take cabs. The hotel is in a great location, we walked everywhere. Michigan Avenue, Navy Pier, Weber Grill for dinner. We would highly reccomend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, complimentary breakfast, expensive internet”
Reviews.Author: Simopel
Reviews.Content: I was there for 3 nights for a conference. The check in process was quick and the staff was very friendly. The suite was very big but almost no space for the hanging clothing or the luggage. It was clean but there were also some stains from prior leaks which could have been cleaned or renovated. The wireless internet cost 14,95 a day and is veeeeery slow. Not worth... There is complimentary breakfast wich is really good, rich, even with cook to order. This can save you a lot of money if you like to have breakfast every morning. The staff was always very nice and helpful. They have a business center which is free of charge to use. The air condition in the lobby and in our conference room was a bit of a problem. it was very cold. Between 60 and 65. Especially when you come from the outside this cannot be very healthy. We made all (from the conference) complaints but it didnt change. Not sure if something was broken of if they ignored us. However the hotel has some signs of the age and could be updated in some areas. The location is great, withing walking distance to Navy Pier and other attractions. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: HospitalityKid
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Embassy for Market Days with some friends and loved the location and the look of the property. I had a similar problem with checking in early as one of the other reviewers. I checked the night before we checked in to make sure that the hotel had rooms available the night before we checked in which meant vacant ready rooms for the early afternoon on the day we were arriving. We arrived at the hotel around 1230pm and were advised that there were no rooms ready and we would have to come back at 3pm, and we were also told that we would have to carry all of our bags back downstairs to Bell Services ourselves to leave with the plethora of other luggage crowding the entrance. I did call the hotel shortly after we left to eat before coming back, and the person on the phone informed me that they did have clean rooms available and a person could walk in to get a room and checkin now, which was kind of irritating. I did not want to make a fuss so I let it go. We came back at 3 and our room was ready. The room was very spacious and nicely appointed, great view from the 17th floor. Housekeeping was efficient and never bothered us when we were in our room, we did however have to call down 4 times for extra towels, and after an hour they met us halfway down the hallway to get them. Breakfast was plentiful and lots of tasty variety. It can be crowded but the service staff was on top of turning tables around as other guests left. The manager's reception was better in the way of drinks than the Embassy in Rosemont, but the snacks were still a little lacking, 2 kinds of similar snack mix and tortilla chips just don't do it for me all the time. Pool and hot tub area were nice, a little small but perfectly functional for the space, it didnt feel crowded. Beds were comfortable and location was great in relation to Michigan Avenue, and only a couple of blocks from the Red Line station at Grand. Overall it was a good stay, and I would stay again. Watch your bill though, on checkout they tried to charge us 49$ for Valet parking, for one day, when we took the bus into the city, so after a couple of questions of "are you sure you didnt have a car?" they removed the charge. Good property with a great location, just some minor service issues. Will most likely be staying again in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: Cincy2
Reviews.Content: I was able to obtain a good rate for this hotel through Hotwire. I then had called the hotel to request a King room in a quieter area of the hotel. At checkin you need to be watchful for the hotel entrance on Illinois St. It's easy to miss this driveway. The driveway was extremely congested upon our arrival. My son and I managed all of our luggage ourselves and went up the elevator to the hotel lobby to check in. We were placed in a room on the 6th floor, which is actually the first floor for rooms. Our room was clean and ready for us as requested. We stayed for 3 days and yes, by far the majority of the guests were families with children or reunion type groups. This is not the place for a quiet get away for couples. The breakfast was fine and certainly offered plenty to eat. I don't think it's worth the wait to stand in the long line for your "cooked to order omelet". All the other side dishes are the same as offered on the two buffet lines. Yes, it was crowded, but workable. Instead of paying the $42/night to park our car at the Embassy Suites we used the parking lot just caddy corner from the Embassy Suites on Illinois for $29/night. Be sure to go to the grocery store (Dominick's) directly across the street from the hotel to purchase your CTA bus cards. $5.75/24 hours of unlimited bus and train travel- great for getting around town easily. From the outside you can't tell Dominicks is a grocery store- look for the Starbucks. The hotel's location is ideal as you can easily walk to Michigan Ave. or down to Millennium Park. On a personal note: I discovered after we checked out that I had left my purse in the room. Panicked I called the hotel and was told that Security would take care of looking for my purse. Sure enough, upon my return they did indeed have my purse waiting for me. I was so grateful!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mercedesc300
