Reviews.Content: I should have know the charcter of this hotel, by when we pulled up to check in.......There was tons of tons of luggage left in the hotel driveway on the curb. That was my first sign, but I ignored thinking a large group must have just arrived. Then inside the hotel was more luggage, against my better judgment I left my luggage with bellmen. Which he assured me that it would be brought up to my room as soon as I get checked in. Well, that never did happen...I was then told at check in my luggage will be right up. 2 hours later before I received my luggage...I was so upset, after calling and calling get one excuse after another. Then, I did not know the Embassy Suites is now a kids hotel, I would have never stayed, there was hundreds of kids running around, playing on escalators, no parents, no hotel security supervising these kids, I finally had to tell a couple of them to stop running and playing on the esclators and elevators, it was horrible. Then the room, it was horrible, left over container of food in my room, strong odor, I moved rooms, but the hotel staff was not very nice. Got through that, the next room, well it also spelled bad, not very clean, no coffee pot, no hand towels, I mean does the maid not check these rooms, basic stuff. I would never stay there again and would not recommend this hotel. Even though the location is a good one, it's not worth it, I would spend more to be at a upscale hotel. Oh, upon requesting bellman to get my luggage because we would store our luggage since we had a early evening flight. Well, by time I got to the lobby, what do I see but my luggage outside security door, in front of elevator, anyone could have walk out of the hotel with my luggage, no security, no bellman. I was so upset, they had no explanation, I then had to stay there until I saw my luggage get locked up inside their security luggage room, They really need to find a method to handling baggage, and they need to review their staff's task...One last thing, I heard a maid walking in the hall using foul language....Do they not get training any longer, customer service is horrible...... Oh, one other comment....The so called free breakfast, was terrible, filty, out of food, out of coffee, you get there between the times they tell you is best and they told everyone else that was the best time also, so it is full, lines everywhere, people food trays left on tables, no clean spot to sit down at, and again kids running all over the place....Just a horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: travelerj317
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice. The room was spacious & tastefully decorated. There was a good variety of food on the breakfast buffet although I thought it was a little odd that there were no bagels nor muffins. The hotel was in a good location & close to bus stops. We were able to take the bus all over the downtown area. The only negative we experienced was that all of our keys would not work when we got back to our room the first night. They gave us new room keys & told us to keep them away from any cell phones & credit cards. I've never had a hotel tell me that before. My key only worked that one time. I didn't bother getting a new key again. I kept the key in the same place in my purse that I have kept other hotel keys & this is the first hotel I've ever had a key problem. Otherwise, we had an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: AnaVeronica
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Rooms are huge and so is the bathroom. This cleaning service was awesome. The complimentary breakfast was much better than I expected and there was plenty of food at all times. I did also liked very much teh manager's reception. You could have free drinks for two hours and also snacks! The staff was always willing to help, they sure made my stay very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: disneyfans48
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. Located a couple blocks away from miracle Mile and the Navy Pier, there is plenty of shopping and dining opportunities. 2 grocery stories are within a block and with refrigerators and microwaves in the room, you can save a little money. The free breakfast is great but not very accessible for wheelchairs. Service staff didn't seem to care. But that was the only example of poor service. Everything else was great. The lack of free Internet was disappointing for the price of the hotel. Rooms are spacious and well decorated. The sky lounge is several floors up, located over a bowling alley and movie theaters but you'd never know it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly nice stay”
Reviews.Author: GarfieldScotland
Reviews.Content: Found staff to be helpful, we checked in rather late but that did not cause any problems. Rooms were of a very good size with two queen beds and a double sofa bed in the lounge area. Very modern and clean. Excellently situated for Navy Pier and the bus for downtown stops at the back of the hotel. Agree with other reviewers about the breakfast. As it is free, there were huge queues and although the range of foods was extensive, the food was often lukewarm. Used by many families, but this was not a problem for us with noise not being an issue. Would be more than happy to stay there again when I go back to further explore the great city of Chicago. If exploring the city by public transport, be sure to buy a pass, 3 days cost only $14, a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Hunnybee73
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! We are huge fans of Embassy Suites anyway -- and this one didn't disappoint us. We took Amtrak into town so we didn't have to worry about the parking price -- but you will pay that price anywhere you stay downtown. What I loved the most was the location. You are so close to things -- Dominick's (a beautiful grocery store w/a Starbucks inside), Walgreens, AMC movie theater, and a bowling alley. Also, you are within 10 to 15 minutes walking to Michigan Ave. shopping in one direction and Navy Pier the other direction. We also enjoyed P.J. Clarke's restaurant adjacent to the hotel. At first I was disappointed that they didn't have a kids' menu. But, they had a few very kid-friendly selections on their adult menu -- cheeseburger, grilled cheese (my kids' choice -- it was superb!), pasta, etc. And, they did have crayons and a placemat to color and games to play on the back. The staff was wonderful -- and VERY accomodating! I was also pleasantly surprised at the pool. When I looked at it on the website it looked like a true lap pool -- well, it is but wider than a single-lap lap pool. It was amazing how many kids were in that pool -- and it didn't seem like they were on top of each other. My son and I also used the fitness room and were very pleased with that. All in all -- an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not Pleased”
Reviews.Author: rkimberly
Reviews.Content: Coming into Chicago on late night train with kids so made reservations well in advance. Arrived at hotel to find the only room they had left was a smoking room. They have you over a barrell with tired kids at midnight. The room was nasty, stinky and we all felt dirty. The pull out sofa bed is one of the worst I've ever slept on -- the mattress must be less than 2 inches thick and all smelly night long I felt every bar in the bed. The next morning our toilet was stopped up and wouldn't flush at all. Breakfast was a madhouse and although it was plentiful, nothing was very good. The coffee was bad. The eggs were cold. I guess the fruit was ok. We were told we could change rooms to a non-smoking this morning so we packed everything and took it downstairs at about 9:00 AM. We told the front desk staff that we were leaving for the day and we were told we would have a non-smoking room when we returned. We had to take our bags down to the lobby level and leave them with the bellman. All of this just took time as we had to wait in line for both things. Upon returning at 3:30 we went to the bell stand and were told we would have to go up to the lobby and see if we had a room (why can't they just call since we're already checked in?) We went upstairs and had to wait in line and when we finally got to the desk, we had not been assigned a room. The clerk messed with the computer for about 10 minutes and finally assigned a room. We were told the bell staff would bring our luggage. 45 minutes later, still no luggage. We called the bell stand and they said they would get it right away and the brought it right up -- I don't think the desk even notified the bell staff. After a nap we were getting ready to go back out and I noticed there isn't even a hair dryer---called to have a hairdryer brought up. 45 minutes later, no hair dryer. To avoid wasting even more or our vacation time dealing with this incompetent staff, I showered and left for Navy Pier with wet hair. After arriving back at the hotel, I called the front desk to bring the hair dryer and explained I had requested one earlier and it hadn't arrived --I asked to have it brought up, along with 2 glasses. The clerk didn't offer any apology for the earlier inconvenience and responded with a tone that made it seem like she was inconvenieced by the request. She just said, "I'll tell someone" About 30 minutes later the requested items arrived. This place is nothing special, but the staff just seems incompetent and unconcerned about guest satisfaction. The rooms are ok, but they just don't feel very clean. I'm in the hotel room right now and unfortunately, I have to stay here tonight, but never again. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: MichiganMomof3
Reviews.Content: I was in town for the weekend with my mom and two daughters for our annual girls trip to Chicago. I had tried to book the State St. Embassy Suites, where we stayed last year, but they would only let me use my Hilton points at this location. We arrived in the morning and pre-registered for our room where they reserved a lake view room for us. This made me happy as I am all about the view! The decor here is modern, which is not my taste , so it seems a little cold. The location is very good--close to Navy Pier and close to Michigan Ave, so we spent Friday afternoon shopping. There is also a great grocery store across the street that has everything you would need. When we came back, our room was ready. All was in order...looked clean and lake view as promised. The first night we took advantage of the free cocktail hour. Choices were limited, but hey, it's free. We walked to Volare' for a yummy Italian dinner, then came back to the hotel to watch tv. My girls (ages 14 and 11) were going to swim in the pool, but complained that it was too small and didn't go in. It looks more like a lap pool, but too crowded to ever swim laps. The furniture in the living area was in good condition, but not especially comfortable to relax in. The pull-out bed is extremely uncomfortable, so don't plan to sleep there unless you are a small child. Also, the walls are thin, which we discovered at 3am when our noisy neighbors rolled in. Saturday morning we got up and arrived at breakfast at 9am--the same time as the majority of the other guests at the hotel. They advise you to eat early, and we learned our lesson as lines were very long. The food was actually very good though, especially the omelettes. The day was spent seeing the Art Institute, Mary Poppins, then out to dinner. We arrived back at the room in time to watch the Sat. night fireworks (off Navy Pier) from our window. Very cool! Sunday was a beautiful day and we walked over to Millenium Park and hung out before catching the train home. Overall, our hotel stay was good. I love Chicago and always have fun here, but have stayed at better places. It is a great value though, especially if you take advantage of the free cocktails and breakfast. If you are debating between the two Embassy Suites, the State St. one would be my pick, although it is a little more expensive. It is just a little more comfortable and friendlier, although no lake view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Value in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: gherkins
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Embassy Suites Downtown lakefront. The free breakfast in the morning is amazing, as are the free drinks during the manager's evening reception. The location is great, between Michigan Ave and Navy Pier. Rooms are very large, especially for downtown Chicago. Parking is expensive, but it's that price everywhere. Pool is small, but you are not staying there for the pool. Staff are wonderful here. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Chicago stay.”
Reviews.Author: tembo
Reviews.Content: We booked the Conrad hotel for 2 nights but when we arrived we were told our reservation had been changed to the Embassy Suites Lakefront. We didn't feel too happy about it but the staff were extremely helpful, they arranged a taxi to transfer us (and paid for it) when we arrived at the Embassy Suites the staff were expecting us and we were quickly checked in to suite no. 1129. The Conrad hotel later phoned to check everything was okay. We had a good view of the lake, the window has a wide ledge you can sit on and admire the view. The complimentary evening drinks and snacks and also breakfast were a surprise for us and we made good use of them. Breakfast was particularly good with a chef making hot food to order. We loved all the space we had in the suite and the bed was SO comfortable. I would definitely recommend staying there when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: faguado
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in April. Features include big, clean rooms with comfy beds. Very good bathroom and shower. Very elegant inside and out. Very good location, 1-2 blocks from bus routes. Breakfast was the highlight for this trip (really good omelette's). Dominick's located across the street, Walgreen's and wine store behind the hotel. Need to improve: remote control did not work and was never replaced (complaint submitted on day of arrival), and the sofa bed was truly designed for small kids (no adults should be allowed to sleep there). Otherwise, an excellent option for Chicago visitors.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY PERFECTION”
Reviews.Author: jamaicalover
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to Chicago for Easter w/e via The Cleveland/Chicago Megabus. We arrived in front of the train station on Union Avenue. We stayed at the Embassy Lakefront. The hotel was beautiful and the majority of the staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious, two rooms with a plasma tv in living room and a regular large one in the bedroom. We had a microwave, mini fridge, and two sinks!. The hotel gives a comlimentary breakfast in the mornings which has pancakes, bacon, sausages, omelets, eggs, fresh fruit, hashbrowns, yogurt, pastries galore, juices, coffee etc. In the evening you have complimentary 2hr drinking or you can have soft drinks instead of alcohol . There is a supermarket across the street that has everything including your CTA bus passes. You are in walking distance to Navy Pier, Magnificent Mile and about fifteen minutes to the Lincoln Zoo. This hotel puts you where you need to be. Has a pool, fitness room, internet, It's clean, and it's adjacent to p.J. Clarkes restaurant. The food is great!.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL; SUPERB SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: bremarv
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old daughter and I stayed at the Embassy Suites Lakefront in Chicago for four nights over Spring Break in April 09. What an awesome experience we had! We arrived a little early and expected to wait to be able to get checked in but we were assigned our room immediately. The room was perfect. I am more than picky about cleanliness and the room was immaculate. We have stayed at several other downtown Chicago hotels and this is by far the best and also the biggest. The other hotels we have stayed in were tiny; the Embassy Suites is huge with a living area, bedroom (with an amazing city view!) and bathroom. The room was equipped with a small fridge, microwave and sink which was really nice too. The bed was heavenly with a down comforter that was out of this world! The doormen were always very friendly as were the front desk, the breakfast staff, the bartenders and the housekeeping staff. The free cooked to order breakfast was wonderful with many choices such as omelets, pancakes with strawberry and blueberry toppings, bacon, sausage, cereals, english muffins, bananas, oranges, biscuits and gravy, scrambled eggs, yogurt, melon, pineapple as well as a wide variety of beverages. The happy hour was also an added bonus with free drinks from the bar from 5:30-7:30PM each night. The location of this hotel is perfect; a couple blocks east of Michigan Ave and a couple of blocks west of Navy Pier. We walked everywhere for dining, shopping and sightseeing! Every single employee at this hotel was more than willing to go out of their way to help if help was needed. There is also a Cinema right around the corner as well as a Walgreens. Across the street is a fine grocery store with anything you would need. I am so happy we chose this hotel and can't wait to return again. I was so impressed and I have stayed in a lot of hotels. Thanks Embassy Suites Lakefront Chicago; WAY TO GO!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: kee434
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and clean. The service was exceptional everywhere from the bellhops when you first walked in to the desk staff, the bar staff, and the cleaning staff. The room was very large and had three sinks (one in the bathroom and two outside the bathroom). The manager's happy hour is a great way to relax before a night on the town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Breakfast, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: TWNorthernCal
Reviews.Content: The woman taking our made-to-order breakfast orders had an amazing memory.... and my eggs were perfect every time. I like that they served cooked oatmeal rather than packets of instant-oats which so many other hotels have with their free breakfast. The fruit was fresh and sweet. We were there on business and never tried the pool or fitness center. It seems like a place where you could stay easily with kids. Our beds were comfy. I like the furniture. They provided shampoo, conditioner, and soap in our room. We asked the friendly competent front desk staff and were immediately given shower cap, body lotion, etc. I guess they arenâ€™t putting one of everything in the rooms now to prevent waste? My partner comment on how well trained staff was...several times.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Aimer83
Reviews.Content: Just got home from a 3 night stay at the Embassy Suites Downtown Chicago - Lakefront (Mar 15-18). After reading some reviews I was a little hesitant, but I work in a hotel so I'm very aware of how picky/unreasonable people can be so I kept an open mind. I was travelling with my boyfriend and another couple (mid to late 20s). When we arrived at the hotel at 12pm, we were greeted by the friendly doormen and took the elevator up to the Sky Lobby. Dinah at the front desk checked us in with no problem or hesitation even though we were 4 hours early. She was so frienly and helpful and has excellent customer service skills. Next, we went up to our rooms on the 17th floor, using a different elevator than the one we took to the sky lobby. At first, this seemed a little annoying (because you couldn't take an elevator from your room all the way down to the main floor) but we eventually grew used to it. The room was GREAT!!!! Very spacious, clean, comfortable bed and furniture, 3 sinks in total, good sized televisions....really couldn't have asked for more. The wireless internet in the room is $15.00 and I didn't find it to be that slow. If you don't want to pay the fee, you can access the internet in the business center for free and it is open 24 hours a day. The managers reception is an awesome way to start off your night. It is from 5:30-7:30 every night. You can only order one alcoholic drink at a time but there is no limit to the number of drinks you can have within the 2 hours (unless they have to cut you off). They also provide chips, salsa, and some other munchies. The bar tenders were very friendly and will make pretty much any drink you want. The line was long at times, but I didn't find the wait to be bad at all. (P a t i e n c e ) Breakfast was great. They had a good variety and it was very convenient. The line for the omelette station can get a little long but if you just want a buffet style breakfast, they have a seperate cart for that where the line is very short (they only put it out when the hotel is over 50% occupancy). Overall, our stay was wonderful. I really can't complain about anything. I would definitely stay at this hotel again for several reasons: - Breakfast and Managers Reception - Great service from front desk, bar tenders, breakfast staff, and housekeeping attendant. - AWESOME location (only 2 blocks from the mag mile and close to Navy Pier) - Clean, spacious, and comfortable rooms. - Good and friendly atmosphere! Hope this review helps :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: DubsDowntown
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay here with my wife and 6mnth old . Staff were friendly and helpful . Found the breakfast to be excellent . Didnt make the managers reception , but it's there . Pool opened at 6am which suited us perfectly and was clean and uncrowded. The suite suited us as we had our young daughter asleep in the complimentary crib while we watched TV in the other room and in the morning one of us sat with her in the lounge while the other got some sleep in the Bedroom. All this for $120 a night and only 2 blocks from Navy Pier one direction and 2 blocks to Michigan Ave. the other . Everything (touristy) in walking distance . While the wireless access is expensive , there is complimentary Internet Access in the Business Center available to all guests . All in all a great place for a break with kids . Very impressed

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient”
Reviews.Author: skurny
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suites last January for a few nights...first off, I lived in Chicago for two years so staying in hotels is always a bit strange when I return. Anyway, the hotel is decent for business, it's in the Loop, has good access to the El and is close to Union Station. However, it was lacking something. Usually I like staying at Embassy Suites but this hotel is very unremarkable. It was clean enough and the people were nice enough but it's doubtful I'll stay there again. I'd rather stay at the Hilton downtown or even the Hilton Garden Inn on Ohio than the Embassy Suites. Plus, even as a Diamond Member, I had to pay $9.95 for internet per day. The nickle and diming really annoys me anyway, but when I stay at Hilton's 100 nights a year? Usually I get comped for stuff like this at the front desk but not this time. You've got a lot of choices downtown, and I'd look elsewhere. I will say the bar is nice in the lobby but the food for Happy Hour was pretty bland.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Embassy Suites .. just lacking”
Reviews.Author: manktripguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Embassy Suites for 2 nights while visiting Chicago. Arrived at the hotel at noon on a Saturday and was allowed to check-in early. Clerk who checked me in was nice, but seemed preoccupied. I took the Blue Line from O'hare to the Downtown Clark/Lake exit. The hotel is a good 10 block walk from this stop, so you may want to avoid it during inclement weather. The room was clean, however seemed a little dark and older compared to other Embassy Suites I have visited. The bathroom was on the small side. The Internet was a little slower than desired (not free). The breakfast was average and was served by pleasant staff. The Manager's Reception was also average. The elevators were fast and there was never a long wait. There were many families staying at this hotel over the weekend. Noise easily carried into my room from the adjoining rooms. Nearby the hotel is a Dominick's grocery store and a Walgreens. Attached to the hotel is a movie complex and bowling alley. The hotel is very near that Sheraton if you are trying to map it out. It is a little walk to some of the more famous restaurants in Chicago (and fast food if you are looking for a quick bite to eat). I did not use the pool but it seemed small. I noticed the hotel just refurnished its fitness center. Overall, this is an ok hotel with an ok staff. I feel the rooms could use a bit of a makeover. I would stay here again if I received a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for location and price!!!”
Reviews.Author: mele2577
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family trip with our four kids. We chose this hotel based on price, locations, reviews and that they would allow all of us to stay in one room. (it's hard to find a hotel that doesn't make us get two room or pay a very expensive suite rate). I have read other reviews others who had a bad experience, but I will say that ours (and most others I read) was great! We checked in on a Friday afternoon. It was easy to find the valet parking and they were great. I hate to pay that much for parking, but you would find that at any hotel in Chicago. We took the elevator to the Sky Lobby to check in and waited maybe 5 minutes till it was our turn, no more that that. The staff was very nice and courteous. They had 2 people waiting to check everyone in, but as soon a line starting forming behind us, another person jumped right in to check in other guests. Our room was on the 16th floor. It is an open lobby area all the way to the ceiling so if you are a little scared of heights, you might want to get a room on the lower floors. The room was a suite with two double beds in the bedroom area with a tv and a sofabed in the living room. It had a small dining area in the living area with a flat screen tv, a larger bathroom than you see in most hotels, and a small kitchenette with a sink, a small refrigerator, and microwave. The bed linens and towels were nice and clean, with very comfortable beds. It also had a large armoire in the bedroom and a large entertainment center, and a good size closet so there was plenty of storage. The managers reception was a nice bonus as well as the breakfeast in the morning. At the managers reception you are offered all the free drinks you can drink (alcohol and non-alcoholic). I read one review that said they were disappointed that they had to wait in line for a drink, but HELLO , its free and how many people are staying there? - You have to expect to wait a little, but we never waited for long. The breakfeast in the morning was more than I expected, you had everything from pancakes and sausge to made to order omlets, cereals, fruits, yogarts, breads, juices, coffee, milk, potatoes. It is included with the price of your room, so it is free to everyone. I would recommend coming either earlier or later (we were there early) because around 8 am to 9 it is busy. The consierge was nice and very helpful. The only slightly negative thing I would say was the size of the pool. It is small (long, but not very wide), but there were never too many kids and ours had a great time. Plus, they had stacks of towels, so you didn't have to worry about bringing them from your room or running out by the pool. All in all for the price and locations in chicago (you are close to everything!) you can't beat this hotel. We will definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Breakfast included!”
Reviews.Author: centworthy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites on Christmas day. We make an annual trip to Downtown Chicago on Christmas day and this time we decided to get a hotel room and my son and his wife came with. It's a great hotel, has a pool, whirlpool and sauna. It's in a great location. This is the second time we stayed at an Embassy Suites, we stayed at the one in Niagra Canada. Both are great hotels, Breakfast is included with your stay and it is a full breakfast. You can even get made to order omlettes. It's a great value when you consider all that is included. Draw back is cost of overnight parking, but that's the case no matter where you stay in Chicago. We usually take the train in from the suburbs and the $48 we save covers any cab fare.

Reviews.Title: “Nice large rooms, true family hotel”
Reviews.Author: JPFA
Reviews.Content: Downtown Hotel near Navy Pier great for family's. Small pool still nice for smaller kids. Room nice large with two rooms. Good morning breakfast and free managers cocktail reception. For Business Travellers it can be good but the family's (kids) can be unexpected.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, a maybe...”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1Denver_Co
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel the last week in October, 2008. Nice place that is trying real hard to be better. The entire place is glass so if you have a fear of heights ask for a low-low floor. The elevators are all glass as are the barriors on the floors. I typically stay clear of Embassy Suites when on business...too many families with crying kids. This is an exception. It is clean and the breakfast buffet/made-to-order is the best I have seen at an Embassy Suites. I hit it right at 7am and breezed through--very good food except for the cold pancakes, etc. The rooms are nice and typical Embassy fare. The front desk needs help as it is very, very slow. The biggest complaint I have (and for business travelors take note) is the internet. It is horrible. The engineering staff told me that they are working on it but that didn't help me. I simply could not do my work on either the "high speed" plug in or the "unworkable wireless". If you need internet go somewhere else. Although they did not charge me (like I was getting anything) it is still a huge hassle. If you can get a deal on the price it is an ok place...close to the Pier if you like that aspect and a couple blocks off Michigan Ave. Easy walking area but not in the heart of the city or theatre district.

Reviews.Title: “Super value and location”
Reviews.Author: tessmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a weekend business meeting and brought my 13 year old daughter. Hotel was clean and incredibly well located. It's a very short walk up to the Magnificent mile, close to the Navy Pier and not so far from the Art Institute and Millenium Park. There is a wonderful supermarket right across the street (with a Starbucks inside) and the hotel breakfast was super. Terrific place for the rate--I was not expecting it to be as good as it was, very pleasant surprise. I think you'd be hard pressed to find a comparable value in a large city.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for first vist to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: AlFalkirk
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights, suite very comfortable although atrium access not good for the vertigo!. Staff friendly and efficient, room spotless, breakfast great. Great location 2 mins from river where you can walk to Magnificant mile

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flynndodgers
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites Chicago Lakefront was a great place to stay. To start, the SkyLobby is located on the sixth floor and has a good view. Check-in was simple and quick, and the staff seemed to be helpful. The room was very nice and clean, and we had a great view of Lake Michigan from our room. The rooms were also a good size, and the couch can fold out into a queen size bed. As for as amenities go, the manager's reception was great for starting the night with some free drinks. The lines do back up but they move quickly. The free breakfast was very good especially for a hotel. The breakfast includes almost anything you need. The location of the hotel is great, just 3 blocks from Michigan Ave. and about 4 blocks from Navy Pier. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: GA-USA-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located well in Chicago, in walking distance to many popular sites and attractions, such as Navy Pier, Magnificent Mile, and Hancock building (longer walk). Hotel amenities are OK, certainly the hot breakfast (but expect lines), and attractive suites, but there isn't an in-room safe or free web access. Some lamps failed to work in the suite, and batteries for TV remotes need replacement. Bedrooms are maintained nicely by the housekeeping staff. I liked our view to the south, and you could also see Lake Michigan. Easy access to lobby and street with efficient elevators. Device in lobby that allows you to print boarding passes for flights was not providing that feature. Also, pool was closed for a whole day unexpectedly. Breakfast food good, especially the quickly but well prepared omelettes. Bacon was delicious and plentiful. Free cocktails and soft drinks in early evening is a nice thing, but it's very impersonal. Don't expect a cocktail party, as many guests pick up drinks and bring them up to suites. If the price is right, then you should consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Stiff cocktails, comfortable bed, great location”
Reviews.Author: Joandio
Reviews.Content: All employees were courteous and attentive. Never had to wait for help. The rooms were typical Embassy Suites, a good size and the decor was fresh - it could not have been more than a year or two ago for new furniture, carpet, etc. My room had a view of the lake on one side - but beware - a massive condo sits directly between this hotel and the Navy Pier about 4 blocks east - so the water views are of the lake south of the pier. It was only two blocks walk to Michigan Ave. and 4 blocks walk to the pier. There is an AMC Theatre adjacent to the hotel and if I had stayed more that two nights I would have taken in a film, just due to the convenience. No complaints here!

Reviews.Title: “Fine 10 Day Stay”
Reviews.Author: dadsasdasd
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for nine nights in Augustâ€™08. Location of the hotel is good, close to Navy Pier and Magnificent Mile but yet relatively quiet. I (single traveler) had a corner room in 13th floor. No noise from the atrium to this particular room, probably because it is located somewhat further away from atrium than â€œregular roomsâ€�. Room has certainly large enough for my purposes, big living room and a separate sleeping room. Room was spotless and didnâ€™t have any scratches or other marks from previous usage, so no complains about it. Also other parts of the hotel were in very good shape. Kitchenette consisted of small fridge and a microwave oven. Room had quite nice views towards Chicago river, lake was also well visible as was Sears Tower. LAN access provided with ~10$/day, didnâ€™t notice any WLAN. One very very minor issue though: one of two TVs in the room was not LCD (they advertise two LCDs in a room) but a old-style â€œtubeâ€� TV. Hotel offered free breakfast and a managerâ€™s reception in the evening. Latter offered very little to eat (just some snacks), but plenty to drink (free beer, wine and booze) for two hours. Breakfast was, um, not that well suited for European taste but otherwise offered quite many different options. I never had to wait for an elevator more than 30 seconds or so, thus no problems for me regarding that issue (unlike some other reviewers). Then again, I left the hotel always latest at 8:15am, so avoided the real morning rush hour. Typical customers seemed to be families and there were really lots of them, but didnâ€™t really hear any special noise (no kids running around corridors etc). Obviously there isnâ€™t an Executive Lounge in this hotel, but did receive two water bottles as a Hilton Honors Diamond member. Better than nothing :-) So while this hotel isnâ€™t quite Five Star Ã»ber Luxury hotel, it did its job very well. I cannot really think of anything to complain about. One thing I noticed though (didnâ€™t affect me) was that there was often quite long queues at the check-in desk. Would I return there? Yes, absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: baleme1
Reviews.Content: when we arrived on a friday around 3pm we stood in line for at least a half an hour to check in. they only had 2 employees for a weekend check in. by the way, good luck finding your way around. we drove around the hotel 3 times to find valet then gave up and drove into self park. we hauled our own luggage. then you enter at street level, get in elevator to get to skylobby on 5th floor, then walk to another elevator to get to room. very inconvenient. the room was very small for a family of four. we took our son's double airmattress and barely squeezed it between the bed and entertainment center. we went to check out the pool. what a joke!! tiniest pool i've ever seen and always full of unruly kids at all hours. my kids were very upset they couldn't go swimming. there is so many kids at this hotel that it's always way too loud. the manager's reception from 530 to 730 is not worth the 15 minute wait in line for a tiny drink. my husband and i were in line opposite each other so we never had a chance to sit down with each other. the complimentary breakfast was terrible. got there around 8 am every day of our 3 day stay and waited in ridiculously long lines. the hot food is nasty, just absolutely gross. i got my kids cereal because i would'nt feed them that crap. we had cereal, bananas and stale donuts. my husband ventured to stand in the line one day and waited 20 minutes for 2 fried eggs while my kids and i ate our food so again we never had a chance to sit together as a family for a meal. there were too many things that we did not like so we won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Hope you aren't in a hurry.”
Reviews.Author: mspoutsalot
Reviews.Content: My family and I always try to stay at another nearby hotel but we've seen how nice this one looked and wanted to give it a try, you know "grass is always greener" situation. To begin, we pulled up on Columbus Ave. to check in because we didn't see the valet and self park were on Illinois. No big deal, still had to figure out how to get to the check in desk which is on another floor, so I had to ask to find out how to get there. When I got to the registration desk there was one employee checking in a guest. I was next in line and even though I walked up at the contract printout time still stood there over 8 minutes before a second employee showed up from the back. Even when she did come up, she fiddled around by the first employee for a minute or two then seemed like she decided she could check me in. She didn't greet me, no "Hello", and no conversation. I had booked a more expensive rate so that my kids would each get an Olympic panda bear, but because she didn't give them to me I figured they were in the room. I honestly thought she would snap at me if I asked about them. The bears weren't in the room and I had to go back down and get in line, again over five minutes, to let them know I never received my bears. Found valet and checked our luggage pointing out that we had already checked in. (I figured it worked out well because our luggage would get delivered that much faster, so I was doing a little better after check in.) After an HOUR AND A HALF I called down to the bellman's desk to see where our luggage was. There was no answer, so I left a message. Never was replied to. My husband had to go back down to the ground level to find our luggage and have it brought up. All said and done, it took TWO hours before we got our luggage. I booked one of the over sized corner suites and the room was very clean. There was plenty of room for us but the views were nothing to write home about. We had no problem with housekeeping and any time we had any needs or questions they were very friendly. My husband went out to check out the facility and stopped by the concierge desk to ask a couple of questions about dinner reservations. After waiting over five minutes he stepped over to registration and asked when someone would be back. That's when we found out they send their concierge home before 6PM! And they don't even put a sign up saying they are gone and to go to registration, which again you'll probably have a wait for because they seem to only let one employee out at a time even though they are now handling check in and concierge questions. Their pool is really narrow and every time we tried to go swimming there were a ton of kids running, splashing everyone, even those on deck, and some even unsupervised. The employees don't seem to check the area at all except for towels. The pool hours are great but the really need to add an adults only time before and after their normal hours so the adults can get in laps or enjoy a peaceful hot tub. Our kids our nine and ten, and even they didn't enjoy how unruly the pool was, they didn't even get in the first time we went to the pool. Everyone we dealt with in room service was super friendly and helpful, which was a blessing because we didn't want to leave the room. It actually changed our mood to have to do something on the Sky Level. When we would go out to dinner or shopping we didn't want to come back to the hotel. We would have just moved to our normal hotel, but the Embassy was going to charge us for the whole stay, so it wasn't worth it. We love Chicago and try to go a couple of times a year but this was the first time we ever wanted to go home and not stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean and Unpretentious”
Reviews.Author: dennisfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference. I had no idea what to expect, so I really went with an open mind. It is located a few blocks from the lake and is right downtown, so the location was GREAT! I found the service to be consistently very good at this hotel. From the valets to the front desk to the housekeeping staff. Everyone was friendly and approachable. The lobby is not on the ground level, it is on the sky level, so this was a bit odd. And you had to go to a separate set of elevators to get to your room (which was a pain when you entered and exited the hotel, but it was a minor inconvenience, plus, it added a layer of security which is important in a place like Chicago. The rooms are all suites, so you have a living room, a tiny "kitchenette" area with a fridge, sink and microwave, and a bedroom. The room was pretty clean. No major complaints. The bath was nice. The bed was comfy. The towels had that "fresh scent" smell like when they come out of the dryer...Mmmmm. We had a lakeview room, but the view isn't great. There are several other buildings blocking your view, but a partial view is better than no view. All guests are treated to a full breakfast and nightly cocktails (free). They have a "cook to order" counter where they make your eggs fresh, and they dole out goodies like bacon, sausage or biscuits and gravy. They also have a buffet-style breakfast in the dining area, if you are in a hurry. I found the breakfast to be a great added value. This hotel is pricey, and if you bring your whole family (which lots of people did), this can cut costs dramatically on trying to eat out downtown Chicago. The evening cocktails session was nice for adults to relax in the lobby and have snack and mingle. It was well attended each night I was there. The area around the hotel is great, and relatively safe for Chicago. We walked to Navy Pier and took taxis to Water Tower Place and the John Hancock Building for under $10 (with 2 people). There is a Dominick's grocery chain right across the street (full size) and a high-end grocery on the back side of the building (FABULOUS deli!). Also, a Walgreen's attached to the backside. We were there for almost four days, so we bought a few groceries for the room fridge. The only complaints I had were that the air conditioning did not cool the bedroom, as well as I would have liked at night. And the internet service was not very fast. All-in-all, we had a GREAT time, and I would definitely stay at this hotel again in the future. It was really nice to have room to spread out for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: SFLcpl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our trip to Chicago, my family and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We typically stay at Embassy Suite hotels because it always meets or exceeds our expectations, this hotel did just that. The hotel meet was very clean, staff was approachable, plenty of room for 5 of us, and a nice breakfast. The hotel was in a great location!! We never used a taxi, we walked to the following attractions Navy Pier, Wendella Boat tour, Bobbys Bike Hike, and Double Decker tour. On the same block of the hotel is an AMC theater and a couple of restaurants. Their is a market right across the street from the hotel with a Starbucks stand inside. The down side to the hotel is the crowd for the elevators and breakfast after 8:30am. We had to wait 15 minutes for an elevator the morning we checked out, they have 4 of them. If you want an omelete you can wait in line a very long time, we chose to skip it. Overall it was a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: JanBrady
Reviews.Content: A great planned weeked was derailed by the inefficency of the hotel staff. I booked a smoking king suite. I confirmed the reservation for late arrival, so imagine my surprise when I got to the hotel and there was no room available for me. After waiting for an hour I was given a non-smoking double room. Once I got to the room it had not been cleaned from the last guests (beds unmade, etc...). Considering we arrived at 11pm, this was quite a shock. In addition, there were no curtains in this room. I contacted the front desk and they sent housekeeping to investigate. Two hours later we were sent to another hotel chain for the night. Unfortunately, we could not check back in to the Embassy Suites until 4pm the next afternoon! This caused a rescheduling of many appointments as we had no room to shower or change in from the time of checkout at the other hotel until check in at the Embassy Suites. I am dissapointed at the lack of concern from the staff and the inability to accomodate those with reservations! Their excuse was that they were "overbooked". How can you not honor a reservation?

Reviews.Title: “Bloodstains on the bathroom walls”
Reviews.Author: Richard320
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a breeze. The room looked okay at first, no cobwebs or anything. But, it was a double, not the king.I booked. Then I discovered the bathroom door would only close with a mighty heave. And I noticed the bloodstains on the wall next to the toilet. Well, I hope they're blood... And the grand finale, the inside door handle is about to fall off. Okay, off to bed. The included breakfast buffet was actually pretty decent. I didn't try the omelet station, the line was too long. A visit with one of our friends staying at the same hotel revealed that they had a refrigerator. We didn't. But there was a nice hole for one. The air conditioning works in a way. Yes, it does cool, but the thermostat is obviously waaaaay off. In order to get the room to a comfortable 78F or so, I ended up turning the thermostat down to 61 Housecleaning staff was kind of surly. If you aren't out of your room when they come knocking, it doesn't get cleaned that day. So eat up and get out and stay out until dark at least. On the plus side, the location is pretty good for tourists. And there's a Dominick's grocery store (Safeway or Von's in other parts of the country) across the street.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful for the family”
Reviews.Author: baseball4us
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for three nights and experienced an excellent hotel..The rooms are extra large..and cleaned up perfectly every day ..the free breakfast, although crowded was very good with a large variety..We have stayed at many other embassy suites..but this was one of the best..It is also close by to Navy Pier and easy to walk 4 blocks to take the redline to both ball parks..also can walk to Milennium Park and to the shopping downtown

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: tday51
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my daughter and Grandkids for the 4th of July weekend, and this hotel was wonderful. All the sites we wanted to see were within walking distance and the added feature of included breakfast each morning and managers cocktails in the evening made this a very enjoyable stay. We would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Family!”
Reviews.Author: usmcsgtftl
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on our travel agent's recommendation. It is in close proximity to Navy Pier and is within easy walking distance of Michigan Avenue. Parking in the area is at a premium, so the valet service came in very handy. The facility is very clean and neat. I have never seen a housekeeping staff so dedicated to site maintenance regardless of the time of day; due to the building design it is very apparent when a member of the staff is diligently working to ensure every surface is clean. As well, we met the hotel's Director of Security while checking in; he displayed a high level of professionalism and made our family feel at home. The pool area is very popular with families. There is a workout room equipped with Precor fitness machines that affords a fantastic panorama of the surrounding area. There is an AMC theater in the same building complex that also has a bowling alley; it was very handy when it came time to entertain three children under the age of ten. If there is a drawback, and it is specific to the hotel chain and not this location, it is the company's insistence that internet access be paid for daily ($10/day). This has been an excellent stay. I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Your Purse!”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: Hotel has kind of an odd configuration. Instead of checking in on the ground floor, you have to take the elevator to the "Sky Lobby" to check in, and then take different elevators to the sleeping rooms. Takes a while to figure it out. I used the automated check-in kiosk, which was pretty impersonal but worked fine. I used the same kiosk later in the trip to get boarding pass for airline. Hotel seems quite large, with big well lit central atrium-style lobby. Suites (bedroom and living room) were less impressive - mine was dark, smelled musty initially, and had some rather bizarre 1950 vintage lamps. Ugly. Two TVs (one flat screen), a nice bed and shower. Coffee maker in the room. Room service for lunch was average - not hot, but I ate every bit of it (club sandwich). The morning buffet was sumptuous - with cooked to order omelets, and lots of other stuff. Nice to have it included in the cost of the room. Staff all seemed fine - no complaints. Conference facilities were also fine. Be careful - one of our coworkers got scammed in the ground floor entrance lobby. A woman pretended to get her heel stuck in the crack at the elevator door, and when our employee went to help, an accomplice took our coworker's credit cards and cash. All got away (so far). It's apparently a common scam in the area. Bottom line - watch your stuff.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: nyer223
Reviews.Content: I visited Chicago for the first time as a hotel traveler and found the Embassy Suites to be a great deal. The entire staff was very courteous (except for the happy hour bartender) and the value was outstanding. The included breakfast is a knockout. I have never seen made to order omelettes and good quality ingredients like this at a complimentary breakfast. I disagree with the reviewer that said the place was noisy - I hear nary a peep from the approxmately 100 children staying at the hotel (they did run amok at breakfast) and the facilities were very clean, recently remodeled with plasma screens adn the like. One peeve was the chlorine odor in the atrium - the pool should have had it's own ventilation. Awesome location (blue line to clark/lake) and a $5 cab ride - 60 minutes and $7 total! The best airport transfer deal in a big city. Parking is a rip if you drove, but the lot across the street is $19 a night if you don't mind parking outside.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Mag. Mile Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NilesD72
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night this time but stayed here every week for almost a year back in 2003 (when the hotel had just opened). I had picked this hotel after trying 20+ downtown and Magnificent Mile hotels. It was good to see that the hotel has maintained it's high quality over the years. I love the location - it is a block from Michigan Avenue restaurants/shopping and 3 blocks from the Navy Pier. The new beds are even better than in 2003. It offers all the features that come with an Embassy Suites hotel - an atrium, all suites with a sofabed, cook to order breakfast and a manager's reception (open bar) in the evening, pool and a functional gym. If you are a HHonors Gold or Diamond member, you can use the neighboring Holmes Place health club for free. It is probably the best health club I have been to in the US. The rooms facing Navy Pier or the river offer the best views. Overall, a great, comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: On-the-Move-RI
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Embassy Suites near the lake and thought it was a great hotel. The interior atrium may be an architectural cliche but I still think it gives the hotel an amazing sense of openness and drama. Our room overlooked the lake and we loved the view, although a tall building partially blocked the view. The two-room suite was very clean, the bathroom was spacious and nice, and overall we were pleased with everything. The complimentary breakfast was top-notch, with no lines and great omelets. The fitness center had first-rate equipment. If you park directly you save a little money over valet parking, but it means you have to take two sets of elevators to get to your car, which can be a hassle of you are schlepping a ton of bags.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay.”
Reviews.Author: CarlosCalgary_Canada
Reviews.Content: My wife and 18 month old stayed at the lakefront from April 8-13. It was our first stay in Chicago so I don't have other hotels in Chicago to use as a comparison but to me it was just average at best. The atrium is a really bad concept if you ask me because sound really travels through that hotel...we were on the tenth floor but it felt like our room was in the lobby bar it was so noisy. We should have requested a room on the roof. Not only is the lobby bar loud but if the people staying next to you are somewhat loud you can hear them too! I could hear the tv from next door from my room. The breakfast is great as long as you're up bright and early otherwise you'll be in line forever. Same goes for the free drinks from 5:30-7:30pm everynight...but it is free. Personally I'd rather pay $7 for a beer and get decent service. The rooms were nice and big but filthy! I picked up a piece of broken glass off the floor and about 1000 hairs came with it. Great location! Parking is a complete rip-off! $49 for 24 hr parking!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tulumfans
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this hotel. Very well kept and quiet. After recent renovation everything seemed new. Service was good. Parking is expensive but valet service was very prompt. Breakfast was typical buffet. Be advised that the pool is quite small and overun with kids. Not a good pool for an adult to enjoy. It would be great if they had "adults only" pool times. (Like before 9am and after 10pm) \ I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites Great Location”
Reviews.Author: iowa
Reviews.Content: My 5 daughters and myself stayed at this hotel over Easter break. The location is great. Rooms were clean, view was awesome, staff friendly, breakfast was very good and the cocktail hour in the evening was wonderful. We would definately stay again and the price was right! We shopped the entire time so location was very important as we walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Met our needs for the extended weekend”
Reviews.Author: Scubachick42
Reviews.Content: My mom and I went to Chicago for a long weekend and this Embassy Suites met our needs - clean, nice location and safe. However, the free breakfast was a nightmare - extremely long lines, completely understaffed, and never enough food/utensils/plates/cups for those in line. After the first two days of the "stress-filled" breakfast experience, we decided to walk across the street to the Dominicks grocery store (similar to Whole Foods) and grab a muffin and sit in Starbucks to enjoy a quiet, peaceful meal. The afternoon "Manager's Reception" wasn't much better - the drinks were fine but the appetizers amounted to "bar food" - pretzels, tortilla chips, salsa and peanuts. On the second night of our stay, they ran out of peanuts and pretzels and when we asked the staff for more, they shrugged their shoulders and said "we don't have anymore." I believe this property was completely unprepared for the influx of Spring Break vacationers and families.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_W_Family
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of our family spring break as did many others as it was filled with families on spring break. The primary reasons we picked the hotel were location and amenities. Embassy Suites almost always have included a full breakfast, evening reception, a decent pool and rooms. It was a very good stay and I have put the highlights in a few categories. Good â€“ room layout was good, we had a corner suite with a view of Lake Michigan, fridge, microwave, flat screen TV in bedroom, clean, comfortable bed, plenty of space for the family to spread out, the breakfast food was very good and the drinks at the reception were also good (especially considering it is an â€œincludedâ€� amenity), check-in was easy and the staff was friendly and helpful Needs Improvement â€“ breakfast planning â€“ with the large family crowd, some items ran out before the end of breakfast each day, one night the reception had a â€œnoodleâ€� type dish, but mostly the same chips/salsa and bar mix â€“ I have seen a much better variety of snacks at other ES properties, housekeeping â€“ one day we came back after 6pm and the room was not serviced, a call to the front desk had it fixed while we were at dinner â€“ also they did not observe the if it is on the floor please change it policy, no Disney Channel (kids only gripe) Location â€“ ok walking distance to subway, easy walking distance to Navy Pier, Michigan Ave, Tips â€“ if you do drive avoid the hotel garage, we parked at the Navy Pier (a few blocks walk) for less than half the price per day â€“ especially since we did not use our car again till we left Overall a very good stay and what I expect from an ES property. We would probably stay here again next time in Chicago as a family.

Reviews.Title: “over priced”
Reviews.Author: gringoca
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at 2 Embassy Suites in 2 different cities. I think both have been over-priced for the level of quality. The location of this hotel is excellent and very convenient for tourists and business travelers. The complimentary breakfast was simply satisfactory. The free cocktail hour was nice. However, neither are enough to make up for the over-priced rates. There are nicer hotels available in Embassy's price range. One thing I've noticed at both Embassy Suites is that their electronic door locks are complete pieces of s. We've had tons of trouble with them at both Embassy Suite Hotels that we visited. We've never had any such trouble at any other hotel ever. It's a bit frustrating to have to put your key in 10-20 times just to get your door to open, every time you come or go... Probably won't stay at Embassy Suites ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: monjacks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Lakefront the weekend of March 8th. It turned out to be a wonderful location and was within easy walking distance to Navy Pier and Michigan Avenue. There is also a trolley stop right on the corner which would be especially nice in the Summer months as the trolley is free and goes to all the major attractions. The hotel was nice, but it is in need of a renovation as the chairs in the room's sitting area were threadbare and faded. It did appear as though they might be in the middle of remodeling some of the rooms. Our only complaint was the long lines for breakfast and the evening reception. It was difficult to locate a table and we had to wait several minutes holding our food before a table cleared out. We can't complain too much though considering the hot breakfast was included as was the alcohol at the evening reception. We look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice of Hotels”
Reviews.Author: mlwhite05
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. I booked it on hotwire.com for $120/night. It was the perfect location, right in the downtown area, about two blocks from Navy Pier. Also about a block from the main shopping strip. Great location for restaurants, shopping, bars. Our favorite bar was the Red Head Piano Bar (or something similar to that), about 20 minute walk from the hotel. The rooms were very clean, we had a one bedroom with a view of Lake Michigan. The bedroom had 2 queen beds and a pullout sofa. Also had a small kitchen with a microwave and refrigerator. The bathroom was clean and big. Everyday, the hotel had a reception in which they served everyone a free drink and appetizers. We also ate at the restaurant (I cannot remember the name), but that was also very good. I did not actually eat the breakfast, but my friends said it was an excellent complimentary hot breakfast with omelettes made to order. The pool was nice, had a hot tub, sauna, and shower area in the pool. Also had a fitness center, which I didn't use, but looked nice with many different machines to workout on. The one thing that really surprised me was the parking. It is about $35/day to park, however this is typical for most areas in the downtown area. In fact, this was actually one of the cheapest places to park, so I truly couldn't complain. Just had to mention it as a tip for anyone who has never had to park in a Metro area such as downtown Chicago. All in all, I will definitely stay here on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarriorMinnesota
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel a few years ago as a business traveler and greatly appreciated the rooms, food, and facilities. As a weekend family traveler, this hotel is not worth the price. We had problems with check in; we reserved with a credit card but put a cash deposit down upon check in - we were in town to shop, and we wanted to stay on our budget. The front desk staff was not prepared to handle or document cash. They also had problems honoring the online package (through their web site) we ordered that included parking and online access. These charges were added again each night and had to be manually reviewed. Due to these charges being added, our cash deposit was not enough to cover a room service charge. Upon notification, I went to the front desk to deposit more cash. Right after I did it, the room service waiter came back to our room and demanded cash. Despite asking to speak to the manager, the only person that would talk to me was the front desk clerk. All billing issues were eventually solved, but I will not return to any hotel in which a staff member comes to my room and demands cash.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated.”
Reviews.Author: bjstokes
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this from the "10th floor" of the hotel (they include the underground levels, so we are actually on the 6th floor above ground, though we asked for an upper floor...beware). Pros: location; aesthetics (everything looks nice and minimalist); free drinks (unlimited!) from 5:00-7:30 PM; fairly spacious rooms; some rooms are being remodeled Cons: everything feels cheap; attention to detail inside the rooms (broken shower curtain rod, broken towel rack, broken armoire, broken pull-out bed, poor ventilation in bathroom, cheap soaps); Service is spotty. Anyway, if you want a good location and free alcohol, and you have children and somewhat low expectations, this place is for you. I thought I would get more for this price. I wouldn't choose to stay here again, although they are remodeling some rooms (I can't tell if this room has been remodeled).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location...One Problem”
Reviews.Author: strtofdrms
Reviews.Content: We were in town to enjoy a concert at the United Center...and we had flown in from Philadelphia. I was told that there was an airport shuttle...just call the day of, yadayadayada. I am about to board in PHL and they tell me...sorry, there is no airport shuttle to this hotel. Oops! Yeah, I would say. We got off the plane at 12 pm and didn't want to wait the 1 hour for the bus to center city (which was $50 a head), so we took the train. CRAZY! The train was a long ride and a scary one...we ended up getting off in the middle of a city I had no clue about and was LOST! The people on desk duty were hapless at best, so we got a cab and headed to the hotel. At this time, it is at least 230 or 3 am. The desk clerk was ridiculous and could have cared less. The rest of the stay was OK...standard Embassy Suites stuff. But that initial craziness tainted the hotel for me. They really...as a major hotel in a major city...should have a shuttle van or at least be HONEST on the phone about their lack theirof. So, live and learn. I wouldn't avoid the hotel, it was average. I enjoyed my time there and the manager was cordial when we spoke later that week. BTW...the concert was great! Saw Chicago in the process and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoutherngirlHouston
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in Chicago. The hotel staff was super friendly and accommodating. The rooms are nice and the beds are very comfortable. The free breakfast (full buffet of cooked and continental breakfast, plus omelettes cooked to order) and managers reception is a very nice touch, although the line to get drinks can be very long, only one bartender,but it lasts from 5-7:30. Convenient location for shopping and restaurants. Will definitely stay at other Embassy suites and this one if in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kevboom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a conference in the area and found it reasonably priced for a downtown hotel. Cheaper than any of the conference hotels, plus the free breakfast and evening reception/drinks were a bonus. As with all Embassy Suites, you get a great room with a bedroom separate from a living area. One thing that I particularly liked about this hotel was the location. It was right next door to an entertainment complex with a big cinema and bowling alley/bar, plus right across the street from a grocery store for picking up fruits and snacks that can be difficult to find when staying in a downtown area. The hotel was a 3-4 block walk from Navy Pier, and close to the popular Dick's Last Resort restaurant on the water where the waiters insult you purposely. It was also only 2-3 blocks from Michigan Avenue shopping and dining--very easy walk. I also walked to the Art Museum and Millenium Park, although these locations weren't terribly close--I'd say 10 blocks south. Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. The location was excellent, the neighborhood was safe with a booming condo population of professionals moving in all around it, and plenty of entertainment and food options were within walking distance. One other thing, if you want to hop on the train, there is a nearby station about 1-2 blocks away. Easy to take the train south or north to Wrigley Field to catch a Cubs game. I must say I was not expecting much of Chicago, but I left pleasantly surprised with everything there was to do downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sshade71
Reviews.Content: My parents, my teenage son, 8 year old son and I arrived by train at 1:30, which is earlier than check-in time. The porters were waiting to take our bags to our room, check-in was a seemless process and within minutes we were in our room. The boys were particularly impressed with the open-air style of the hotel and the fact that they could see straight into the lobby from our 11th floor room. As many reviews have indicated, the elevators are SUPER fast. Our room overlooked the lake and much to my 8 year old's delight -- a construction site!!! The softest beds and pillows I've ever slept on. Even the rollaway was comfortable as the teenager decided he wanted the "good" bed on Sat. nite. Room was quiet for sleeping and water pressure in shower was great! We ate lunch at the hotel restaurant upon arrival and everyone's meal was wonderful. In case you're wondering, the mashed potatoes are real and they are fabulous! The manager's reception was a nice addition, limited drink availability and "chex mix" like snacks. The free breakfast was great--good selection even if it wasn't free. Made to order omelets & eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, french toast, bagels, donuts, cold cereal, fruit, yogurt, potatoes, toast, juices, coffees, teas, you name it! If you can't find something you like young or old, then you just don't like breakfast! Our train wasn't leaving Sunday until 5:30 and the porters willingly stored our bags while we took one last jaunt in the City. They were always helpful with obtaining cabs, assisting in and out of building, etc. I highly recommend staying at this hotel to anyone, and will definitely return myself.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarieManor
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Friendly employees. Room comfortable. Open lobby concept.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: DanielleWI
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, just a few blocks from everything. The beds were soooooooooo comfortable. The made to order omlets for breakfast were a huge hit with my teenage boys!

Reviews.Title: “Service With a Smile!”
Reviews.Author: 70ishtraveler
Reviews.Content: We live close to Chicago but wanted to spend an overnite in the downtown area, to enjoy the fine dining, shows, etc that the city offers. We chose the Embassy Suites Hotel for price and location. Our first stay here, it won't be our last. From the time we arrived until we left the staff were so pleasant, asking how we were, was there more they could do, etc. We reserved our room on line, a king suite, separate living room including a manager's complimentary cocktail reception and full cooked to order breakfast for the mere price of $119 per nite! Such amenities at this unparalled price in the heart of Michigan Avenue North area. Prices vary depending on arrival dates, but it will still rank as one of the best stays for the money. Jan and Terry

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with open bar!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kzoo50
Reviews.Content: Booked room on Hotwire for $109 a night on a weekend! Arrived around 5:00 on Friday to find an open bar for two hours, with snacks!! Great location, within walking distance of Millenium Park, a must see when you travel to Chicago. The rooms were clean and roomy. Complimentary breakfest was very nice and helped cut the costs on the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: mxtravelingirl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire and got an incredible rate of $89. The hotel had an excellent location, 2 blocks from Michigan Avenue. We just walked there and took the CTA bus to go wherever we wanted to. The rooms were a little bit small, but they had everything we needed. There was a living room area with a queen sofa bed, a desk and a TV. There was a sink, a mini-fridge, a microwave oven and a good sized bathroom. The main room (separate area) had 2 double beds, another washstand with a mirror, and a second TV. Complimentary breakfast was offered every morning with cooked-to-order omelettes, plus cereal, oatmeal, scrambled eggs, pancakes, waffles, yogurth, fruit, bagels, pastries, muffins, toast, bacon, sausage, milk, coffee and orange juice. There are complimentary drinks and snacks in the afternoon, but we never got to be there in time. The only thing that we didn't like were the elevators. They were really fast, but it took you 3 elevators to get to your room from the parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Free drinks & made to order omelettes”
Reviews.Author: LouisaHouston
Reviews.Content: Our girls weekend to Chicago saw us booking a suite at the Embassy Suites Downtown Lakefront based on a husband's recommendation. When we checked in, the Manager's Special was in full swing. Free drinks in the lobby/atrium for 2 hours! Snacks included! The ambience was relaxed yet fun and inviting and the atrium gave off a chic vibe. We had great service at reception, with the concierge service and with little extras like forks delivered to the room late one night. The breakfast staff were welcoming and humourous as we waited in line for our made to order omelettes each morning. The hotel's location is perfect - w/in walking distance of Navy Pier for the boat tours, of the Magnificent Mile for shopping and for some restos. The theatre district was a cab ride away but not too far. Aside from a broken pull out (useable with care), the hotel offered everything we could have asked for. Even more considering the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Stinky shower curtain, too many elevators, too high a rate”
Reviews.Author: wdharrington
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice enough, but the bathrooms smell like a musty locker room. My business associate's bathroom smelled exactly the same as mine, so I'm convinced it's a hotel wide problem. The layout is good and there's plenty of room. The beds are comfortable and clean. The thermosat takes forever to cool the room off, and this was after midnight. Also, I asked to cancel this room because the Chicago Marathon was going on and streets around the hotel were closed. They said sorry, so their customer service in my book was below average. If you have a car and park it in the garage you have to take three separate elevators to get to your room, bad news if you've got kids and luggage. No help was around to get my luggage or for valet, so stay at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites redeems itself!”
Reviews.Author: meredithandmarley
Reviews.Content: I've had BAD BAD BAD experiences with Embassy Suites in the past, so it was with major trepidation that I booked this hotel while in Chicago for a physicians' conference. My experience here totally changed my mind about ES. We arrived in the middle of the heat wave to cordial bellmen and wonderful front desk folks. Since we were staying 8 days, we figured we'd ask for a corner room on an upper floor for a view & see if they'd comply. (We booked through a special convention service for approx. $200 per night - not especially cheap, but decent given what was going on during the time we were there.)The convention was soon to start and the Chicago Marathon was the next weekend; they were quite full, but willingly accomodated us. Our windows looked out on the Wrigley & Tribune buildings along with partial lake and river views. Our room was clean and comfortable - the standard ES with a sitting room, fold-out sleeper bed, small kitchenette with mini-frig, & comfortable king bed. Because we had a corner room, I think we had a bit more space than some of our friends who had standard hall rooms. Complimentary hot breakfast was very good = just quite crowded unless you went very early. The swimming pool was small for the size of the hotel, but we used it every day with our 2 kids and there were never more than 6 people including us in it, so it was fine. Overall pluses: FABULOUS LOCATION! Less than 2 blocks from the river, a couple blocks from Navy Pier, 2 blocks from Michigan Avenue, walking distance to Millenium Park. Nice staff - went out of their way to be helpful. Also - one of the only hotels that we've stayed in that allowed kids in the hot tub; a definite plus for our girls. Areas that were just ok: Rooms could use a bit more lighting - it tended to be rather dark. Water pressure in the shower was really low (we were on the 12th floor). Also, for the price of the rooms, one would expect internet to be included in the cost - it was an additional charge. However, there is a business center with 3 computers that you can use for free. Overall, I'd stay there again in a moment - especially with our kids ages 3 and 6. It's very family friendly and our experience was great. PS - If you're there during the marathon, the route goes right by the hotel and you can watch the people run below you out your window. The kids loved it.

Reviews.Title: “TOO MUCH FUN!”
Reviews.Author: traveler293
Reviews.Content: TWO WORDS: Elevator Races! Amazing times! Those 4 elevators in the sky lobby are so superspeedy! They are rapid fast!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: ksauer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Labor Day wknd and had a great time! Arrived early (11am) and had planned on asking for a place to store luggage until room was ready. To our delight, they told us that we could check in already! Our room was nice, 14th floor and had a HUGE corner suite with a beautiful view of the River. Breakfast was really nice. They had hot food buffet, cold cereal, assorted donuts/bagels, and a cook-to-order omlette area as well. They do have a happy hour with free drinks and appetizers, but we weren't around for it. There is a Walgreens around the corner where we would get bottled water every morning. The location was great...walking distance to everything..Navy Pier, Michigan Ave, John Hancock Bldg,etc. There is a stop for the free trolly just a few steps away from the hotel. We will definitly be back.

Reviews.Title: “One of our best experiences/deals!”
Reviews.Author: hua_and_grace
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at Embassy Suites and loved every minute of it! The location is great, being walking distance to Navy Pier, Magnificent Mile as well as being within a block from Walgreens, Fox and Obel (a really nice gourmet food store/market), and Dominick's (another supermarket). We checked in around 6pm or so and requested a high room with a view...and got a room on the 15th floor (they have 17 floors total) with a "partial" view of the lake...which means you can't see the _entire_ lake from your window... but its still a GREAT view! The Manager's reception allows you free, unlimited drinks (alcohol, juice, soda, etc) with finger foods (potstickers, crab cakes, egg rolls, meatballs, veggies/dip, etc) and the breakfast buffet has pretty much some of eveything (made to order omelettes, fruits, pastries/bagels, juices, sausage/bacon, french toast, pancakes, etc.). The suites were very roomy with a separate bedroom with its own sink and TV and a living room with a kitchinette (a small sink, microwave, mini-fridge) with sleeper sofa, business desk/chair, and separate closet. Its great for families! Last, the service was wonderful: friendly and helpful staff who request that you speak to the manager on duty if you do not feel any part of your stay as being "very satisfied".
