All in all, we would definitely stay here again...especially with the Hotwire price of $109 a night. If you plan on seeing just Chicago, then we would advise you to not even rent a car as parking/traffic is such a hassle and this hotel is in such a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: taykayTroy_MI
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed at an Embassy Hotel before, so this was a welcome surprise for us. It is a practical place to stay especially for families with kids. The rooms are clean, neat, and big. Our room had a very comfortable king bed with a sitting area with a pull out bed. There were 2 tv's and a microwave and mini fridge.There was an additional 2 sinks as well. Towels were well provided for. The carpet and couches looked a bit worn. If u have a view of the Lake u can catch the fireworks on a Wednesday or Saturday at 9/9:30pm. We never heard any noise or disruptions during the day or night, so we slept pretty well. The breakfast was good, but long lines and crowded, so go early. All the staff we encountered were professional, friendly and helpful. Room service was good, portions are big, so we could share. Parking is expensive (+-$39per day) - there is an option for self parking, but I think u have to pay every time u get your car. Also there is a parking structure opposite the hotel I think u can use. If you're driving yourself the entrance to use is on Illinois street, which is a one way. It can get very confusing- u can't park infront of the hotel on Columbus. There is a Walgreens just around the corner. The hotel exceeded our expectations. We will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: suechucky
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a 3-day weekend in August. It was perfect for our family of 4 with 2 teenagers. It was very clean and extremely quiet. We never heard a single sound while in our room! We had a partial lake view/ city view on the 12th floor. It was quite an experience for our kids. Being a weekend, the hotel was full to capacity, but we never had to wait for any elevators as they were always quick to arrive. We loved the extra space of the sitting area separate from the sleeping area. We were close enough to Navy Pier that we walked or took the free blue trollies. We were able to walk to Gino's East, Giordano's, the Hancock Building, American Girl Store, Mellenium Park and more! On the negative side, the free breakfast was very crowded by 9am and very hard to get a table. We found ourselves having to get up earlier than we wanted just to get a table at breakfast. The pool is also very small for such a large hotel. The parking garage was outrageous at $34 per day. (We parked our car for 3 days and walked everywhere) Our weekend was expensive, but we felt very worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, not the worst”
Reviews.Author: Prof_Fwy
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites Chicago Downtown/Lakefront is trading on its reputation. It is not a fair bargain for the price, but it's not the worst you can do in the city by any stretch. The location is excellent. The facility itself is somewhat shabby. In my room, the wallpaper was peeling, the bathroom tiles were cracked and dirty in the grout and corners, the ceiling fan was slightly noisier than an airplane propeller, and the air conditioning unit hummed -- loudly -- all night long. Street noise and lobby noise are problems. All of the rooms are built around an atrium at the bottom of which is the bar, reception, front desk, etc. There's also a bar in the hotel, opening onto the atrium, that serves until 4 a.m. Great, if you're partying. Terrible, if you're trying to sleep. My non-smoking room was, technically, non-smoking, but since all the rooms in the atrium share a ventilation system, I not only got to listen to my neighbors below and above, I got to inhale their second-hand smoke too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great for families, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: NJ2Mom
Reviews.Content: We (mom and 2 boys, 11 and 6) stayed at the Embassy Suites Lakefront from 8/12 - 8/19, booked via Hotwire. We couldn't have been happier with the choice, especially for the price. The boys were awed by the 12-story atrium and fountain in the lobby, it was very dramatic. They also loved the glass elevators which felt like an amusement park ride. We had a little key trouble the first day but the staff were great about getting it fixed. This hotel is in a great location if you plan to go to Navy Pier -- only a 2 block walk. And, it's only 2 blocks west to Michigan Avenue where you can catch buses and do some shopping (the lego store in the Nordstrom mall is fun for kids!). Plus, there is a bowling alley and a movie theater, around the corner and actually in the Embassy Suites building. Great for a rainy day, and we had a few! The room was nice -- 2 double beds with an east view, decent view of Lake Michigan. There's a building between the hotel and the lake and you can see the lake around both sides of the building. The 'suite' section had a pull out couch -- which was kind of hard and not so comfortable - We ended up all sleeping in the 2 beds, which were very comfortable. There was also a second TV, table, mini-fridge and microwave. There are also laundry facilities available. Breakfast was crowded only on Friday, Saturday and Sunday; weekdays were not bad at all. The evening reception had short lines (5 min. or so) for drinks; that's the price you pay for free I guess, we only went a couple of times. The pool is quite small -- it's like one lap of a lap pool. We went twice, it wasn't crowded. The bellmen, concierge, and front desk staff were all truly great. The cleaning staff was very anxious to get to our room. We even ordered room service one night and it was prompt and hot. Overall -- great value for the money! It may not be the Ritz but for a family friendly stay in Chicago, I would definitely recommend the Embassy Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Great Service, Worth Every Penny in an Expensive Town!”
Reviews.Author: Itlngrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property on business, and had stayed at many Embassy Suites before. ...I thought I knew what to expect. An atrium, a guestroom with a sitting area, wetbar, etc... but upon my entrance into the lobby I was pleasantly surprised. This property puts a modern/trendy spin on what you think of the "traditional" Embassy Suite-Style Atrium. Lots of glass, modern fountain water features, candles, gray tones used, cubist decor/accents w/a bit of Asian flair thrown in. At night when the lights went down, it took on an even cooler vibe. The rooms feature marble counter tops. Views vary - and I had a city view. Room was CLEAN, and large. Service was impeccable - I checked in at the height of a rush time - it was BUSY and they moved us fast, and were courteous. The manager's cocktail reception and breakfast in the morning are added perks that give you more bang for your buck if you compare prices at other Chciago downtown hotels - definitely a stylish hotel that is worth your money.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for us”
Reviews.Author: UKBrown
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be in a good location - within easy walking distance of Navy Pier and Lake (not actually Lakefront though), river and Millenium Park and a longer walk to Sears Tower and museum area. We found the hotel to be quiet - no sound came from other rooms and we had no problems with noisy guests in corridors as often happens. We overlooked the road but did not find it too noisy. Love the Embassy Suites for their two rooms - as a family of four it's great to have the extra space. We stayed four nights (Sat/Sun/Mon/Tues) and unlike other reviewers, at no time did we have any queues for the free breakfast . Only problem was slowness of toasters. Didn't use the Manager's Reception but never saw any long lines for this either. Two sinks were seperate to shower which is always useful and there was a third kitchen-type sink between the two rooms along with a small fridge. Unlike other fridges on our holiday this one was completely silent. Everywhere was very clean. Loved this hotel and loved Chicago. Would definitely stay again although it's not cheap!

Reviews.Title: “July 4th experience”
Reviews.Author: vnbond
Reviews.Content: Stayed July 3 - July 6, 2 adults, 1 teenager and 1 preteen. Had read a lot of reviews about this hotel and knew what to expect over the July 4 holiday. Place was full, and it was all families with kids.... like us. At times there were waits for elevators (particularly after the July 3 big fireworks) and the breakfast was unpleasant due to overwhelming amounts of people. That said, the staff handled things well, obviously had dealt with these types of crowds and we felt they did a good job. You had to show your room keys to enter the hotel on July 3rd after the fireworks which kept out the hordes of people streaming off the shoreline. Things quieted down quickly due to the clientel being families. Our room was a 2 double, non-smoking. Very clean and spacious, had a city view. Stayed on Hilton points. Our room not ready at 3pm so they found a compatable room for us so we could check in immediately. Did not use the pool, very small and crowded. Lobby area spacious, very nice, had drinks there one afternoon but left before the crowds arrived for the free drinks and snacks. The location of this hotel was perfect. About 4 blocks to actual Navy Pier enterance, 2 blocks to Mich. Ave. Went to a movie one night in the AMC on lower level of hotel, also bowling there. At ate Grand Lux nearby (very good) also liked Banderas and Dicks Last Resort Dockside (also close by). Would recommend for families, but for adult only trip we liked the Hilton Suites on the upper end of Mich. Ave where we stayed last summer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: S708
Reviews.Content: We actually made a last minute decision to spend a saturday night in downtown chicago. I went on Priceline.com and bid on a 3 star property for $90.00 and we got a room at this hotel. The normal rate is $250.00 a night so I felt like we got a great deal. I couldn't have gotten a better value anywhere else. This is actually a very nice hotel right in the heart of the city. We were close to all kinds of shopping, resteraunts, and bars. The hotel lobby is beautiful with a large glass atrium. The staff was friendly and efficient. Are room was a very nice one bedroom suite with a nice view of the city. I would highly recommend this hotel for someone in the city for the weekend. The "suites" include a seperate sitting area with a couch and t.v. This would be a perfect set up for a family vacation. I felt that this was one of the nicer Embassy Suites I have ever stayed in. The room includes a free breakfast buffet, which was comparable to any resteraunt. This is really a great property and I would not hesitate to stay here again. At the end of the day since we only paid $90.00 a night this is probably the best value I have ever found. The normal rate of $250 a night would seem a little steep, but if you can get a reduced rate online I would definitely recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Embassy Suites Lakefront”
Reviews.Author: HomebaseDC
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 5-night stay at the Embassy Suites Downtown/Lakefront in Chicago. We enjoyed every minute we stayed in the hotel. During our stay, our suite was clean, everything was in working order and we had plenty of room for three people. Having a clean kitchen sink, microwave and mini fridge was extremely useful and convenient, as was the extra vanity and sink in the bedroom. The beds were warm and comfortable, but not saggy. The sofa bed was more comfortable than any other sofa bed I have experienced. All the staff,including the reception desk, valet, bar staff, food service and housekeeping staff were professional and personable. It gave one the sense that they really enjoyed working there. Even though I did not reserve a room with a lake front view, the reception staff found a room with a partial view without an additional fee. The complimentary breakfast is far more than the usual danish and coffee. It's a medium sized buffet complete with eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, French toast, cook-to-order omelets, pastries, cereal bar and fresh fruit. The evening Manager's Reception with complimentary alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks from the full bar was a great way to start each evening. The location on Columbus and E. Illinois is fantastic as it is a few blocks walk from Navy Pier and the river walks along Wacker Drive. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chi_townfan_7
Reviews.Content: Pros-Wonderful staff Beautiful decor Corner suite was great for my rather rambuctious kids Breakfast buffet and Evening manager's reception Only a couple of blocks from Navy Pier Cons-Pool was on the small side Hot tub was closed If you self-park takes 3 elevators to get to rooms All in all a great place and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Memorial Weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: atlmom2
Reviews.Content: We had 4 teenagers and 2 rooms. Excellent stay. We requested 2 rooms next to each other. Arrived at 11am Saturday of Memorial Day weekend. One room was available and they said they would get our other room as close as possible. We ended up with the room next door which was great. Not so great pull out beds but you don't expect they would be that great. Excellent location to Navy Pier and the Watertower and Michigan Ave. shopping. Would stay again when we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Conference / Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: Alicia710
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for a 4 day conference from April 21-25th. Generally speaking the room was nice and spacious. The front desk staff (and any other staff we encountered) were friendly and helped out when we requested. We did not use the concierge, so can not comment on those services. We did not like the complimentary breakfast all that much. They had a large selection of items, but nothing tasted really good. We did not have problems finding a table though. I thought the elevators were fairly quick and did not require long waits or cramming into them with a bunch of people. The only annoying thing with the elevators was that it took you 3 different elevators to get down to the self park area below the building. It took 2 elevators and a walk through the large lobby area to just get to street level. We did hear strange things coming from the vents in our room. Not sure how close this personâ€™s room was, but it was somewhat uncomfortable hearing her emotional breakdown while sitting in the living room area of our room. There is also quite a bit of street noise in the bedroom â€“ especially during rush hour. That sort of thing does not affect my sleep, but itâ€™s definitely there and we were on the 12th floor. These are things that Iâ€™m not sure the hotel can do much about, but thought some people might want to know. The location of the hotel is good and safe. It was about a 10 minute walk to Navy Pier and about 5 minutes to Michigan Ave. All in all, the stay went fairly well â€“ we would stay here again for a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “busy weekend caveat”
Reviews.Author: gordotx
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room with usually reliable Embassy Suites anticipating a leisurely weeknight stay at a spot close to restaurants, shopping and Navy Pier. What we failed to anticipate was a hotel overrun with spring break kids and their families, straining the ES staff to their limits, evidenced by the mob scene breakfast we encountered on a recent Friday morning there. At 8:30 we went downstairs to find hundreds of people in all the food lines, patiently waiting for complimentary breakfast. Unfortunately the staffing seemed minimal, with dirty dishes, empty drink containers and jammed tables everywhere. You would think that when a hotel is booked solid, they might anticipate a crowd like this, but that was not the case here. We nudged a couple of oblivious post breakfast coffee sippers out of their seats and quickly ate the eggs that had become cold on our search for a place to sit. We left our room (comfortable, but with stained rugs and no coffee packets) soon after and headed for a lengthy wait at the elevators with our bags. The valet was fairly quick with our car, but then for a $39 overnight charge it should have come with a wash & wax. We're from Dallas, so we know about downtown parking charges but this seemed excessive. All in all, we will try somewhere else the next time we're here visiting this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “My Paper Walls”
Reviews.Author: sheenaeaston4
Reviews.Content: If you love to eavesdrop, this is the hotel for you! Not only did we get to listen to â€˜Brianâ€™ call his buddies at 3 a.m. after a night of partying, but we also got serenaded by the next guestâ€™s children. Thereâ€™s nothing like â€œNew York, New Yorkâ€� to rouse you out of bed at 6:30 a.m. Mind you, these people werenâ€™t being overly loudâ€”just normal noises. We also got to hear the maintenance man roto-rooting the toilet next door at midnight. Why, you ask? Because there was a serious plumbing problem in our section of the hotel. We had to have our toiletâ€”which wasnâ€™t even secured to the floorâ€”serviced three times in three days. And no, weâ€™re not big eaters. Iâ€™ve seen the undeserved raves about the breakfast and managerâ€™s receptions. We were sent to the reception to wait for our room, which wasnâ€™t ready for our 7 p.m. arrival. (no excuses, no apologies) Thereâ€™s something about a ratio of 300 guests to 1 possibly inebriated bartender that doesnâ€™t sit right with me, but really, who doesnâ€™t love to stand in line for 30 minutes just to eat and drink below-average fare in a lobby that reeks of chlorine? (A quote from our 8 year old: â€œThese pancakes taste icky.â€� Seriously, how bad to they have to be if kids wonâ€™t eat them?) If you are in the hotel during the breakfast rush or happy hour, stand outside your room and look down into the lobby. Youâ€™ll see huge throngs of hotel guests cued up for a â€œfreeâ€� Miller Lite, or some gritty, overcooked, foodservice eggs. You may find yourself thinking of earlier, simpler times, say a Soviet toilet paper line, or maybe a killing floor during Chicagoâ€™s â€˜hog butcher capitalâ€™ days. Hereâ€™s a tip that saved us some time and trouble: walk one block east on Illinois to Fox and Obelâ€™s, a GREAT gourmet market and liquor store. That corkscrew by the ice bucket in the room is there for a reason. In all seriousness, this hotel was â€˜fineâ€™ in spite of our problems. The lake view was pretty. The room was clean. The sofa bed was good, but small. The location was convenient. Service was, â€˜eh,â€™ with the exception of the bell staff who were uniformly great. We paid $149/nt., which seemed reasonable overall for Chicago. Iâ€™ve seen rates posted into the high $200s, and this place simply isnâ€™t worth those prices. And 4.0 rating? Uh, no. Based on the design of the hotel, I think it must have built its reputation as a businessmanâ€™s special. Now it caters to the family crowd, and the transition is only half successful. The pool is obviously a one-lane lap pool thatâ€™s now overcrowded with kids, and the large bar area has become pancake central for the kiddies. Itâ€™s basically Comfort Inn and Suites with a fountain and glass elevators. I love CI&S, but thatâ€™s not what I was expecting. Another note, this hotel is NOT appropriate for people who are afraid of heights. The hotel has 12 stories of rooms above the lobby with an open atrium that is bordered with clear plexiglass along the â€˜hallways.â€™ We saw one young boy who was terrified of the drop. Something to consider.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Was Aces!”
Reviews.Author: dave1013
Reviews.Content: I won't repeat all the good things stated about this hotel. My wife and I were there last week for a convention of my nonprofit and it lived up to its reputation as presented here in Tripadvisor. Only a few additional comments. On floors 10 and 14 there are a washer/dryer. $1.50 to wash and $1.50 to dry. The washer on floor 10 was out of service at the time of my visit and the sign on it looked like it had been there a while. One the plus side, the elevators that take you from the SL level to your room are the fastest elevators I have ever experienced in a hotel. Very convenient. The concierge was great, gave us a wonderful tip for a great Italian meal one evening. All in all, an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Yet”
Reviews.Author: strfdtravllr
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Embassy Suites after a long train ride from Detroit only to find out Expedia had botched our reservation (that's aother review). While I was on the phone with Expedia for almost two hours (over the counter at the front desk!), the front desk staff offered us free cocktails, dinner for our tired and hungry children, and assisted us to book a replacement hotel- all while not even guests! They even offered that we return in the morning for free breakfast instead of paying to eat elsewhere. We were forced to stay elsewhere for one night but returned to Embassy Suites for two more nights- a terrific stay! the rooms are spacious and well-appointed- showed no signs of wear that others mentioned. Beautiful soaring lobby- kids thought it was the coolest. Awesome cocktail happy hour -FREE! What! We couldn't believe it! Without a doubt, a fantastic location, above and beyond staff in ALL areas, and great, family-friendly rooms. Can't say enough (and this from two BIG hotel snobs!)

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: SuperToad
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a night, and arrived after midnight. Bell service was smooth and excellent, as was checkin. I did however, order "build-a-bear" package, which was forgotten, but the manager promptly sent it up when I called. Room was clean and funcitonal, if not elegant. Nice view of the lake, also. I did not appreciate the bible in the room, though (placed by the Gideons or something), I don't think it's a hotel's place to do that, it made me feel uncomfortable. But Room service was excellent, though expensive, and they gave me a late checkout- and then an even later checkout without any hassle. Checkout was smooth as well, as was ordering and loading up the car. Later, I thought I had forgot my watch- I called the hotel who sent up security who went throught the entire room, and called me back (they didn't find it.. But points for trying.) Over all, extremely functional and pratical, but could use more elegance.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Embassy Suites Lakefront”
Reviews.Author: ldonn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of August 2006. The hotel was wonderful. We had a beautiful view of Lake Michigan from our suite. The complimentary breakfast and cocktail hour each day was one of best things about our stay. It definitely cuts down on the price of eating out. The staff was helpful and courteous. Getting around Chicago is much easier if you use the public transportation system. We got a 5 day visitor pass for $18. Where else can you get a deal like that? We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GIve this hotel a try”
Reviews.Author: sylvrunr
Reviews.Content: Nice room decor and clean. Breakfast can get crowded. Tip--go early! Did not care for the construction noise on a Saturday morning. But this hotel was very well located (close to Michigan Ave) and all staff were pleasant to deal with. We'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Strongs
Reviews.Content: I think this a great location in downtown Chicago. There are so many things just STEPS away. (AMC Theatre, Starbucks, Jewel, Walgreens....) There was a really awesome bar (LUCKY STRIKE) with a bowling alley and lots of pool tables or huge couches to watch the game on. That is through the AMC doors and up the escilator. Valet parking is a little high, ($39 per night) but for downtown I suppose that is the going rate. Huge free breakfast.. We will definately be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Agree - You can do better”
Reviews.Author: Amge55
Reviews.Content: It's over-rated. So many things were out of order it's not funny. We had a broken lamp when we checked in (They swapped out a new one immediately.) The ceiling fan did not work (but they didn't offer to give us another room, only a stand-up fan that they never delivered.) Another light bulb out on the desk lamp and a third one burnt out during our stay. The gym equipment was broken while we were there the entire week after Christmas. The bathroom had other people's hair there for three days before they cleaned it up. The Manager's reception is over-rated. The line is so long you only have enough time to get one drink in two hours. The Breakfast is nice if you can get in before 7:30. Otherwise you'll be fighting the crowds. Really, there are plenty of other places to stay in this vicinity. Take your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A very good deal, but expect to 'pay' for it”
Reviews.Author: Hi_from_Benelux
Reviews.Content: At about $120/night for 5 people (breakfast included), this was undeniably an excellent deal. The location is prime, and the room was well-designed and comfortably held our entire family. The free cocktail each evening was nice & the nibbles were decent (an unfortunate sea of styrofoam cups, however). However, the much vaunted "cooked to order breakfast" was a chaotic, unpleasant ordeal each morning. We felt like cattle waiting to be served at the trough. There was insufficient seating, and the entire environment reeked of make-shift disposable (ugly folding tables/chairs, ugly plastic trays, and again a miserable waste of styrofoam cups). Dread of the breakfast pandemonium would cause hesitation in whether to stay at this hotel again. It is a shame, as so much of the hotel has good things to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: _rugrats_5
Reviews.Content: Large clean room. Fantastic breakfast (but does get crowded sometimes). Location is close to Magnificent Mile and Navy Pier, and we were able to use the free trolleys quite often during our stay. We have a family of 5, so the pull-out couch was great in comparison to a roll-a-way bed at most hotels. Friendly and efficient service. The pool is not real large, but the kids enjoyed it. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rate, amenities!”
Reviews.Author: airplanegeek
Reviews.Content: Great location! About two blocks from Michigan Ave, and just a few more to nearly everything else. Traveling with a toddler, we chose Embassy Suites for the separate living/bed rooms, refrigerator, and microwave. The complimentary full breakfast and evening cocktails were just a bonus. The rate was $50-100 less than a standard (amenity-less) room at all the nearby major chains, so it was a no-brainer to stay here. I recommend a south facing room for the best views since you will be overlooking a parking lot and not directly at a high rise. Checking in/out was a breeze. Booked a nonrefundable, prepaid rate online so that minimized the check-in time. Asked for a late checkout on a Tuesday and was allowed to stay until 1pm. Took the super convenient Orange Line train from/to Midway Airport ($2/person). Easy half mile walk from nearest station to this hotel, even in teen temperatures. Free Navy Pier Trolley picks/drops you across street from hotel. Also across the street are Starbucks, Dominick's grocery, and Un-cork It (large liquor store). You may also choose from a few neighboring restaurants. It's by no means a deal breaker, but as stated in other reviews, it takes two elevators to get from street level to your room. One set of elevators gets you from street to lobby, the other set gets you from the lobby to the rooms. Elevators are exceptionally frequent and fast to ascend/descend. I don't recall waiting more than 5 seconds after hitting the up/down button.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for kids and/or Chicago Marathon”
Reviews.Author: fightinghippos10
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites Downtown Lakefront is a great place to stay if you have kids and/or running the Chicago Marathon. The property has a great location. Easy walking distance or short cab ride to Michigan Ave. shopping, River North dining, Navy Pier, Grant Park, and the lakefront museums. I walked to the start line, which was less than a mile away. Embassy Suites are great for families. The 2 bedroom suites give families extra space. The inclusive breakfast is also very nice. The hotel is clean and has a new feel. The elevators are very fast. Unfortunately, you do need to change elevators to go down to street level. There is a Dominick's grocery store with Starbucks across the street. This is a very high end Dominick's. Also, there is an adjacent movie theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: KathrynH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Embassy Suites, Chicago Downtown Lakefront for 2 nights, September 22 & 23, 2006. It was centrally located, within walking distance to most of the sights we wanted to see. We arrived well before check in and were able to go right to our room. Room was clean and spacious. The bed was a little too firm for me...a pillow top would have been more comfortable. We thoroughly enjoyed the cocktail reception and the cook to order breakfasts. Staff was courteous and friendly. Using the concierge service to book evening reservations to a Comedy Club was not a problem, they were happy to help. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “You Can Do Better”
Reviews.Author: comeflywithme
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel over the weekend. The hotel was nice, but not as good as others that I have stayed at in Chicago. On the plus side, the hotel is close to the Navy Pier, Millennium Park, and Michigan Avenue. The manager's reception (free drinks and snacks from 5:30-7:30pm) is always a treat. The breakfast also offers a pretty nice selection (very decent for a free meal in Chicago). The view from the hotel room was very nice. I could see the lake and river, instead of just the side of other buildings. The pull-out bed on the couch was also decent for a couple nights' rest. I would recommend staying at the "Embassy Suites Hotel Chicago Downtown" instead of this location though. The staff at this Lakefront location wasn't as friendly or helpful (particularly the concierge, when I asked for a restaurant recommendation). The rooms also weren't as clean. The layout of the Lakefront isn't as nice either. The lobby and lounge feel crowded and not as relaxing as the "Downtown" location. As other reviewers have mentioned, having to take one elevator to the lobby and then walking across the lobby to a second elevator in order to get to your room feels a little strange (especially after a long day of walking around the city).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved the managers reception, loved the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: stiebo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Embassy Suites for 4 days and we loved it. It was clean, staff was very helpful and pleasant. We LOVED the made-to-order breakfast and the manager's reception. The lines did get long but if you got to breakfast early enough they were not bad. The kids loved everything about it also.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families, but maybe too good--breakfast traffic worse than the Dan Ryan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2-night stay here for our family of 4 + baby (2 adults, a 5-year-old, a 3-year-old, and a 3-month-old). Obviously, traveling with such a group is never going to be seamless, but we were pretty happy with the room (12th fl, great view south towards the AON Center). It was a "King Suite", so my wife and I and the baby slept in the King, with the two kids on the sofa bed in the front room. Besides the two-room setup with fridge and microwave, another huge plus for staying here with kids is that there's a Dominick's grocery store directly across the street (and FYI, your Safeway card seems to work there). That saved us the first night when everyone was too tired to endure a dinner outing and we bought dinner and other supplies from there. Friday morning's free breakfast was a total fiasco. The line was about 20 minutes or more to get your food, seats were hard to come by, and they kept on running out of things like plates and silverware. It was obvious that the crowd was 90% families, which obviously slows things down. There wasn't any obvious way to help the situation (other than maybe keeping supplies filled so that people aren't disrupting the flow by barging into another line to get a fork). It really started our day off on a sour note. Inexplicably, I never saw the lines get out of hand on Saturday morning though. My guess is that so many people had been traumatized by Friday's scene that they either sent one family member down to fill a tray for the rest (as we did) or they just went to Dominick's or some other place for breakfast. Another drawback is the fact that you need to take an elevator from street level up to the 5th-floor "Sky Lobby" and a second one up to your room. Just a pain when you're going back and forth (e.g. if you're playing the parking meter game, see below). Parking charges are always punitive in downtown hotels, and this one is no exception. $39/night to valet park, $32 to self-park. We managed to get through our two nights with only about $25 in charges (a $53 savings). There are meters immediately south of the hotel and to the east on that same block (between the Sheraton and Illinois Ave). They run 9 am to 9 pm, so if you get a spot at night, you don't have to get up at dawn to move it. The lot which is located southwest across the intersection of Illinois and Columbus from the hotel charges $22 for 24 hours (with, obviously, no in and out priveleges), so we did use that for a long stint that first night. Another parking location that can be attempted is the lowest of the 3 levels of Wacker Drive, just south of the Chicago river. The meters are 7am - 7 pm, though, and there are quite a few homeless people living down there, so I can't vouch for the security of it. I'd definitely park there during the day (and I did), but chickened out for the overnight stint. Getting back to the hotel itself, it's a good choice for its access to Grant Park and Millenium Park (less than a mile to the South), Michigan Ave (a couple of blocks east), Navy Pier (if that's your bag) and some metered parking. If you're an early riser, you shouldn't experience the problems with the breakfast traffic. Staff were all fine, breakfast is above average for a free one. We didn't partake in the happy hour (long lines again, of course), but I'd guess it was typical for Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family traveled to Chicago by train for the first time for both. We definately picked a great hotel. We were greeted right away when we arrived. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I'll admit I was afraid to go to a big city for the first time. Once we got to the hotel, I was definately more at ease. We checked in quickly, and were pleasantly suprised how clean the hotel was. We ventured out the next day, and we found we were close to the Navy Pier. We also could walk easily to the Mag Mile. The places you needed to be were in walking distance. The breakfast buffet was nice, but you need to get there early to beat the lines. It was so nice to stay here for our first experience in Chicago. When we go back--we'll be checking out the Embassy Suites Lakefront again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice...but TONS of kids over the 4th of July Weekend”
Reviews.Author: VegasCanuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the 4th of July long weekend. The location is fantastic! A short walk to: Navy Pier, Michigan Avenue, countless restaurants, and shops. There is a brand new Dominicks (supermarket) across the street...perfect for stocking up on groceries. The hotel is very new (2 years old?). Keep in mind that there are two Embassy Suites in Chicago...this is the newer and better one. The suites are very nice, quite new and some have wonderful city/lake views. Due to the long weekend, the place was crawling with kids. My partner and I don't mind kids but this verged on ridiculous. Both the free (and very good) breakfast buffet and the evening cocktail hour were overwhelmed by the capacity crowds. Parking is steep ($36 per day self park)...but at least it is located in the same building. An elaborate movie theater and a bowling alley are also located in the same building. P.J. Clarkes (Burgers, pizza, pasta, steaks, etc) is a fantastic restaurant located on the street level of the hotel. Would I stay here again? Yes!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: ncstewart
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of a great corporate rate ($175), the suite arrangement (separate bedroom to put our 2-year old down early in the evening), and the included cook-to-order breakfast. Everything went wonderfully except that on the second day, our room wasn't clean when we returned in the early afternoon...and it was naptime. By the time our 2-year old woke up, it was 4pm -- a call to housekeeping was returned with the message that they had left for the day, but offered to bring towels and plenty of coffee. Also, the hotel charges $9.95 per day for (slow) wired internet access (no wireless in the suites). We weren't aware of this through any of the websites and only discovered it when we hooked up in the room. Overall, a great place to stay with kids, but watch the extra charges!

Reviews.Title: “This is the way to run a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frick
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean, comfortable hotel with friendly, courteous and professional staff, the Embassy Suites Lakefront Chicago is for you. Every staff person I encountered was friendly, from the bellman to the cleaning staff. To make up for some inconvenience with our booking (which was alleviated before our arrival), the hotel had a room available for us when we arrived early, and as a thank you to us for being flexible, the manager delivered fresh fruit and bottled juices to our room shortly after we checked in. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. It's only two blocks from Michigan Ave and right on the shuttle route for Navy Pier. The complimentary breakfast is more than sufficient with a variety of delicious items as well as a "cook to order" station for omelets, etc. Afternoon cocktails and appetizers are offered in the atrium in a relaxing, fun atmosphere. Other hotels take note -- this is the way a hotel should be run!

Reviews.Title: “Love Embassy Suites Hotels!”
Reviews.Author: HulaHoney
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and courteous as mentioned in other reviews. Check-In was a breeze and I was able to check in 2 hours prior to 4pm. Pool is small but it wasn't a concern to me as I wasn't there to swim! My husband loved the jacuzzi. Great location as hotel is within walking distance of Magnificent Mile, Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium and The Loop. Breakfast Buffet and Manager's Reception are exellent. Seating area is large although the Manager's Reception can get quite crowded if there is a conference within the hotel. Lines long for drinks but bartenders moved very efficiently. Sitting area a little bit cold during Breakfast Buffet so take a light cover. Room was great. Spacious, clean and 2 TVs!! And although there was a family next door with little ones we couldn't hear them at all!!! Elevators (all 4) arrived within seconds when requested. Had dinner at PJs our last night and our meals were wonderful. Not overly pricey and food was quite tasty. We have stayed at the the other Embassy Suites Downtown Chicago, Embassy Suites Old Town Alexandria and now this stay at the Embassy Suites Lakefront has made us fans for life!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: aks001
Reviews.Content: Evening cocktails and breakfast! Concierge were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: Mikefrommentor
Reviews.Content: Per travel advisor reviews spent three nights during the week during spring break. Made reservation on line. Got corner room as requested which was quiet. Small pool. Staff very helpful. With two children ages 6 & 8 able to walk to Navy pier and Magnificant Mile. Hotel and room very clean as is the city. Our family thanks the reviewers of travel advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites Downtown Lakefront was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: bowlerwife
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Embassy Suites Downtown Lakefornt and it was just perfect! A perfect location, close to the Magnificent Mile and the Navy Pier. Our room was great. Everyone at the hotel were so friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend staying there!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: aaronvot
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay for families or otherwise. The room rate was $199. It was clean but not overly fancy. Right in the heart of downtown within walking distance to shops and restaurants. We took our daughter and the room was perfect for her to stay up and watch TV in the living room while my wife and I had the separate bedroom. The suite was huge with a great view of the lake and the river. The staff was outstanding, friendly, accommodating. The manager's reception was a nice touch, unlimited beer, wine, cocktails saved us from paying $6 a drink elsewhere. The breakfast buffet was just average but there is enough food to fill you up and saved on breakfast tabs downtown. We couldn't have been happier and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for families staying downtown”
Reviews.Author: juniemonster
Reviews.Content: I brought along my family to a conference in Chicago - and chose to stay at ES for the suites & the free breakfast. Aside from the suite arrangement (perfect for families - put the kids to sleep in the bedroom, and then stay up in the living room, sleeping on the pullout bed), the lobby is the best part of the hotel. Our 3 elementary/preschool kids were unanimous that riding the glass elevators was the highlight of our trip to Chicago. We also enjoyed the great cooked to order breakfast, and the free drinks at happy hour. The hotel is a free shuttle ride from Navy Pier, and just a few blocks from Michigan Avenue (Wrigley bldg) and the river. An excellent location!! While we'd stay here again if coming to downtown Chicago, I do have to mention 2 things. #1) The pool is sorely lacking. It is very narrow and was extraordinarily crowded at all times of the day with kids. There would have been no possibility of swimming a lap across the pool at anytime during President's Day week-end. There were at least 25 kids in the pool, and 8 in the hottub - and the comfortable capacity for the whole place would be about 2 or 3 families. Second, sides of the pool were grossly grimy. While I had to be in the pool with my daughter, I could hardly stand it with how dirty it was. My last straw was when I saw the same gross thing floating by the side of the pool that I'd seen the day before. Ewww! #2) The ES is pretty expensive. We reserved 3 months ahead, and so got the bargain rate of $170/night. That's a LOT to pay for a night. The parking is $32/day, with no other safe options nearby. However, overall a great choice for families. I would NOT stay here by myself or on any sort of romantic weekend though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My two sons and I stayed one night at the Embassy Suites on N. Columbus in Chicago. Great location. I paid extra for a lakeview room and we did have a nice view of the lake, but I wouldn't really recommend to anyone else to do that. You could just take the elevator to the top floor and basically see the same view. I really liked having two rooms, it was more private. The total was $290.00, the most I've ever paid for one night at a hotel, so I'm still trying to justify spending that amount. The suite was clean. The service was excellent. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was pretty good. We checked out the pool but didn't use it. It was pretty small, I would call it a lap pool. It did look clean. We could hear the people in the room next to us, but I don't think that is unusual in a hotel. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Lakefront in January and it was magnificent. The hotel itself is gorgeous, the lobby overlooks the Lakefront area of Chicago, and is beautiful. We had two standard suites, with lovely views of Navy Pier and the lake. The rooms were very clean, the linens were wonderful. There was a very clean nice bathroom, with a good shower, and something that seems to be rare in hotel rooms, an actual soap dish for the soap. There was a wet bar with sink, microwave and refrigerator, as well as a vanity with a sink outside of the bathroom. The rate comes with complimentary made to order breakfast, and "happy hour" with free drinks and some snacks, chex mix, tortilla chips, salsa and queso. The breakfast was delicious, they had made to order omlets, the usual hot and cold fare, and lovely pastries. The service was excellent as well. Every time we approached the front desk, we were greeted warmly and any questions were answered. There is a concierge desk, however, we never saw an actual concierge, but the front desk staff was completely knoweledgeable and helpful, made dinner reservations, called a taxi, etc. We had many transportation questions that they were able to answer and provided great information. All in all it was a fantastic place, and if I were in Chicago again, I wouldn't hesitate to stay there. Also, the prices were quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelmingly Friendly Service - Many Plusses”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeBob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days / two nights while on a business trip. Requested and got a corner room with impressive views in several directions from the 14th floor. The room was very well appointed and spacious. The elevators featured some of the quickest response times and fastest floor transiting I have seen anywhere. The customer-consciousness of the help from the street level bell staff to the front desk to even the custodial and maid staff I met in the halls or elevators was over-the-top friendly and impressive. Cabs were always available summoned quickly by the attentive staff which was a good thing since parking your own car here will cost you $32.00 nightly, and access to the L-Trains (0.7 miles) is a bit of a hike in colder weather. The Embassy's nightly manager's reception is a nice touch and the accompanying snacks are adequate, while perhaps a bit "ordinary". The well-staffed, cook to order breakfast was excellent. The major complaint I had was that the mattress on the King bed was just atrocious. The bedding was good quality but I have slept on sleeper sofas with more comfortable mattresses. I brought item this to the attention of the front desk and they did little more than thank me for the point-out and promised to look into it. That was a bit disappointing. Replace the mattress and I will gladly return here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel except for the noise.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel the week of December 12th-16th. Overall, the hotel was very nice and the free breakfast and happy hours were great. The location is very good also. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The only negative is the noise. I could easily hear people in the next room or noise from the street. I was on the 9th floor so the street noise was surprising.

Reviews.Title: “Much Fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Family and I stayed at the Embassy Suites Chicago Lakefront hotel for the first time this october. We are Hilton Club Members so we were led to stay at a Hilton-affiliated Hotel and we picked the Embassy Suites. We stayed from Oct. 21-23 and enjoyed it very much. It is in a fabulous location just situated between the Miracle Mile (Michigan Avenue) and the Navy Pier and Lake Michigan. You could see everything from just outside your window, such as the Hancock Tower or the River. The rooms were pretty comfortable and it was pretty spacious. The lobby is pretty and the Manager's Cocktail Reception everynight was very nice. It was pretty crowded during our stay because the White Sox were playing in the World Series those nights and it was nice because the TV's all around the lobby showed the game. The breakfast was nice. My only concern was that the tables were too small. There isn't much to do in the hotel itself, but step outside and its a world of excitement. Chicago is nothing like NYC and it is one gorgeous and clean town. The restaurant in the Hotel, P.J. Clarkes, was nice and the food was pretty good. I definatley reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our two kids (ages 10 and 6) stayed here five days leading up to Thanksgiving. The Embassy Suites is a great place to stay if you have kids and are going to be in town for more than a day or two. It seemed to me the same crowd you'd have at a hotel near Disney World--i.e. lots of families with young kids. We had a room on the 9th floor--there are 17 total--with a good view of the lake. The location of the hotel is just fine, situated between Michigan Avenue and Navy Pier We didn't have a car with us, but never had any trouble getting to where we needed to get to. You can walk anyhere from the Loop to the Hancock pretty easily. With four of us, taking a cab to the museums was only a couple dollars more than the bus would have been, and much more convenient. There is a Walgreens on the same block, with a liquor store and a gourmet market one block away. Since there's a mini fridge in the room, you can stock up on snacks for the kids. I expected the worst concerning the nightly reception and the breakfast, but it wasn't that bad. Weekends are definitely more busy. Just know if you choose to get to breakfast at the same time as everyone else, you'll be waiting for your breakfast with everyone else. If you don't want to wait in line for breakfast (like 10-15 minutes), simply wake up earlier. You can always skip the line and get bagels, juice, cereal, etc. with no wait. Don't stay at the Embassy Suites expecting luxurious surroundings, especially when there's an Intercontinental, Ritz and Peninsula within a mile. Yes, noise carries quite well in the building, and there are hotels closer to the heart of the action. However, you get breakfast taken care of every day, can have a couple pops in the afternoon, and the room has two TV's so the kids are happy. Having some patience will definitely help. However, chances are if you are traveling to the big city with kids, you probably already have enough to enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy during the week great”
Reviews.Author: Lecats
Reviews.Content: I had an extended stay at this Embassy. A total of 5 1/2 weeks. During the week it was mainly business people. No long lines at breakfast (6:30am start) or managers reception (5:30 to 7:30pm). Both are 7 days a week. Fairly quiet (if you are high up) except for the emergency vehicle sirens. However, the invasion of children started on Friday nights. Lots of noise and long lines at breakfast and reception. With the atrium the noise rose so it is best to be up on a high floor. There is a washer and dryer on floors 10 & 14 for those longer stays ($1.50 each). However, the walls are paper thin. Speaking, radio, TV and children are very noticable from the next room. Rooms in the corners should be quieter. Also, the beds are hard (at least on floor 13).

Reviews.Title: “not the finest of the Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: aroundtown47
Reviews.Content: There were no real problems with this hotel it was merely a disappointment. I have stayed in various Embassy Suites over the years and have always enjoyed them but this one was nothing special and not the greastest value for your dollar. The concierge was not very helpful or friendly either.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites Lakefront - nice stay”
Reviews.Author: love2gogogo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last night (Sat, Oct 29) for a short family outing to Chicago. Won a bid of $65 each for 2 rooms on Priceline - what a steal! Our family of 4 (two boys 8 & 11) were very satisfied with the accommodations and service, especially given the price, since the cheapest rate offered on the web was $199. We arrived at 1:00, but were told our rooms weren't ready since check-in is at 4. No problem, we wanted to have lunch so we walked to Navy Pier (not as close as I had thought but a nice day for a walk nonetheless) and then over to lunch at Dick's Last Resort on the North Pier. We returned to the hotel at 3:30 and were given 2 adjacent rooms, having requested such. Both rooms were the typical Embassy suite style - separate bedroom, fold-out couch in living room (on the 10th floor) - each bedroom had two double beds. I decided that a King bed would be nicer for hubby & I, so returned to the front desk to ask to be changed, which was kindly accommodated (on the 12th floor). No mention of Priceline either time. Unfortunately when I exchanged room keys, the boys and my husband, waiting in one of the suites, had left some luggage in the other suite. So when I returned with the new room assignment, we had no keys to get in the other room. I found a maid a few doors down and explained. She called the front desk to confirm my story (can't just be letting people into strange rooms you know.) When confirmed the front desk said that security had to let us in and they would be right up. After waiting a few minutes, the maid kindly let me in herself so we wouldn't have to wait longer. Rooms were a contemporary design with modern furniture in nice shape. Rooms were pleasant to look at and comfortable although it was weird that the rooms had a window with shutters looking out onto the hall, but we just closed them. The view not much to look at, not a problem. Nice that the bedroom window opened to let air in. Room was absolutely sound-proof - didn't hear a sound from any other room or floor (except occasional siren outside.) Internet connection was woefully slow so we weren't able to use that - didn't bring it to the hotels attention since we weren't in the room for that much time. At 5:30 we mosied down for free drinks at happy hour and relaxed while the kids swam. Hot tub and pool are nothing fancy - basically a lap pool, but we pretty much had it to ourselves, there was one other family in the pool room. The only minor complaint was that the bartender would only let you take one drink at a time, so hubby and I had to go to bar together or one of us made two trips - silly. But a good deal regardless. There was nachos, cheese sauce and nuts for snacks. No long lines at the bar or for food. We dined at PJ Clarkes in the hotel which we enjoyed - having left the kids at the room checking in via cell phone. Free breakfast the next day was also very good. We arrived at 8:00ish having read horror stories on tripadvisor.com about dreadfully long lines after 9:00. Since it was Sunday there was made-to-order omelets, as well as bacon, sausage, cereal, donuts, juices, fruit, etc. We checked out at 9:30 and there still was no waiting line at breakfast that we had been warned about. Being a weekend, I was surprised that it wasn't busier. Self-parking was $32. Would stay here again, especially at this price given the free happy hour and breakfast - what a great deal. Would be fun to do a "girl friends" trip here. Overall a very nice stay, kids really enjoyed having a suite all to themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Place”
Reviews.Author: PR
Reviews.Content: Because we didn't get much of a family vacation, I told my boys that their first 3 day holiday we would book a trip where ever American had a netsaver. Well, last weekend the Netsaver from Dallas to Chicago was $139. We booked the Lakeshore Embassy suites ($279 a night). First, Chicago is a great place to take the family. There were tons to do. The hotel's location is so-so. It is great if you are interested in the Navy Pier and things on that side of town. You can walk to Navy Pier in 5 minutes. We did that on Saturday. It is quite a ways (about 2.5 miles) from the Museums. We bought a CTA pass that will take you on any train or bus in town. It was $9 a piece for a 2 day pass, but it sure saved on cab fares. The only problem is that the main line (the red line) is about 5 blocks from the hotel. That would not be a big deal unless the weather is bad, which it was on Sunday and Monday. So, if you want a hotel closer to the line, you might look somewhere else. Anyway, we did the Bears game on Sunday...a great way to experience true Chicago. We ate at the typical pizza joints (Gino's East and Giadarnos sp?). The hotel itself is really nice. Getting into it is a little cumbersome. You go into a small lobby on the street level where the bellmen are then take an elevator to the Sky Lobby located on the 6th floor. Then check in. The main lobby is huge and very open with lots of windows. In the main lobby you have the manager's reception at night (mixed drinks, beer, wine, sodas, snacks) and breakfast in the a.m. Breakfast was quite good (omlette station, pancakes, egss, bacon, sausage, hash browns, and assorted pastries and breads). There was a pool and hot tub, but according to my boys (who are like polar bears) the pool was too cold and the hot tub too hot. The rooms are typical Embassy Suite rooms. We booked a corner suite, which was great. We had a view of the lake, which was really nice. My only criticism is the walls are very thin. We could hear our neighbor's radio as well as other entertaining sounds at different points during the night and I am sure they could hear our boys early in the morning. The first night the hotel was packed, but with the Sox playing in the World Series I expected it. So the lines at the happy hour and breakfast were long. The next night and morning were much better. Let me know if you have any questions, but overall a great trip and good hotel.
